Summary: The staff was really rude i called front desk to ask for clean sheets and the guy who answered screen at me saying ‚Äúim telling you the housekeeping team is no longer here‚Äù always had problems with th key to my room i was never able to connect to the internet

Summary Heading: Bad experience and checked out early.
Summary: I stayed only one night because: 1) The carpet had about a dozen 2" spots on the carpet and there were around a half dozen white areas on the carpet between the bathroom door and entry door. I assume the 2" spots were from drinks or food. The white powder could've been cocaine or body powder. It is clear the carpet needs to be cleaned or replaced, 2) Heat was not emitting from the unit. The first thing I did after sitting my luggage down was to make sure the unit was turned to heat. It wasn't so I turned it to High Heat and turned the temp control to warm. I became cool while sleeping. By morning, my fingertips and nose were cold and I was shivering a little, 3) there was a musty smell, 4) The TV didn't work, 5) The third lamp didn't work until I saw the plug on the floor and

Hotel was decent in cleanliness but room was very old looking, headboards were ripped and old. My family stayed 4 nights 3 days and had to request housekeeping MULTIPLE times but they NEVER came to clean our room or bring new towels.

Overall a decent hotel, interesting set up, not sure how to explain besides Disney meets Italian Baroque?  It‚Äôs unique I guess, I‚Äôm not sure how else to explain, I‚Äôve not seen anything like it.    Ok so now the low score is because of the cigarette smoking, marijuana smoking and fentanyl smoking ‚Ä¶so if you smell a weird smell and not sure if it is the plumbing or eggs or ‚Äúsomething‚Äù it‚Äôs probably the new drugs people are smoking which I am guessing is fentanyl and/or crystal meth combo (based on research definitely not personal experience) yes it‚Äôs horrifying, but I have been traveling a lot lately in so-cal, staying in various hotels from 60-150/night and it‚Äôs the same everywhere.  Unless you stay at a 200+ boutique, it seems that everyone is smoking  everything everywhere

Staff are great here, and building is beautiful. Breakfast is decent. You get a buffet style set up. I don‚Äôt know that I can stay here again because of the beds alone. On our first night this particular weekend, the heater was broken, and we froze. The bed was a hammock. Staff were very acommodating and switched us rooms. The next rooms heater worked fine. The beds were TERRIBLE. When I say hammocks, I mean it. There is not support under the mattress. The ‚Äúbox springs‚Äù are actually just a literal spring platform like you would find in a couch bed, but worse. They weren‚Äôt sturdy at all. Forget about sleeping two people on a queen bed. You sink in and roll over each other. Hojo, I have stayed here MANY weekends to enjoy Disneyland, monthly even. But this bed situation BREAKS the

I went to this hotel because my house‚Äôs water was shut off and when I tell you when I checked into my room 30 minutes after I was finished taking a shower and there was knocking on the door and I opened it and there was a worker and he said when are u guys checking out I said 11:00 and he left few minutes later somone was trying to open the door literally but I had the top lock locked and I opened it it was a cleanup lady and I told her why are u trying to open the door and she said it‚Äôs ok it‚Äôs ok and I just saw said good morning to her when I check in and I said stop trying to open the door and she just kept saying it‚Äôs ok it‚Äôs ok like ü§® worst hotel ever never staying there again.

Never book again at this hotel! Front desk staff was rude and not helpful, room smelled awful and the lobby was sloppy and hallways were dirty and smelly. Such a disappointment and we didn‚Äôt stay the second night, we checked in somewhere else!!

The entire hotel had a terrible old mildew, mold smell. Bed were so uncomfortable. We had to check out after one night and find a different hotel. Also don‚Äôt look forward to breakfast we went down at about 8pm on a Friday morning and there was no fruit or breakfast meats. The eggs looked sketchy.

Absolute worst hotel imaginable! Rooms were dirty and moldy. Our car got broken into right after we checked in and nothing was done to help resolve the situation. The paint and wallpaper was all peeled and smelled like dirty diaper and cheap weed. There were children and crackheads running up and down the halls yanking on doors and trying to pry them open. It was literally so bad that I left in the middle of the night! Never would I ever recommend staying here even if it were free!

Summary Heading: DISGUSTING HOTEL. DO NOT STAY HERE.
Summary: I am usually not picky about hotels but this hotel was absolutely disgusting and by far the worst place I have ever stayed at. The lobby is nice but don't let that fool you because the rest of the hotel is an absolute NIGHTMARE. The elevators close to the lobby weren't working during my entire stay so I had to walk all the way to the back of the hotel to use the other elevator. On the day I was checking out, both elevators were broken which resulted in me carrying my luggage down 4 flights of stairs which was a terrible experience. The room itself was absolutely DISGUSTING. There were chip crumbs behind my nightstand, EW! The shower water never got hot, only lukewarm at best. The sink water pressure was off and would splash me every time I turned it on. There were disgusting

Summary: This location should be shut down, exterminated, renovated, increase security before this business takes another reservation!  Homeless people camped out at the entrance of the property, we feared for our safety and the safety of our car each night.  Roaches crawled from behind the tv to behind the mirror and the horrific smell of the room was doing a bad attempt of covering up something bad.  Fragranced funk!  The parking spaces were so narrow that our drivers door was damaged and we know exactly why.

Old building, noisy hard to sleep,  not clean. sole elevator with smelling. I would NEVER go this place,  especially there is NO sound isolation at all. Filth room and bad AC, not a pleasant stay at all,

We booked 2 hotel rooms for 3 nights with Flight Centre (Bad Company) I called them on the first night that we got in to tell them we were running a little behind but we were on our way, the clerk that answered the phone said that the reservation was canceled as they don't guarantee the reservation through 3 party bookers. They said that they had overbooked and needed our room for someone else. They finally gave us a room after I told them I was from Canada and we had nowhere to stay. The room that they stuck us in was absolutely disgusting. The hotel had extremely dirty rooms ( I have pictures) There were stains on the carpets and holes in the walls. The tap in the bathroom would not shut off. The blow dryer did not work. We stayed there for 3 nights and no one came into our

Summary Heading: You will be threatened by the front desk man
Summary: PLEASE DON‚ÄôT GO TO THIS PROPERTY IF YOU‚ÄôRE A WOMAN TRAVELING WITH NO MAN!   We booked our stay for two nights and called to make sure the reservations were correct and if we could check in early. The man on the phone was hanging up on us when I started to panic because our reservation was canceled (we were about 1,000 miles away from home). I was stressed and kept trying to reach out to the hotel and booking.com. Well the guy at the front desk (we found out later) kept hanging up on us because I was stressed on the phone.   Well finally we get the manager on the phone and she gets us a new booking! Unfortunately the madness didn‚Äôt stop here.   My wife and I entered the facility and saw this man we didn‚Äôt want to be helped by him but.. he was ready‚Ä¶  My wife looks to me and asks

Don‚Äôt do it! The hotel is terrible. There was water damage to the first floor so it smelled like mold. The lobby smelled like weed and when we got to our room it smelled like someone smoked a whole pack of cigarettes. We walked in and out. They have smoke free policy and the recommended is moving to a higher floor when we were on the highest floor. There was a line of people also complaining about there rooms like broken A/C and and broken toilets the two girls at the front were sooo rude.

Summary Heading: Worst experience of my life at a hotel
Summary: It was the worst hotel experience of my life the hotel was renovating while we were staying there we changed three rooms and non of them were clean we wasted our money and time and vacation experience. They had broken lamps burnt carpet and even worn off headboards. The first room we got had clogged toilet and hair in the bath tub. We go relocated to a new room from their point of view it was clean but had a floss laying on the floor and the carpets were extremely dirty! Also the ac switch was not working properly. We stayed three nights there they didn‚Äôt clean our room also kept on throwing new policies like ‚Äúwe dont do room service everyday‚Äù And later ‚Äúwe need 24 hours notice for room service‚Äù all of these were not told at the time of check in. Dont waste your time and money

good breakfast, shuttle to Disneyland,friendly staff, clean  I Used hotel points to stay here. The room was clean, breakfast was tasty, free shuttle to Disneyland , friendly staff.I will definetly stay here again

Summary Heading: Good to stay, Great for people who plans to go to Disneypark many days.
Summary: Quality service & room Breakfast is clean warm and good Shuttle to Disneyland is enough Staff all great!! Never see any bugs or roaches Location nearby is Sprouts Organic market that have a lot of great food to add more healthier diet.

Summary Heading: Mold everywhere and they stole my clothes beware of this shady hotel
Summary: This place is going to be in my nightmares! This hotel is the worst place you can stay. I got this hotel through Hotwire for me and my boyfriend to stay for Disneyland. As soon as we get there I noticed everything is rundown and the staff are not even in uniform. We get to our room on the second floor and the mildew smell hit my nose instantly. We look around and we see that there is mold spores in the vent. I was mortified, I went down there to the front desk and changed rooms immediately. When we got into our second room we noticed in less then 5 minutes there are mold spores. We switch rooms again and there are still spores. They switched us to our 4th room on the bottom floor and the room was fine. It still reeked of smoke and there was dust on the furniture. The sink did

I and my son stayed at the Howard Johnson by Wyndham Fullerton Anaheim hotel in room 228 from August 24 to August 31, 2022, the full accommodation was paid through booking sites (AGODA.COM, FindHotel), after our check-out the hotel wrote $453.17 from my card (01/09/22 - $244.69, 14/09/22 - $208.88).1- on what basis was my money recorded? 2- a month has passed, I immediately return my money!!!

Summary Heading: Worse hotel EVER due to SHAWN
Summary: Worse service. I highly advise to avoid this place like a plague. Go next door to Holiday inn Express. My main reason for this hotel was the disrespect Shawn gave me, he was in helpful in EVERY situation possible. My ac didn‚Äôt work, toilet water kept running, roaches everywhere and he didn‚Äôt want to give us the mangers information to contact. He refused to activate a key to get access to our kids medication. Refused to let us get our stuff, let our kids rinse off from the beach. This guy is a disgust person. He definitely has mommy issues to try and control someone at their hotel. Only a low self esteem looser would stoop down to this level. Shawn you are pathetic. Karma will come to you. Providing a picture so you can BEWARE.

The hotel is OLD. It really needs to renovated. Breakfast was okay but no much variety. Room crazily are only clean on the 3rd day not next one which is really disappointing and not sustained. If yo do not mind an old hotel, almost falling apart it is okay. Price too high for the quality of everything.

You know the moment where something is so bad you have to say something?  I‚Äôve stayed at thousands of tels and this is that moment. The moment something was so bad I feel compelled to warn others. I reserved two rooms. One was fine and one smelled like vomit and had a wet floor. I called and asked for a different room. I was informed they didn‚Äôt have any other rooms (even though when I checked in they gave me the options of multiple floors). They offered me a 20% discount and I let them know I could not stay in a room that smelled like vomit. Finally they said they would let me cancel my reservation and do somewhere else. To be clear, I didn‚Äôt want to go somewhere else as my other party was in the hotel in my other reserved room. When I went to find another reservation o checked

Run from this ghetto place.  They have guests under lockdown as if you're in prison by locking all of the doors leading into the hotel 24-7. You are forced to go thru the front door which is a major inconvenience.  Not to mention the numerous homeless people shooting up in their parking lot and deficating in plain view of customers!  Oh. Did I mention their employees case you to see if you're in your room so they can steal from you by knocking on your door at 10:00 at night to ask if you're there?  Creepy place. I regret staying there. Pure DUMP. Please don't bring your kids there. You'll  regret it.

I paid for my room via a third party and when I showed proof to the heavyset girl at the front desk, she said her computer was down. She then took copies of my confirmation number, driver's license and Platinum American Express card. I then left for a few hours thinking everything was ok. When I returned, my adult son, who stayed behind, was sitting outside of the hotel with all of our belongings piled up on the sidewalk! Apparently, the inept woman who helped me earlier decided to call the police because she's too stupid to figure anything out.  They treated my son like a criminal. This was a very traumatic experience and what really gets me is how the manager, Sam, treated the situation.  Ironically, all of the bad actors were "gone" when I returned to the hotel.  No phone

Stayed here with my daughters dance group.  Absolutely gross and customer service is awful.  Room was not cleaned during our entire 4 night stay.  Pool water was green.  Mold in hallway walls and bathroom.  Had to go down daily to get our own towels as there was no service to our room even after requested.  Manager and staff were unprofessional and smirked the whole time when bringing issues to their attention.

The room was not as we expected it was very outdated and smelled like a smoking room. I paid for the room with microwave and fridge, since our stay was 4 nights with kids the fridge did not cool well and the microwave was not clean. The bathroom was dirty, around the toilet and the underneath of sink had what looked like either vomit or some other staining that could have been easily wiped off during routine cleaning, there was some kind of remnant of a spider hanging from the shower area. The pool was cloudy and grey in comparison to the pool on the other side of fence so I was leery of letting kids swim. Our stay was part of a group outing and we all were required to stay in same location. The instructor of course had a nice room but ours and other parents did not. This place

Go to the holiday inn next door this wasn‚Äôt  it for over three hundred for two nights you‚Äôd think it‚Äôd be better then a $60 off the beaten road crap shack but it‚Äôs not, it‚Äôs not clean, no curb appeal, no amenities like they‚Äôre ‚Äútv‚Äù is super outdated I think it was 13 channels app together. Bathroom was just disgusting, no water pressure the sink didnt work, parking was questionable I didn‚Äôt see any security walking the grounds truly could have paid less and gotten more elsewhere

I was looking for an affordable option close to Disneyland and this hotel fit the bill! The room was spacious and clean. The TV had many channels to browse through after a long day at Disneyland.   We were not able to partake in the free breakfast due to having breakfast plans at the park, but it looked decent (bagels, cereal and other items). They also offer a free shuttle to and from Disneyland, which is amazing! That saves you $30 right there!   Staff was friendly and welcoming.   For those of you that complained about the appearance or quality of the hotel, please keep in mind that we booked a budget hotel, not a Hyatt Regency. If you want something in better condition, then allocate the money for it, otherwise, accept the place your budget had chosen.

What a sh**hole!  Call down to the desk to get extra bedding so my son could sleep on the floor. 30 minutes later no bedding and it turns out the guy had brought it to the wrong room. There is only one person on duty for the entire hotel. Finally got the bedding. The next morning they had only left us two bath towels, One of which came with a complementary HAIR on it!  Tried to call down for more towels and even sent my kids down there but there was nobody at the desk!  I had to dry off with a hand towel and my son had to dry off with a sheet he slept in!!  No staff still at the front desk when we left at 6:45!

It wasn‚Äôt how it looked in pictures plus ac didn‚Äôt work at all & we had a baby they even said oh manager never do nothing & they have alot of complains it‚Äôs not worth the cheap things just get a better one

Summary Heading: Need improvement, but sufficient for a couple of nights
Summary: Our Check-in  experience was a breeze around 3-4 PM. The front desk told us that they don't change towels and clean  our rooms unless we requested. As it turned out, we didn't request the rooms to be cleaned at all. We only use the rooms to shower and sleep which probably not more than 10 hours a day. We did request new towels when we came back from Disneyland but they ran out and wasn't able to provide to us later.  Breakfast was minimal. There were eggs, oatmeal, coffee, juice, baked goods, and cereal. That was enough for quick meal before getting something that was more substantial.   The room itself was OK. The two rooms we had were a little different.  One had a new carpet. Bathroom was about the same.  We noticed the wall paper on the hallway came off with mold behind it.

Summary Heading: 4 nights and they never cleaned my room!
Summary: The hotel never cleaned my room. I even called and was told they would clean it the next day. I had to kill a large spider and another insect in the bathroom. There wasn't any ice in the ice machines and the breakfast was subpar. For the amount of money spent, I expected something better than I received. First time in my life staying at hotels where the hotel didn't clean my room, especially after staying there for four nights. This is not what was advertised when I booked the room.

Floors were dirty and stained, no hot water, AC unit did not work, had to request room service, and the manager there was very rude  When I requested a late check out He wanted to bribe us to give him a good Google review in order to get a great check out

No service. Falling down walls.  Broken fixtures.  Unclean poop on toilets for 5 days.  Green pool. Leaky faucet. Lumpy beads. No  cleaning service during our 5day stay.  Reported to front desk the need to clean the room and the leaky faucet but nothing was done over 5 days.  Worse stay ever!

Water damage throughout the hotel.  Visible damage to hallway and guest room with paint bubbled up and peeling; this did not look like recent water damage.    Carpet in the rooms and hall way were sticky, stained and discolored.  The pool area was a mess with a pile of patio furniture stacked messily in the corner.

Staff was great but room was horrible, bathroom was disgusting and TV did not work. Luckly the staff moved us to a better room , overall very dirty hotel. Will not recommend for family's or small children.

For the price this was a fantastic hotel. This hotel is 3.2 miles from Disneyland has a free breakfast has a free shuttle to and from Disneyland has a nice clean comfortable room with very comfortable beds very friendly staff I would highly recommend this to a family who isn't looking to spend or get the most expensive hotel in Anaheim. Just a fantastic hotel for the price only negative was the shower pressure the water pressure in the shower was pretty low but I understand California is in a drought. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Easy check-in/check out, light breakfast of eggs, cereal, muffins, yogurt, oatmeal, etc. Older hotel hidden behind Holiday Inn, but the room was clean and the staff was great. I would have appreciated a microwave and mini fridge for leftovers from dinner, but all-in-all‚Ä¶nice place for a good price.

The staff were all extremely nice & helpful. They were willing to hold our luggage prior to check in and after check out. That helped us out a lot since our flight did not leave until 11pm that night. The only down fall was that the shuttle for Disneyland was only available from Thursday through the weekend. Wish we would have known about that sooner since we had depended on the shuttle. Overall, not bad of a stay.

Summary Heading: Never again will I stay at this brand of hotels
Summary: Pictures are not accurate, this place is dirty,unsanitary, lousy , noisy, grimy, felt like I was in the 1970‚Äôs roach motel !! I will never recommend this brand of hotels to anyone I know. I had to play Plummer with the toilet every use, they don‚Äôt clean this hotel daily. Carpet is so dirty my new socks out of the package got super dirty in the morning. Eghhhhh spend the extra$$ of better treating yourself for sure.

We booked this hotel for our vacation but it was a big mistake. The front desk clerk Sean was rude and actually had a yelling match with my daughter because we were asking for more towels after the 3rd day there. We tried explaining over the phone that we didn't have hot water in the shower but he hung up on us. When we went down to the lobby to explain the problem he was very rude and started to yell at my daughter saying that she was the one being rude and just wanted to cause problems. Coincidentally our rooms were broken into the next night and alot of our personal belongings were stolen. And don't count on the  security worker on site. He was too busy playing video games when we showed him the video of our room to care.  So if you're planning on staying there please don't!!!

Summary Heading: Bizarro details and surreal Twin Peaks ambience
Summary: Snarky night clerk - not just to us. He couldn't - or wouldn't? - provide a time frame for water shutoff less than 24 hours.    Public areas are decorated with elaborate Chinese furnishings and statues, including two large tusks, (no sign of HoJo colors) sprinkled with Disney art and offset by cracked and peeling wallpaper, rumpled carpet, and safety cones for the hallway plumbing repairs. Did I mention, some outward facing rooms had broken windows?  Breakfast only, all chairs in dining area faced in the same direction like it was a classroom for ghosts.  The room: thin blanket, foot-high hard square pillows, one duvet for two beds, no duvet cover. Scarred wallpaper, uneven red curtain - half-expected a small man to come dancing out of it a la Twin Peaks.  He didn't, but we were

Summary Heading: Nasty smells rooms not clean so gross
Summary: Very disappointed in this hotel I‚Äôve have stayed at this hotel and the one next to it the one next to it is an eight tour this one is a two when it comes to cleanliness odor overall fill all together. I feel this hotel could be beautiful if it had the correct cleanliness to it.

This hotel was a good deal but the property is older and requires some repairs. It was nice that it was close to Disneyland and Knotts Berry Farm with shuttle service. Complimentary breakfast was pretty good but could use a few enhancements.

Worst booking and was my very first time to actually walk out and staying elsewhere and I am not a picky person at all. It was just failing to meet basic expectations as per cleanliness and overall room appearance.

This hotel in filthy, broken items in the room, the carpet is very dirty. I would not advise anyone to stay in this hotel. I left a message for the manager to call me and I have never received a call.

I chose this facility because it is less than 3 miles down the road from the house out of town friends had rented for our Disneyland trip. This is probably one of the worst hotels I have stayed in. The photos online are very deceiving because my room looked NOTHING like the ones online. The room had an odd musty smell and strange burn looking marks all over the mirror in the bathroom, it wasn't very clean, the light switches had holes around the face plates, furniture looked very old and outdated and I did not feel comfortable even walking without shoes on in the room. The walls and all of the light switches were very dirty. I was hopeful when walking into the lobby and very quickly disappointed when arriving to my room. I would say the only plus to staying here was the free

over all just a crappy hotel, I booked it by mistake, was supposed to be at a different location. Not sure what happened. The room smelled terrible, no cleaning service, front desk was not helpful. Breakfast was not even food, disgusting.

Summary Heading: Not the worse, certainly not the best
Summary: There are a lot of things that could be better about this place, but if you can make the best of your situations, this may be the spot for you.  The breakfast was good, the room smelled funny, hairs on the bed, it just didn‚Äôt feel clean.  We‚Äôve had worst experiences, so we always travel prepared, but you shouldn‚Äôt have to right?

I would save your money and pony up a little bit more for a nicer hotel. The pictures of this resort do not do it justice it looks nice and well-kept and pictures but you get in there and just anything other than that it is old, outdated, dirty and falling apart. Our room smelled musty, there were hairs left on the clean washed towels. The continental breakfast or lack there of consisted of eggs, the heels of bread and dried croissants. The shuttle broke down and was not fixed within the stated time I know other resolution was offered. All in all the amenities that we chose this hotel for were the biggest disappointments.

We are staying right now here, we asked yesterday for housekeeping to be done today, we asked in the morning again to do housekeeping, the name of the person in the front desk was BLANCA she said to us that it will be done but it seemed she had no interest at all and was in a bad mood.  We arrived in the night and the room was not done at all.  So we asked that the room be done for the Third time but there was no housekeeping.  The room really needed to be clean and the trash to be taken out since we are staying with two small kids.  So it is not nice to arrive after a long day very tired and the room not to be clean.  The hotel is old, it does not look clean, there is no good service.   Please attention to the lady named BLanca, she has no costumer service attitude, she should

Worst hotel experience I've ever had. This hotel doesn't deserve even a one star.  The building is so old. The room smells terrible; something like mold or something. We had to spray the room with perfum to bear the smell in order to sleep. It's coming from the walls/paint.  Then came the breakfast; which was the worst hotel breakfast experience I've ever had. There were no options to choose from; only wheat toast was provided with only butter as spread; no cheese no nothing. There was nothing else. No fruits. They only had fat free milk and nothing else.  The springy mattress was also uncomfortable. The AC/Heat unit is an old one that's noisy and not automatic; you can not set a temperature and you have to leave it on all night if you need it.

Summary Heading: Do not spend your money here.
Summary: The experience in this hotel is one of the worst I had by far.   Management is not efficient, rooms smell like dust, air vents in the restroom do not work, hair on the floor, wifi is poor, stains on the walls, it really looks horrible, elevators sound as if they are going to break.   Please do yourself a favor and avoid the regret you will have later for choosing this hotel.

Clean place spacious, chill friendly staff , only wished they had a tv guide for the channels, but everything else was great ,alot restaurant and stores around and cool bar next door, good place to stay!

I was amazed at the low room cost.  It fit our budget allowing us to spend money on fun things on our trip.  The rooms were super clean, I made sure to inspect everything closely before bringing in my belongings.  The rooms were quiet.  However, keep in mind we had no mini fridge or microwave so we had to buy food each day we were there.  The breakfast was included in the room rate, though it had very minimal options.   Distance to Disneyland was about an 11 minute drive.  The parking at Howard Johnson was free while staying here.  They also provide a shuttle to and from the parks on the weekends.  I will definitely be coming back again when I go to Disneyland.   Oh, also...there is a gas station on the corner of the street, very convenient for a quick fill up and snack run.

I wanted an affordable place to stay near Disneyland and found this gem.  It‚Äôs located in Fullerton and has easy access to shops, restaurants and public transportation to Disneyland and the Fullerton Transportation Center. The rooms are clean and comfortable. I highly recommend this place!

This hotel has fallen down after Covid closure. It is not the same it looks and smells dirty. The elevator takes for ever to get up and down. The breakfast menu is very minimal and not tasty at all. üò≠

Summary Heading: Our toilet kept clogging during our whole stay.  Maintenance did  come, but they  are n ot plumbers and it kept clogging
Summary: The front desk staff are exceptional and keep the hotel running smooth to the extent possible.  Parking is limited.  Stay in building 1 (inside rooms) and view over park/fireworks.  The room is clean, but it's like a basic hotel room from the  1970s but a bit upgraded.  It's one of the closest hotels to Disneyland Park where you can walk and not be in an outside room like the other hotels on this strip if you stay in building one.  The hotel should have called a plumber for the toilet since the problem repeated each day which I requested and they did not.  They used regular maintenance.  Also, the pillows are very poor.  Hard to sleep.  Bring your own.

Everyone was nice. The bedroom was very comfortable, large size bed, TV, hot water. No mini fridge in the bedroom. The breakfast was included and good enough. There was always parking spaces available.

Summary Heading: Run Down, Dirty and Clueless Staff
Summary: Run Down, Dirty and Clueless Staff.  Toilet didn't work.  Room had missing ceiling pieces, missing tile, faucet leaked, toilet leaked.  Continental breakfast was terrible.  Overcooked eggs, overcooked sausages, cheap muffins from Costco.  This hotel should be rated as a 1 star motel!

I was worried  about this stay because of the reviews but I personally thought the stay was fine  i got a room on the 4th floor the beds are small usually you would get a queen size these seemed like a twin/full bed and they do weirdly hang off the base of the bed ...it is under construction which wasn't really visible  but my only problem was that there wasn't a mini fridge I've stayed in multiple hotels and this is the first one w/out a fridge .. would stay again if it was my last option

The stay was fine. Only real complaint I have is that the room as soon as I walked in it smelled like cigarettes and it was so strong. There was someone  knocking at my door at 6am but not sure who.Other than that it was nice

Bad place - nasty room - rude manager - not clean room - smells so bad - manager disrespectful , he doesn‚Äôt know how to treat his guest - the place not healthy place to stay - restroom nasty , bed not clean , light broken , air conditioner not working goid

What I was really disappointing was the cleanliness and upkeep of the room. The room had a musty smell. The carpeted floor is extremely dusty, even the cabinet and curtains are super dusty. Breakfast was the WORST we have had. The strange woman knoked my room door. Terrible place, never stay!

Summary Heading: I will not recommend this place to my friends
Summary: I was disappointed with this place I should have spend the extra $100 and stay with my friends at the Double tree. That hotel was nice. I will not recommend this hotel and it seemed like other thing were going on in other rooms. I heard stuff

Despite all the hotels are opening from lockdown. I love all the staff here. They do their best to operate this place and provide customer care. They are all super nice and accommodating. I see them work very hard to make sure we are all happy and comfortable with our stay. I would not want to stay anywhere, because of the service and staff are Literally the best in any hotel in the county. I really Appreciate William, Marlene, Cy and the other supervisor, I wish I knew her name. But they are truly amazing.

This place used to be clean not sure what happened. Nasty place now. The carpet needs a good cleaning the elevator needs a mop. I used to like staying here but I guess because everyone likes to use covid as an excuse means they can‚Äôt clean.

Never staying here again. I will gladly pay more somewhere else than here. I had to tolerate a weird smell and the phone ringing in my room all day and night and I got a room I didn‚Äôt even ask for!!!! I wish I can get my money back. I will for sure tell my family and friends to neved stay here.

It took 45 minutes for us to check in I came 1 hour earlier and was refused to check in at that time. We had no couch or extra chair in our room. There was no hand sanitizer available at the front desk

The rooms are outdated and staff had a hard time checking people in. The breakfast was weird because of the limited items such as scrambled eggs and noodles. The wifi only worked in the lobby and not in the rooms.

PROS; comfortable bed , AC worked , Good location  CONS; lobby not very clean, hallways and stair well had trash in them and the rooms could use some repairs. The staff take more pride in the work place

This place was filthy.  It also had graffiti on the building and the Disneyland transportation van.  I checked into 2 different rooms to find the 2nd was even more dirty than the first.  The WiFi was only available in the lobby based on a sign at the front desk.  The ac units smelt horribly moldy.  Hair in the room in multiple places.  Dirt smeared on the bathroom wall and shower.

At first check in got greeted with hotel staff yelling at a guest about her kids running all over the place. Not to mention the old smell when you first walk in. The rooms also had this terrible smoke smell which I requested a non smoking room. Carpet of room was disgusting. Stains all over the carpet and it looked like it hadn‚Äôt been vacuumed for months. Walls and scratch marks and paint peeling. Lamp inside room was broken. I was afraid to even lay on the bed knowing how filthy everything was. In listing claimed free breakfast. The breakfast was a ziplock bag with 2 Costco pastries and a juice box. Would never stay at this hotel chain again.

Not disabled friendly   No restaurant on site had to pay extra money to door Dash food. Not clean, and the staff was not very knowledgeable or friendly Motel 6 would have probably been better then that. Waste ur money and time

It turned out better than expected, they just reopened and the staff did an amazing job transitioning back to a running hotel. The staff is super sweet and accommodating, we felt very welcomed and tended too. Wish we could of stayed longer.

Summary Heading: "Pandemic" is not another word for "Cut-back" or "budget-cuts"
Summary: The phone doesn't work at this property, so when I called the HQ to confirm free shuttle and hot breakfast during the pandemic, they confirmed this is still relevant, hence to reasons why I choose this property. The shuttle was not running, during 4th of July UNTIL enough customers complained and the hot breakfast was a packaged muffin and warm OJ in a bag.

Ideally this would not be a hotel I would stay at. However, this was the location picked for a wedding block.   Rates online were much higher than booking over the phone. I highly suggest to call to book for the best possible rate. I ended up getting the room at $89/night. However the price is not worth 2 double beds.‚Ä®‚Ä®  After a smooth check in process with Blanca we were taken to what was considered a clean room. Upon entry, we were bombarded with the stench of cigarette smoke. There were sheets and towels on the floor and marks on the wall. It was as if they forgot that they were cleaning the room.‚Ä®‚Ä®We quickly went downstairs to complain and immediately upgraded to a 2 queen bed deluxe with a pool view. Blanca was efficient and understanding. Our second room was much better.

The King Suite is not a Suite at all...no separate bedroom or special amenities ...the only perk for a King Suite is its location with a pool view.  In addition, the rates at the facility are different than those given online and by its phone representatives...be sure to check rates online and call the hotel directly for the best deals.

My kids didn't feel comfortable and when they're actually saying something bad I knew the place was a poor choice.  We just felt the room was old and dirty.  Furniture looked so used and walls looked worn out. It was one of our worst looking rooms ever. I would not recommend coming here unless you just need a bed to sleep on.  Our beds were fine. I slept well at least.

Staff were very friendly & accommodating to our families needs including late checkout with fees waived, delivered a bar fridge to our room, house keeping did a great job of cleaning our rooms daily.  The breakfast was simple but delicious.  The hotel is within short walking distance to a variety of eatery's, shopping outlets & access to disneyland was easy with the regular & free daily shuttle services to & from. We would stay here again. It was comfortable, easy access & affordable. Best part is the hotels gift shop, they have everything a traveller needs.

We just made our check in and Emanuel and Blanca at the front desk were very polite e friendly. Great staff makes a big difference!!! We booked a double bed room and so far the room seems quiet and has a very confortable bed. The hotel has free parking that is a plus!!!

Summary Heading: A great place to stay if your out of the hotel most of the time
Summary: Based on previous reviews, I was a bit worried about booking this place . This was a trip where I just needed a place to crash, as we would be at Disneyland most of the day. I‚Äôll be honest, when I walked into our room, I was initially disappointed. It had a strong odour of chemical cleaner, and the state of the room is described well by previous reviews . This is no five star, or even three stars.  The shuttle to the park does not operate during the afternoon, so If you want to get to the park, Uber is the way to go. It cost anywhere from $9-11 each way. The customer service is what won this place for me. I left feeling satisfied . And to be honest, it‚Äôs a great value for what you are paying . The breakfast is basic, but it gets the job done . If your a picky person, this is not

Came all the way from australia for a holiday and after a massive 5 days we must give a big Thank you to Emanuel for the complimentary late checkout of 4pm with having two kids to organise this was the greatest gift Thank you so much

Came all the way from Australia for a 5 day adventure filled, non stop holiday with my wonderful sister in law and two daughters, hotel staff Blanca and Dulce were very welcoming and helped us with all our questions  We had a wonderful time away and the hotel was close to everything we needed including the free shuttle to Disneyland üé°üé¢‚úàÔ∏èüòäüåØ

Dulce was really thoughtful explaining the shuttle and hotel services. She also mention an upgrade promotion and we got a better room and beds. We also got a mini fridge which was super conveniente since we had 2 little ones traveling with us. The hotel is well located with a bear by Walmart, target and Sprouts.

This place is absolutely disgusting. It is NOT a 3 star hotel. We felt very deceived and lied to. It‚Äôs dirty and runned down. There is a lack of care and excellence all through out the hotel. Our room was dirty, smelly and old. The heater smelled of mildew. Our sheets had stains, things were broken, the carpet was stained dirty and very old. There is either dirt marks or stains all through the hallways and doors. We checked the same day we checked in. When my husband and I think of this place and our stay we shudder and say YUCK

From checking in, deposit, room comfort, bed heaven, quiet sleep, breakfast and easy checkout... I would definitely stay here again. Thank you for making our stay comfortable and enjoyable. Plus the free shuttle!!!

Summary Heading: Very Dated and Extra Charges for Complimentary Breakfast
Summary: When entering the room, it had a distinct odor. The walls in the room show wear and tear, and the amenities were limited. There were only 1 or 2 available outlets for charging phones and devices, and they were in hard to reach places. In addition, complimentary breakfast was not ‚Äúcomplimentary.‚Äù I was asked to pay extra for my spouse and children. This was the first time I have been asked by a hotel to pay extra for advertised complimentary breakfast.

The stay was everything I expected clean room was big outside patio and close to local stores. Would stay there anytime and would recommend to anyone In The area. I didn‚Äôt have time to enjoy the pool area so for next time I will make a stop for a swim. Thank you for e warm welcome

This is the 2nd time I have booked her. The front desk people are very friendly and give you all the information you need. Check in was fast and easy. When I call to add a fridge to my room within 5 mins they were knocking on my door. ($10 per stay for mini fridge). The breakfast is simple but filling, eggs, potatoes, cereal, pancakes, toast, biscuit n gravy, juice, and coffee which is also free. PLUS you can‚Äôt beat the FREE Disneyland shuttle thru out the day. I recommend this hotel. Very close to the freeways, restaurants, stores.

Came here for a family trip and only booked for sunday until wednesday. We decided to come on saturday and book the same hotel, and i asked the staff if we can keep the same room since we were going to be coming back the next day. When i booked online i only book it for 2 adults but when i got to the front desk i told them it was two adults and 2 kids. They were nice enough to help us with booking the same room and didnt charge us extra. Great service. Def recommend.

Great front desk staff! Accomodating and kind. Here for work and the staff helped us work out issues with room arrangements, got our group everything they needed and were kind and positive even though we bothered them a lot!

Blanca was amazing help! The rooms are clean and big. They need to update the carpet, but other than that it‚Äôs a good place to stay. They also have a shuttle to Disneyland. Got a fridge included in our room! Thank you!

Summary Heading: Good location and value for money
Summary: Good choice and good for value. Especially when you stay in a few days. Very convenient with Target, Walmart and shopping in walking distance   Parking free in a big hotel parking area. Located on I-91 freeway near 57 and I-5 freeway too

Good stay, we enjoyed the complimentary shuttle. Liked the breakfast setup just thought the actual food was not all that great. It was alright but not super flavorful. Overall I cannot complain. Worked out well!

Summary Heading: you get what you pay for!
Summary: We booked a last minute trip to California and got a really good deal on a flight and hotel package. It said the hotel was a 3 star. I wouldn't classify this as a 3 star. We had very pleasant staff encounters throughout our stay. We had no issues with check-in, wifi always worked, we used the free shuttle and free parking. There was also free breakfast, which we only used once but it wasn't too bad. I see some bad comments regarding breakfast, but it honestly had a good selection, the hot food was actually hot and it didn't taste that bad. There was lots of free parking when we were there. However, the building overall is outdated, especially the room! The carpets were gross, the furniture extremely outdated and beaten up and barely any lightening. The water pressure in the

Summary Heading: It should say come take a bath with a bowl
Summary: I dont take time to see damages in hotels, however from now on I will.  It was supposed to be a stay to facilitate my quick departure in the morning until I went to take a bathe and didn't works the key to open the shower ... I had to waste time filling the tub and pouring water with the ice container to  fix my problem. I got so angry that I will never come back.

This hotel is in dire need of room renovations.  Our room was outdated and needed an upgrade.  The ceiling was peeling, the carpet very old (you didn't want to go bare foot trust me) the electrical outlets were coming out of the walls.

The biggest problem inexpensive hotels have is the type of guests that stay there.  They don't respect much and therefore beat up the rooms.  Our room was clean but needed a lot of maintenance.  There was a hole in the wall and the walls looked marked and dirty.  Breakfast was good, especially for the price.  Be prepared to use Uber to get to the park.  The shuttle is small, crowded and runs to a strict schedule that doesn't work well with park closing, fireworks and shows.  It is free, so that's a big plus.  If they change the schedule a small amount and run more during popular times this would be a great improvement.  If you're on a strict budget this hotel will work as long as you aren't looking for much.  With some maintenance it would be a great value.

Unless you want a dirty, cockroach room with a moldy bathroom and a bed that folds in the middle and horrible food, then stay somewhere else!  Had to use points to get a good rate and wish I had known I would use points for a horrible stay.  I‚Äôm so embarrassed that I booked our family stay here for the holidays.

Overall it was not a bad stay. I would go back there. But the breakfast wasn‚Äôt too amazing, there was little to no variety, which is unfortunate. The rooms walls could‚Äôve been cleaned better. However, service was good.

I had my expectations fairly low but I was surprised, my family didn‚Äôt like the breakfast but for most it would be nice. The rooms were clean and spacious but if I was to leave it at one sentence I would say you get what you ask for.

The night we checked in, I asked for a roll away bed multiple times  and each times I called or even went to the front desk in person, I was told it will be coming soon. I think the front desk clerk (I think his name is Sahir) just wanted me to go away so he told me what I wanted to hear. The roll away bed never came and I fell asleep ion the chair. The next morning I had a terrible stiff neck!

I had a long day at Knotts Berry Farm and was looking forward to sleeping. When I arrived at the hotel there was very little parking due to a party being held in the main ball room. The front desk was nice and fast and the party didn‚Äôt affect my stay at all. Had a good nights rest and the next morning I had a good free breakfast. The water pressure in the shower was a little low, but other then that it was a good stay.

Summary Heading: A low cost option to Disneyland
Summary: We saved a ton of money staying here as opposed to other places in the area. They provide a full breakfast. On weekdays it is juice, cereal, different breads, eggs, breakfast potatoes, biscuits and gravy, fried rice, and pancakes. On weekends they replace the pancakes with breakfast sausage. The hotel is clean and the morning shuttle driver is amazing. The beds could use some updating as they slump into the middle. Also don't count on the WiFi as being reliable. But seeing as we were there to visit Disneyland, we had a free breakfast, free shuttle service, and free parking on the property. Definitely helped reduce unneeded costs that often are associated with a Disneyland trip.

price was right, you get what you pay for. I have stayed there twice. Hall ways are run down. Internet was terrible.Mattress was soft and could use a replacement.Got checked in early. Breakfast was good, Room was nice..Shuttle rides were fine except they play loud music.Shuttle hours have a gap from after 11am nothing till after 5pm.

The hotel is very clean and comfortable.   The people at check in were professional and courteous. The  rooms have windows that open with no screens.  Mine was stuck open and hard to close.  My room faced the expressway and was very noisy.  At breakfast.  They could not keep up and ran out of eggs.   They had to send someone to get more.  No meat was offered.  More thought could have been put into the buffet.  There is plenty of parking even for larger vehicles.  Not sure about semi trucks.

Run down, weird smell, lights in room flicker, they do have complimentary breakfast, staff was nice but would not go back. On check-in they ended up charging me twice, still waiting on them to fix this issue.

Summary Heading: Outdated, run down, but does the job.
Summary: This place probably ceased being a viable conference center 20 years ago. Very run down & shabby, peeling paint, gross ceilings, but beds & rooms were comfy. Free shuttle to Disneyland & low prices were what drew us as our trip was kind of last minute and all the hotels closer to the park were either sold out or had inflated prices. Breakfast barely worth eating, we actually skipped breakfast on the 3rd morning because we couldn‚Äôt stomach it again after 2 days. Definitely won‚Äôt be staying here again.

Summary Heading: Unacceptable About Sums It All!  The Epidemy Of Terrible Service And Poor Value.
Summary: Unfortunately the don‚Äôt have ratings going in the minus! Tried emailing and phoning several times prior to arrival to inquire about accommodating my disability. The front desk NEVER answered after being on the phone for 15-20 listening to music on three different occasions and different times of day. Emails were equally ignored.  ‚Ä®‚Ä®Upon arrival I was helped by a man, who was not only new and uninformed, he was also rude and arrogant. Instead of saying ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not sure let me ask‚Äù  rather than admit he doesn‚Äôt know, he said we don‚Äôt have it! He ended up telling me ‚Äúthis hotel doesn‚Äôt adhere to the Americans With Disabilities Act‚Äù! I did t know that was a choice.‚Ä®‚Ä®  The hotel is in terrible disrepair and is undergoing construction which they don‚Äôt bother to warn guests about on their

Many issues from checking in maintenance repairs never resolved outlet in bathroom ac not working tv channels not working breakfast was terrible ate only once there. I would recommend staying elsewhere

This hotel was quite inexpensive and they actually had a free shuttle to and from Disneyland which was a great surprise!  The curtains in the room didn't close all the way, and maintenance arrived promptly to fix the problem, but a binder clip from the front desk solved the problem quickly.  The breakfast wasn't bad and had a decent selection of hot foods that you don't normally find at other hotel breakfasts.  The staff was all friendly.  The internet was unusable.

Summary Heading: If I‚Äôd Only Read The Reviews
Summary: If I‚Äôd only read the reviews we would never have stayed there.  Everything negative is true.  Cockroaches in room( absolutely disgusting, spend last 30 days in different hotels in USA and this was the first and only with cockroaches), badly cracked bathroom basin, noisey rooms from highway (needed ear plugs to sleep). Appalling internet speed unusable most of the time.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for, bad sleep
Summary: Hallways have no AC and bathrooms aren't very clean. Noisy room if room is facing the freeway.  Had to change room in the middle of the night. Breakfast room is very limited as to what they offer and it's was dirty.

Bad internet, even cannot have a smooth video conference with my colleague and boss. Staffs did not willing to offer help, I have to run multiple time to the front desk to ask them and explained my situation again and again, but they did not show they care or having any understanding. I will not recommend this hotel to anyone, especially for the business trip, even the hotel description sounds they are so professional on business service. You will feel despair when the problems has effect on your business or your job, and no one care when you looking for the help.

Summary Heading: Better Than A Motel But Not Much
Summary: For the price I guess I cant be picky but staying on the second floor the hallway had lamps with dead flies, muggy air and taped up ventilation.  The Bed was extremely hard and was broken. The room smelled of icy hot. The TV listing boasted a large listing of options, maybe 10 channels worked.  Cleaning staff put a do not disturb sign on our door the 2nd day to avoid cleaning the room.  The main positive was the breakfast and the proximity to the freeway and attractions but definitely going to spend the extra $20 next time to stay somewhere else

I reserved this hotel for two days to attend Disneyland.  When I entered the room it was infested with roaches.  I no longer wanted to stay at this hotel which was a valid reason.  The hotel staff refused to refund my money.

Would not recommend only part of hotel that was decent was check in area everything else very run down manager never available poor rooms needs total updating would not recommend this hotel better to pay extra and stay at a nice place

Summary Heading: Awesome value with a gorgeous pool!
Summary: Very happy with the accommodations and the service. The room was large and the pool access off the slider was awesome. Five star sparkling pool! Plenty of both shade and sun with cushioned chase and pool towels available. The breakfast could be better but it is still an added bonus with eggs sausage pancakes and a variety of cereal too making the stay overall a great value and deserving of a thumbs up!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review of our hotel.¬†We are pleased to hear you enjoyed your stay with us.¬†It's something our staff takes great pride in, so we value your feedback. We are currently working to make enhancements to deliver a more comfortable stay for all of our guests and we hope you will visit us again.

Summary: Place is outdated, walls can use some work, restrooms can use some work. For the value it was ok but is not a 3 star hotel as advertised. 15 minutes drive to disney but they have free shuttle service and free parking
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We understand and apologize for the inconvenience caused by the hotel conditions. We are currently working to make enhancements to deliver a more comfortable stay for all of our guests.  We hope for the opportunity to accommodate you the next time you are in the area.

Summary: Overall the room was great. Comfy bed and quiet place to sleep too. Would recommend this place to friends and family. Staff was also friendly and helpful. Internet connection wasn't that great at all however.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review of our hotel.¬†We are pleased to hear you enjoyed your stay with us.¬†It's something our staff takes great pride in, so we value your feedback and we would work on improving internet-connections. We are currently working to make enhancements to deliver a more comfortable stay for all of our guests and we hope you will visit us again.

Summary Heading: Not nearly as bad as some of the reviews
Summary: I did not choose this hotel, as I used  a 3rd party "mystery" hotel option, when it was revealed to be the Hojo in Fullerton I thought about just eating my original booking and finding somewhere else, I was glad that I did'nt.  The Hojo is older and does need some renos soon but for now it is fine, My room was clean, no bugs, no hairs, no smell , the AC worked very well and the bathroom/shower were older but worked great.  The pool is actually very nice (but there is no hot tub)  Breakfast is good but it is the same thing everyday Scrambled eggs, potatoes, rice, pancakes, some fruit and toast and muffins.  While there was no meat it is much better than most of the Anaheim area hotels.  There were stains and scuff marks in the hallways, the wifi is terrible, and the the windows
Manager Response: Thank you for your candid review. We apologize that your recent stay did not meet your overall satisfactions. We appreciate your comments and will share these with our team so that we can continue to improve our services. We are currently working to make enhancements to deliver a more comfortable stay for all of our guests. We do hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back in the future, so that we can provide a better experience.

Summary: The staff was very unhelpful and not friendly. Because the hairdryer in my room is not working, I asked the staff in the front desk to borrow me another, he replied, No, I don't have now, maybe we can borrow you one in the morning. I asked may I use any other empty room's hairdryer for 5 minutes to blow dry my hair?  he replied, I'm afraid not. I asked is there any other way to help me?  he replied, I'm afraid not. So I have to wait an hour to let my hair dry in midnight then sleep.
Manager Response: Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We apologize for the inconveniences you faced during your stay, as that is not up to our normal standards. We will share your feedback with our staff and make the necessary changes. We are currently working to make enhancements to deliver a more comfortable stay for all of our guests.  We hope you choose to stay with us again, so we can show you our true level of service.

Summary: We were pleased with the relatively quiet air conditioner and environment. We stayed in two different rooms during our stay. I was disappointed in the first room that it didn't have a refrigerator or microwave. The second room did have a refrigerator but still no microwave. To be fair it wasn't advertised to have a microwave. The bed was comfy, and there were plenty of towels.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We are pleased to hear you enjoyed your stay with us.¬†It's something our staff takes great pride in, so we value your feedback. We understand and apologize for the inconvenience caused by the in-room amenities. We are currently working to make enhancements to deliver a more comfortable stay for all of our guests.  We hope for the opportunity to accommodate you the next time you are in the area.

Summary Heading: Bad experience and a haggling GM
Summary: Made a reservation a month before the stay.  Upon arrival  I was notified that there would be a night with no power (no A/C).   Apparently I could have relocated to another property without penalties but no one ever told me.  So I stayed as it was to late to look for another reasonable hotel.   During the night of the power outage it was hot and humid and the utility trucks were parked below out windows.  Noise all night long.  Could not sleep.   Also the external doors were not secure so anyone can come in.   Discusses with GM and he offered 30% discount so I agreed.  At check out instead of 30% for the stay it was for one night.   Very unhappy with with the management!   Cheap and haggling.     Will never stay again to say the least!
Manager Response: Dear Anthony,  Thank you for choosing Howard Johnson and for taking the time to provide feedback about your experience with us.  We would like to start by apologizing to you for not meeting your expectations. We are accommodating with our limited resources due to the power outage with SCE for that one particular night that it was occurred and has inconvenienced you. During our discussion with our Manager, we have made explainable yet clear that the night that you were inconvenienced would be given a discount, which your concerns of the inconvenience die not apply to other nights you have stayed, and the amount of your expected service recovery was beyond the situation that we have agreed upon. We respected your feedback as a guest of us and we did not mean to made your choice of staying or cancelling as difficult as possible, since our business was also dealing with the difficult situation of being interrupted by the power outage that was given us a short notice for.    We strive to make each stay as pleasant and comfortable as possible, and we will use your comments to coach our team in order to provide a better experience in the future. Our security Team was on-duty every night that we would be able to handle any concerns regarding safety for all of our guests staying with us. If there's any assistance needed, we are here 24/7 to assist while you are staying with us.  Please note that the service recovery for the inconvenience for the night that you are not satisfied with has been provided with our sincere respect towards the inconvenience that we did not intend to involve you for if it is not necessary. No additional discount would be offered at this time of communication. We hope you will stay with us again to show you that your unsatisfactory stay was an exception.

Summary: Smelt bad, found hairs and dirty sheets.. the photographs online don‚Äôt do justice to the real property.  I addressed my concerns to staff on site and they did not do anything.  I would rather spend an extra 20 dollars and stay somewhere better

Easy check in and check out.  Nice staff and clean comfy rooms.  Nose is low abs club is right  next door.  Will stay here again. Recommend staying advice 2nd floor nursery bc of the layout Perlas are passing by all the time,  which isn't a big deal but I'm weird like that

Staff were amazing and location is good. They have a shuttle to/from Disneyland. The room I stayed needed some repairs and needs an update. Other than that, this is an amazing hotel! The pool is nice with tables and chairs to eat. The little store is inexpensive which is a nice. I would stay there again.

My family of 5 has stayed at this hotel at least 10 times over a 4 year period. The location is easy 5 min drive from Knotts Berry Farm and offers a free shuttle to Disneyland. The hotel grounds and lobby are nicely maintained. And the hotel has plenty of free parking with no resort fees. Down the street to the north is Target (grocery / clothes etc)  In & out burger, taco bell, korean bbq, frozen yogurt and more places to eat. The hotel can give you a printed map of the area.  The rooms are clean, but do need cosmetic updates (but for the price and value do you really care!?) .  The beds are full size - mattress are soft but the pillows are very flat so housekeeping usually folds them in half to make them more fluffy. FYI bring your own pillow, so you get a good sleep. The

Great location, next to a shopping center and restaurants just a few minutes away. Incase you forget something for your trip you have Target next door. Great customer service from the hotel and the employees as well.

Didn't like the fact you  have to pay extra for guest's breakfast.  I made a goof and said only 1 guest for reservation.  They wouldn't let me change when  we checked in and said i would have to pay $7.00 per person a day!! Not to mention the breakfast isn't worth the $7.00. Would not recommend.  Rooms smelt like smoke and stuffy.

You get what you pay for.  It felt like staying at a motel.  However, this place is perfect for the low budget traveler who just needs to just sleep and leave. I'm not sure why some appliances including the phone, alarm clock were all unplugged.  On a positive note, the front desk staff were friendly.

We stayed at this motel multiple times. This last time was the worst. We stayed 3 nights. On our last day we went to Disneyland for the entire day. We left on Saturday morning June 29th around 8 am. We returned at almost midnight. When I walked into my room I noticed my Apple Watch charger was not on the bathroom counter as I left it. I asked my husband if he moved it. Upon further inspection I realized both our Apple Watch chargers were gone, our phone chargers were gone and my brand new IPad Air was gone. I had the IPad in a drawer. Also they took two of our phone chargers. My purse was on the floor. I looked to see what was missing. My kindle, eye glasses and car keys were taken. They did not take my wallet that had money and credit cards in it. We called the police to do a
Manager Response: Greetings Ms. Jessica Phillips,   Thank you for your feedback on Yelp and TripAdvisor. We understand and apologize for the inconvenience caused by the incident happened during your stays, which we has assisted immediately but our Insurance company would investigate further from this point. Our Hotel is currently working to make enhancements to deliver a more comfortable stay for all of our guests. We hope for the opportunity to accommodate you the next time you are in the area.

Summary: The room was fine, the staff was great, but the wifi was very unreliable. It was easy to connect initially, but very random as to when it would be available. There were times when my husband could connect to it, but my kids and I could not.

I need my money back  this place is really badi will never stay here again every think was really bad services was the worst I have any were I have pad please be for but this is the worst one I Will not staying here again

Nothing spectacular about this hotel though we did get a good rate for 2 nights. We had a hard time getting in with our key cards if you wanted to enter through the doors by the parking area, small elevator use to bigger ones, one lamp inside didn't work, wish they had a small refrig to keep water or drinks in, no amenities in bathroom except a small bottle of shampoo, conditioner, soap and another item no toothbrush or toothpaste. We had breakfast coupons which was ok potato's, scrambled eggs, biscuits, muffins, beverages, cereals etc. If they had a breakfast meat at least it would have been great but I understand  when it's free. Free shuttle to Disneyland 15 minutes, a few malls around there to dine and close to downtown Fullerton was convenient.

When you book be sure to not request a room on the first floor that is near the freeway. If you are looking for a very filling breakfast, you may be disappointed. They do not serve meat, but they do have eggs, potatoes, and rice. The rooms are older, and someday the place may need to be updated, but for the price to stay for a week, you probably can't beat it! It has a nice pool, and it is a pleasant atmosphere. The location is great if you plan to do to Disneyland, etc.

Waiting for appartment to be ready  so we stayed here about 2.5 weeks we would have stayed longer but they didnt have availability one night so we had to check out and was to much of hustle to check out and back in

All the front desk agents and the 1 housekeeper cleaning the rooms next to mine were all nice. Summary Heading: Never stay in a Howard Johnson again
Summary: Unusable internet, extremely slow; TV didn't work, had to call for service; old THIN towels; no instructions on phone; interior of lobby and room very old with a lot of updating needed, patch walls; leaky bathroom faucet, had to leave a towel around faucet to keep from getting wet; lamp in room broken; bathroom floor sticky; wall plugs were loose and questionable; entrance only through lobby because side door key pads broken. Called for coffee packet because none were in the room the first morning and it took an hour plus to get coffee in the room.

They offered a cheap upgrade from full to queen bed, a complimentary breakfast for both days, and a free shuttle to Disneyland operating at all hours of the day. I would definitely come back and recommend this resort to others

Summary Heading: Bugs infested Hotel. Misleading pictures in the website.

The first room they gave us have ants on table and beds. There are some pieces of trash on the carpet as if they haven‚Äôt vacuumed the floor. The hallway smells with visible stains all over. We were transferred to a room down the hall, but still there were ants on the tables and beds. When I asked if they can transfer us to a room on the other side of the building because of the noise coming from the freeway and bugs. The receptionist told us that they are fully booked and there is no other available room. Don‚Äôt make a mistake parking near a Banana tree in their parking lot or you‚Äôll be surprised with

The Howard Johnson in Fullerton looks nice enough in the lobby but the rooms felt like an old Motel 6.  Very run down and outdated.  Odors, and ants.  Few outlets, poor TV and internet.  Poor customer service from the front desk.  The only thing we liked was the water pressure.  Definitely NOT worth the money.  Avoid if you can.

The staff was friendly and the breakfast was good. One of the reasons I chose this hotel was for the free Disneyland shuttle but the evening shuttle didn‚Äôt show up so we missed the fireworks unfortunately. The room had a strange chemical odor that we couldn‚Äôt get rid of by opening the window and cranking the a/c. The next morning all of our belongings were covered in ants. :(

I can not believe how awful this hotel was! The pictures are lies! Between the rotting structures, the overwhelming abundance of ants and smell of weed I don‚Äôt know what was worst. There is a reason for the low price. Run do not walk to your next hotel choice! This place was disgusting!!!

This Howard Johnson is nothing like the others. It is very very very old. The pictures are deceiving. The free shuttle was horrible. It only comes every hour and about 7x throughout the night. It's a small shuttle, if it fills up, you have to wait for the next shuttle, which is an hour wait. The breakfast was also horrible. Nothing like other Howard Johnson's breakfast. Overall, a horrible experience. Never again!

Hello, I recently stayed at this "hotel" it was the WORST experience at a hotel I have EVER experienced. When first checking in, they had ants in the lobby, so we let the front desk know and they said "Thanks, we will handle it". The next night, after being at Disney, ALL DAY, we go to our room and ANTS were EVERYWHERE. Being on the third floor, I was already shocked that ants where there, but to find them in our luggage, the desk, OUR BEDS, was absolutely horrible, it is now about 1 in the morning, we are having to change rooms WASH OUR CLOTHES BY HAND because they could not open the laundry room for us because the front desk "did not have the keys", until i went down 4 more times and they finally got security to open up for us. It is now 2 in the morning and we are drying our

Will never stay at this property again. I usually do not complain but this was horrible. I reported the issue to their corporate office and they tried to blame the ants from coming in with the rental car, I did NOT have a rental car.

Stayed here with family, we booked two rooms and they were both terrible! First of all the whole hotel smelled like weed. The room was filthy, the curtains were covered in dust, there was food under the nightstand, the bathroom looked run down and beat up. The shower head was not attached to the wall and it was rusty. The plastic light cover was cracked and when we asked for a rollaway bed for our child it was terrible. The mattress pad was super thin and the wires were popping Through it.  The food wasn‚Äôt the best either. The eggs tasted fake and mushy, and as filthy as the hotel was, we were scared to eat the food. To top it off the fire escape doors that should stay shut were propped open with rope and our last night someone pulled the fire alarm around 10:30 at night. This

Close by too the park! Free Shuttle bus to and from the park. Close walking distance for food and shopping. Great breakfast and customer service was great. Sasha up front helped us with questions and what we needed. Overall great stay.

Too many issues to list, big ones like improperly charging cc's with an oops I am sorry, to black widows in the common areas outside, to the broken down plumbing. Slumlord feel for a Disney Resort Price! Don't do it.

We came up to take our youth group to six flags and then to a conference at the Honda Center. We reserved 5 rooms about 3 weeks prior to the trip through hotels.com. When we arrived to check-in the man at the front desk was very rude, stating he had no reservations. We had 20 kids, with us waiting to go in at approximately 10:30pm. The man at the counter who stated he was the manager (who was not the manager) asked if we were drunk and that this isn't his problem. So we finally got our reservation worked out with hotels.com, and when we went to get the rooms, it took them 3 hours to get them for us. We were waiting so long that we had kids sleeping on the couch in the lobby. Then they messed up and put 10 kids in 1 room and while we were waiting for them to fix this and get us

Stayed for the first time at a Howard Johnson, we thought we had booked the HOJO in by Disneyland but mistakenly pick this hotel. And please do not make that mistake.  It was a pretty bad hotel, that I will not be making that mistake again.  It was quite dirty, service was one of the poorest I have experience. Service desk never provided a few things we asked for.

Summary Heading: If you like filth stay here
Summary: This hotel is so run down and dirty, filthy, nasty you will not want to stay there the carpet looks like people work on cars inside the building the hallways and rooms are filthy and the rooms smell like mold

Hotel was very noisy. You can hear every car in the freeway. The doors squeak so you can hear every time one opens. Biggest complaint is the Disneyland shuttle. They fail to tell you that you may not get the shuttle first thing in the morning. A small shuttle bus is shared between two hotels so if it fills up at the other hotel you‚Äôre out of luck! So if you stay here you better plan on no shuttle if you care about getting to DL at a good time. Also, the first shuttle doesn‚Äôt even leave until 8:05. Breakfast is just OK. The only thing that made this place good is the cleanliness of the room.

When we got to the rooms the conditions were awfull. The walls were stained and the bathroom light turned on after many tries and it was blinking. The whole room looked runned down. The breakfast consisted of white rice, eggs, and what I can only hope was rice in broth, not sure what that was about.  Our icemaker was always out of ice so we had to travel from the 4th to the 1st floor if we wanted ice. Summary: It could have been worse, but the staff was not welcoming and uninformative. Rooms are ‚Äúclean‚Äù, but the room and AC smells stale, WiFi is ‚Äúavailable‚Äù but you cant actually connect to it, and for the price... we would have been happier at a cheap motel.

The walls are extremely thin, I could hear our neighbors until 3 in the morning as well as anything that was going on in the hall way. The decor was extremely outdated. The turn down service was extremely poor they only changed our trash they didn't give us knew towels or toilet paper and we were there for 3 days.

Summary Heading: Not the best, but okay for the price
Summary: The breakfast was not edible. All of the beverages had been so watered down that they were not digestible. The French toast was hard as a rock as well. We didn‚Äôt bother to even go down after the first experience. The service was great though and the rooms were clean. They looked a little old and rough though. Bubbles paint in the restroom, cracks in the ceilings. Repair jobs were evident because the paint did not match and there was a ton of caulking showing.

I was a bit skeptical when I first booked this hotel through Hotwire, but my experience was definitely not bad at all. The staff is great! They were super nice and super helpful and even allowed my boyfriend and I to check in early. A big plus is they have a free shuttle to Disneyland which is reliable and fast. The hotel package also came with free breakfast which was pretty decent. As for the room itself, I have no complaints. It was clean when we arrived and very spacious! Overall, this hotel isn‚Äôt as bad as what some reviews say!

Hotel was ok. The pictures look better then the hotel.  The pool photo is misleading.  That hotel in it is the Holiday Inn.  This is a run down Howard Johnson but had free shuttle service to Disneyland with good hours which was fantastic.  Also, a continental breakfast was included and very good. Same items everyday but that was ok for us.

The employee that helped me at check in was very nice and the process was fast.  The hotel and our room was very dirty.  The drapes in our room had a white dried substance on it.  The lamp shades were dirty with various substances.  I was afraid to walk on the floor barefooted.  The bathroom was disgusting.  I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

Summary Heading: Dated, dusty interiors and pungent smells
Summary: The room interior looked like something out of a B-movie knockoff of Beauty and the Beast. It might have been cute 30 years ago but it‚Äôs pretty bad now. Room had a strong smell of the chemical they use to remove cigarette smell, and the carpets were dark brown, in an attempt to hide stains. I am not usually sensitive to smells, but this was *pungent*. Seems like they did the world‚Äôs cheapest renovation, as there corners had carpet sticking up and unfinished wallpaper. Saw a 2 inch cockroach in the hallway. WiFi was about 2 mbps, working about 50% of the time. Staff were okay though. Don‚Äôt stay here if you want to feel comfortable.

Pros: Hot breakfast buffet with ample seating, free shuttle to Disneyland  Cons: Needs some updating, esp rooms; beds are small, room did not come with microwave or refrigerator.   We booked a room for 2 adults and 3 kids.  There's no way we could have fit 3 kids in one of the double beds.  We got a cot that was supposedly $10/night, but they ended up not charging us for it, which was nice.
Customer service was not good ...the communication level was poor ...at check in they gave me a room that was occupied bad experience overall

The Stay was great....but trying to get my rewards points earned for a free stay has been a hassle. My boyfriend is a rewards member and I paid for the room but they did not give him the points because my name was on the room not his. We asked to get it corrected  The staff created a new account for me instead of giving him the points to earn a free room or gold status...frustrating.
