The hotel is situated across from a large plaza with different stores and shops and just a 2 minute drive away from In-n-out (the real savior of the trip). Also very easy access to a major highway. - Parking is complimentary and easy to find spots in the parking lot. - Pool was awesome and not crowded (hours 9:00am to 10:00pm, no Jacuzzi onsite)  Cons: - Room conditions were kept in mediocre condition. They also varied from room to room so I'm guessing it is up to chance if you happen to get a good one or not.  - Privacy was also a little spotty. I stayed in a room on the 1st floor that faced the pool and the sliding

Summary Heading: adequate for a few nights, great breakfast!
Summary: This is a very large hotel.  The internet is very spotty in the evenings after about 5PM.  I am guessing because their server can't handle the internet traffic.  It was very frustrating to try to skype or even review my emails.  On a good note, I really enjoy the breakfast buffet.  Hot fresh breakfast to start your day.  Rooms were clean and comfortable.
Nice staff nice hotel but seriously needs a Million dollar renovation seriously!! Breakfast is good and nice location.. Internet is terrible!!! Free but still very bad!!

There was great and not so great. Great Number 1.The shuttle to Disney.  It was fantastic.  Made for a more relaxed Mom. Not having to drive and park. Great Number 2.  The pool, it was clean and the perfect temp. (not to warm and not to cold)  It is large and goes deep.  Lots of seating and tables and it was great. Great Number 3:  The breakfast buffet had all the options and was fantastic.  Great way to start the day with a good breakfast.  Everything was there so everyone got what they wanted to eat and drink. Not so great Number 1.  Facilities are older, NO FAN of any kind in the bathroom. One shower and the whole room was hot and muggy.  Not so great Number 2.  Stopper in the Tub did not work. So no soaking in the bath. Shower worked though. Not so great Number 3. No

It was like being a teenager again. Couldn't come and go whenever we wanted due to a problem with their key card machine.  So every time we left the room we had to call the front desk to get let back in. I asked for some sort of compensation and Frank told me that he was very sorry but they weren't responsible for my being dissatisfied.

Summary Heading: 1/2 under construction and 1/2 is desperate need of renovations
Summary: The overall feel of the room was dirty mainly due to the very old stained carpets old water stained furniture dirty windows and dated decor.  Staff was extremely professional and nice

Great and clean hotel for my family and I. Rooms are clean and great dependable shuttle to and from Disney. They give you breakfast passes when you check in that will cover your breakfast the entire stay and it is a pretty good breakfast. Only complaint about the hotel is that every Coke vending machine was out of order. You could go to the gift shop and buy a Coke but if after hours you couldn't get one. There is a Walmart 2 minutes away so I would suggest getting a cooler and buying some cokes to have in your room.  Would stay here again. !

The reviews on the hotel scared me to the point where i brought my own spray bug. I didn't see any!  However, i was surprised. The lobby/front desk looks great. And the room we had was clean, it does look like it needs new painting, carpet...but good enough to sleep well and relax. Wifi is good near the lobby not so good in the rooms. The pool is heated. Breakfast is good, buffet style and complimentary. Needs more variety in jam. Location is good, near  different fast food, stores and close to the freeway. They had a private event that night and we didn't hear a single noise.  I would go back in the future.

If some one is looking for mid Budget Hotel closer to Disney Land in LA may want to choose this property. They do have free shuttle services between the hotel and Disney land. Hotel certainly needs renovation but rooms are pretty clean. Staffs are nice and helpful. Breakfast is OK.

This hotel was run down, with walls and ceilings stained and paint peeling.  The water in the shower stopped - 2 mornings in a row.Just stopped! I asked for a wake up call - that I never received.  The internet in the room was not working - nor was the internet in the business center. The breakfast - while a lot was offered - was pretty bad and mostly inedible. I brought these matters to the hotel staff's attention - as well as the corporate office - who all seemed like they couldn't care less. I was over billed at check out - though they did fix that.

Glad this place was cheap as it is in need to a refresh on the inside.  The room was clean and not dirty at least.  The free breakfast was ok, everything was mass bagged or boxed and server up buffet style.  The WiFi we had though was pretty bad honestly.  Not sure what was going on but we definitely were not impressed with the WiFi performance.    I wold stay here again just don't have too high of expectations.

Summary Heading: Beds are OK, Hallways need uograde
Summary: Booked this room with Points plus cash, which made the value reasonable. The room was OK, the beds were comfortable, the shower was good. The hallways however, are in much need of updating: Dated and smelly, especially the further you got from the lobby. Breakfast was hot and plentiful. Proximity to Disneyland was the main driving factor in selecting this location, and access to the park was quick and easy.
Needed staff to change bedding.... 'appeared' to look used. But staff was quick to change without further issues. Very nice and helpful attitude of front desk staff.

Summary Heading: Nice clean place to stay in Fullerton
Summary: I really liked the breakfast bar.  It was equal to a brunch buffet at any fine restaurant.  Lots of pastries and toppings for the hot cereal, even the cold cereal was a bit of an upgrade to most other breakfast buffets.  The room was clean, linen was clean and when there was a problem with an appliance, the electrician was there in a jiffy

I recently stayed at the HoJo in Fullerton. I have a mixed review as I was recommend by a few different people to stay here. The pros: Very fair and reasonable price for the stay (through Travelocity), convenient location, close to Disney parks (4 miles away) that has complimentary "limited" shuttle service (there is a little stretch in the middle of the day when the shuttle does not run), clean, friendly staff, complimentary breakfast (6-9am) and Internet and a big private parking lot.  Cons: The internet hardly worked in the room, worked best in the bathroom, the complimentary breakfast would have been great if they extended it to 10am AND if the food was a lot better. They did have a good variety of stuff however the quality wasn't that good. This hotel is also a business
Manager Response: Hello pano_kutulas,  Thank you very much for sharing your feedback regarding your recent stay with us. I have shared it with our staff, as it is thru direct feedback like yours that we are able to improve and better our product and service. Thank you again,   Cordially,  Juan Navarro-Sigala General Manager

Summary: Everything needs updating. Couldn't get wifi except in the lobby. Not enough parking. I would have been better off sleeping in my car and using Starbucks wifi.

I booked this hotel through Tous4Fun but the facilities like free breakfast at Hotel was not extended to us as we booked the tickets through tours4fun. Either Tours4fun or hotel web site never mentioned on their web sites that some facilities will not be extended to guest who come through tour operators. I never faced this situation as I usually book hotels through various channels web sites like Orbit, Expedia, ... and even princeline.   The manager/supervisor was too rude and he hung up the call while I was explaining the discrimination when it was extended the same service to few chines tour guests who traveled with us. It is more of right of information to customers so that no surprises at last minute like this which we had to sell out $10 to buy the breakfast whereas it was
Manager Response: Hello JaiHo1, I am sorry you state you were not extended the All American breakfast during your recent stay with us. As it was explained to you and your guests during the check-in process, your reservation did not include it. As we offer different rates for our rooms, some of the rates do not include the breakfast, to make them more affordable for tour companies. If there is anything else I can assist you, feel free to contact me.  Cordially,  Juan Navarro-Sigala General Manager

Summary: Even my picky husband was satisfied! Comfy clean room for a great price! Friendly staff! Great stay!
Manager Response: Hello christyl378,  WOW, thank you for a great review. I am glad that you had an excellent experience during your recent stay at our property. I have shared your comments with our staff during our daily huddle.  Thank you again, and hope to see you next time you visit this area.  Cordially,  Juan Navarro-Sigala General Manager

Summary: Took my daughter to celebrate her 20th birthday üéâ I love the customer service from the shuttle driver, he went beyond his duties to provide my daughter a b-day preset üéÅ When it comes to the rooms they desperately need to be updated üòî
Manager Response: Hello pinguina_78,  Thank you for sharing your comments regarding your recent stay at our property, and for acknowledging the level of customer service you and your daughter received. I am so glad that she enjoyed her birthday. We are aware that our rooms need to be updated, and are planning to do that soon. Thank you again, and hope to see you next time you visit this area.  Cordially,  Juan Navarro-Sigala General Manager

Summary: The location was great, staff was nice. The breakfast was nice. The room just felt old, dirty and outdated. The carpet needs replacing as it was stained and made me want to keep on shoes the whole time. A good overhaul would make this a great place to stay.
Manager Response: Hello amandat073PT,  Thank you very much for taking the time and provide us your feedback. We are in the process of upgrading/renovating our property, we have started with the north 7 story building and is scheduled to be finished by October of this year, after we will continue with the rest of the property. Hope to see you then.  Cordially,  Juan Navarro-Sigala General Manager

Summary Heading: Hotel was fine. Unfortunately breakfast resulted in in some...
Summary: Hotel was fine. Unfortunately breakfast resulted in some intestinal distress. We skipped breakfast the next 2 mornings
Manager Response: Hello Jcnewt,  I am sorry to hear that you may have experienced an issue with our breakfast. We have not heard of anyone else reporting feeling sick. Please accept my deepest apologies, and do not hesitate to contact me should you need further assistance.  Cordially,  Juan Navarro-Sigala General Manager

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: Unfortunately the conference room was being used for a large party on our first evening and the hotel staff was not concerned or able to confine the noise to the conference room. At midnight children were running up and down the halls and by 2 am we were woke up due to noisy guests hanging out in The hallway on the 2nd floor. Thank goodness we were only there 2 nights since We were sleeping on a very warn out bed and the breakfast was subpar. Additionally there was a cockroach in my room the last morning so I was happy to be leaving. The staff was pleasant and the price was right but next time I'll stay where the shuttles to Disneyland run all day and not just in the am and evening.

This is our place to stay anytime we are in Anaheim, either for Disneyland ( they have a free shuttle) or for and Angel game.  They are courteous , clean, friendly and your stay includes breakfast and the price for what you get is always a good deal.
Manager Response: Dear dfish83,  What a great review, thank you very much for taking the time to share your experience during your recent stay with us. It is our pleasure to be able to assist you during your stay at our hotel. If there is anything I can assist you for future stays, do not hesitate to contact us.  Cordially,  Juan Navarro-Sigala General Manager

Summary Heading: Everything was great except Wi-Fi connectivity
Summary: Service and breakfast were amazing, but unfortunately we didn't have very good Wi-Fi connectivity in our room (154).  The internet would constantly drop out and disconnect which made it basically unusable.  This was annoying because we were unable to back up or upload the photos from our trip each day overnight.
Manager Response: Hello juner889, I am so glad that you were amazed by the service level, as well as the breakfast provided at our property. Please accept my apologies for the inconvenience you've experienced during your stay regarding the use of our WiFi service, I have shared this with our IT staff, because we just upgraded our WiFi system, and increased the bandwidth last February. Thank you for providing us your room number on your review as it will help us pinpoint & address the issue with WiFi connectivity with our provider. Thank you very much for sharing your comments and providing with feedback.  Please do not hesitate to contact me if I can assist and/or help you in any way.  Hope to see you next time you visit the Fullerton-Anaheim area.  Cordially,  Juan Navarro-Sigala General Manager

Summary: Had to wait a long time for early check in. The next day we requested room to get cleaned it didn't get serviced. However, nice people at front desk, good breakfast and room was comfortable to sleep.
Manager Response: Dear AngelikskillZ, Thank you for submitting your comments about your recent experience during your stay at our hotel. Please accept my apologies for the wait on your early check in request, and for the room not being serviced the following day.  I am glad that you found our staff & breakfast accommodating to your needs. If there is anything I can help and/or assist you, do not hesitate to contact me.  Cordially,  Juan Navarro-Sigala General Manager

Summary: The room was kept clean, customer service personnel were courteous. Breakfast was ok. I didnt like the fact that there was an extra fee to have a refrigerator or microwave in the room. The water drainage for the bathroom was not very good. The wifi was free but it had horrible connection. I did like the fact that the hotel was close to shopping centers and fast food restaurants.
Manager Response: Dear Alejandra831, We thank you very much for your feedback regarding your recent stay at our property. Please accept my apologies for the inconvenience you experienced when using the Wi-Fi, and the drainage in the room. It is thru direct feedback like yours that we are able to improve and better our product & services. Thank you again for giving us an opportunity to serve you during your visit to the Fullerton-Anaheim area.  Cordially, Juan Navarro-Sigala General Manager

Summary: Nice staff, issue with first room smelling and TV quality of picture, peeling wallpaper, old carpet, stained bed cover but was given a different room when requested. Never got Wifi password. Traveled with teenager. Never made it to my reservation although I requested double beds. They gave me an extra breakfast ticket for him after they said they might have to charge me extra for him, but did not. Good price for this area. Rooms are tired, but they are starting to remodel.
Manager Response: Dear Mia H, Please accept my apologies for the issues you encountered in the first room you were assigned. Thank you very much for providing your kind comments regarding your recent stay at our hotel. It is thru direct feedback like yours that we are able to improve and better our product and service. I have reviewed your feedback with our staff in order for us to tackle those issues, and prevent our future guests from them. Please contact me at your convenience if I can assist you in any way,  Cordially,  Juan Navarro-Sigala General Manager

Summary: It was the best service I ever had, hotel staff were very kind and friendly, also they were interesting on my trip and the places witch to visit and brings me all the information that I need. the hotel has a shuttle services to Disneyland and other places. Breakfast was very good it has many options to eat and the service was incredible!
Manager Response: Dear Hugo G, Wow, thank you for your review, I am glad that you had a great experience during your recent stay. I have shared you kind comments with our staff during our daily huddle up, as we use all feedback for training purposes, and they need to hear that they hard work does not go unnoticed. Thank you again, and look forward to see you next time you visit the Anaheim-Fullerton area,  Cordially,  Juan Navarro-Sigala General Manager

Summary: Good location and the service supplied by hotel staff and amenities makes the best option on Fullerton area
Manager Response: Hello 0camilom,  Thank you very much for taking the time to provide us your comments, and a great review regarding your recent stay with us. I have shared your kind comments and review with our staff. Thank you again, and hope to see you next time you visit this area,  Cordially,  Juan Navarro-Sigala General Manager

Summary Heading: Good stay for the couple of days
Summary: Not super expensive, free breakfast, wifi, pool, room service every day, always can ask for extra towels or tooth brush tooth paste (whatever you forgot), nice big plaza right next to the hotel with target and all kind of places to eat, staff is friendly especially Frank at the front desk  is super helpful
Manager Response: Dear _veruxa_da, Thank you very much for your review about your recent experience at our hotel. As you mentioned, our location is a plus having those 3 shopping plazas next to our hotel with discount stores, shops, places to eat, etc. I am glad you noticed Frank, our Guest Services Supervisor, as he provided you with his excellent customer service & hospitality skills, he is a "star" in our team. Thank you again, and look forward to see you next time you visit this area,  Cordially,  Juan Navarro-Sigala General Manager

Summary: First off the staff was outstanding and very welcoming.  The Buffet was excellent and saved us money.  Our stay was only for one night as we went to Disneyland.  Rooms are kinda dated but they were very clean and comfortable.  Hotel also offers a shuttle to Disneyland and free parking.   Hotel is about 4 miles from Disneyland but it is a straight drive to it.  Will stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Jumpstart000000, Thank you for giving us an opportunity to serve you during your recent visit to the Anaheim-Fullerton area. I am so glad you enjoyed your stay with us, our guests satisfaction is our # 1 priority and goal. I have shared your kind comments with our staff to let them know that our guests "do" notice when we are attentive & welcoming. Thank you again, and hope to see you next time you visit this area,  Sincerely,  Juan Navarro-Sigala General Manager

Summary: So many people all the time. .this place is run down. .the parking on the weekend is terrible..they have functions here and the hotel guests end up with no parking. . The room is so dated. Beds uncomfortable.  1 elevator at each end of Hotel. .takes about 5 to 10 minutes to get it.  So small you might have to have your family wait and take it again. The one plus is free breakfast which isn't bad. .and a shuttle to Disney.  Would only stay here in a pinch.
Manager Response: Hello marky012,  Thank you for taking the time to provide us with your comments regarding your recent stay at our property. Our ownership & management companies acquired this property about 2 years ago, and since then, are bringing it up to date little by little. I am sorry we failed to "wow" you in the product area, but I sure hope we made up in our service & cleanliness, and the full american breakfast we provide every morning to our guests. Please contact me should you have any questions and/or may require my assistance,  Cordially,  Juan Navarro-Sigala General Manager

Summary: Have been at this hotel before for smaller type convention.  Good location, staff very helpful, clean, free breakfast, pool area, etc.
Manager Response: Dear Al R, Thank you for providing us your feedback about your stay. I am glad you had an excellent and productive experience when attending your meeting/conference. It is thru direct feedback like yours that we are able to maintain our associates motivated, and excited about providing great customer service, and a clean place to stay to all of our guests. Thank you again, and look forward to see you next time you visit this area,  Cordially,  Juan Navarro-Sigala General Manager

Summary Heading: Michelle in the front desk was extremely rude! She needs...
Summary: Michelle in the front desk was extremely rude! She needs more help in the customer service department.
Manager Response: Dear N8643PRmicheller,  Please accept my deepest apologies for the poor customer service you have experienced during your recent stay at our hotel by one of our staff members. Customer service and guest satisfaction is our # 1 goal priority, and I am sorry we missed the opportunity to wow you during your stay. Thank you for bringing it up to our attention, It will be addressed with our team, and used for training purposes. If there is anything I can assist you, please do not hesitate to contact me.  Cordially,  Juan Navarro-Sigala General Manager

Summary: I frequent your hotels in various cities for work and they all are very accommodating. The rates are exceptional,  the hotels are well maintained and the staff is very friendly. I would recommend all Wyndham hotels, the chances of a terrible experience are slim to none, in my experience. Thanks!
Manager Response: Dear laurashanoviab,  Thank you very much for taking the time and provide us your comments and feedback regarding your experience during your recent stay. Thank you again, and look forward to see you during your next visit to this area.  Cordially,  Juan Navarro-Sigala General Manager

Summary: Check in took almost 30 min. Elevators not located near room. Beds not comfortable. Very thin walls. Had a language barrier and I speak english.

A couple of my friends and I wanted to go to the bars in Downtown Fullerton since we had never gone before. We didn't want to worry about drinking and driving though, so we decided to book a room. The lobby was gorgeous and the front desk was helpful. We got a room on the 3rd floor and it had a nice view of the pool. There was in iron, an iron board, and an extra blanket and pillow already in the closet when we checked in. It was only like 5 minutes away from the bars, so that made it easy to book an Uber. In the morning, we went down for breakfast and I was so surprised that they actually had a very good breakfast. It was buffet style and they had really good sausage and eggs.
Manager Response: Dear Leah T, I am glad you enjoyed your stay with us, and were able to experience the "Downtown Fullerton" ambiance. Thank you for sharing it with us. Look forward to see you next time you visit this area.  Cordially,  Juan Navarro-Sigala General Manager

Summary: Stayed here two nights for a work-related workshop. Was convenient to have our room right down the hallway from where the workshop was being held. Didn't have to lug a massage table around very far or up the elevator. Place is worn looking and shows its age. Room with double beds was a typical room - nothing special enough to mention. Room was next to parking lot which was next to 5 Fwy. Could hear big rigs going by and a truck constantly backing up with those 'beeping' noises. Inexpensive place to stay for those visiting Disneyland and Knott's, just don't expect too much.

Summary Heading: Everything is great except there is no fridge and...
Summary: Everything is great except there is no fridge and microwave, you can ask for them but u have to pay extra
the room i was in has a leak in the bathroom, there was soap left in the bathtub from the previews guest , breakfast was bad, no flavor and all was not good.

Friendly and helpful staff all the way from the front desk to the maintenance personnel.  Even made sure we had a parking spot during a large meeting for Amway distributors.  Prompt repairs of two minor items in the room.  Breakfast staff especially efficient and courteous.  Room rate includes a breakfast that would cost $10 per person.  Make sure you get a poolside room to minimize traffic from the freeway.

Maintenance anyone? No tub. Shower wasn't enclosed on the floor so the water went all over the bathroom floor past the toilet to under the sink. I put my foot on the soap holder to shave my legs and it broke of into pieces. I fell in the shower. I took a piece of the broken soap holder to the front desk and told them what happened. They apologized and asked if I was ok.  That was it. Nothing more. I am a rewards member. I guess membership doesn't have its privileges! The morning shuttle driver to and from Disneyland is polite and jovial. The evening driver is grumpy, impersonal and a horrible driver. Also, I received a phone call on my cell phone from the front desk telling me that I couldn't leave the do not disturb sign on the door for more than two days. I told her I picked

Located in a skechy part of town surrounded by Bail Bond advertising. The outside was pretty rundown and looked like a truck stop. Lobby was very nice but niceties ended there. Walking down the hall I began to notice instant decline of property upkeep. The room was dingy and smelled horrible. There was not one wall that didnt have peeling paper. I slept on top off the sheets as I was to afraid to get under them. The bathroom was covered in mold and rot and the bathroom outlet did not work. Had to scout around the room for an outlet to plug in the blow dryer. Took the shuttle to Disneyland, waited until almost 10:00 pm before hailing a cab to get back to the hotel. Did not try the breakfast, just shortened my stay checking out immediately. As I was leaving the lobby I heard the

The motel itself was clean and the staff are friendly The breakfast was OK however we did not get the room that we had reserved so instead of staying three days we only stayed one when we booked a room they said there was a hot tub there was no hot tub at that facility The swimming pool was OK
Manager Response: Dear Gordon D B, Thank you for providing your comments and feedback regarding your recent stay at our hotel. I do apologize for the misunderstanding and confusion regarding the room type you thought you had reserved. At our property, we do not have a hot tub. We will commence renovations soon, and adding a hot tub is in the plans. I am glad that you were satisfied with the friendliness of our staff, and the breakfast provided. Thank you again, and hope to see you next time you visit this area.  Cordially,  Juan Navarro-Sigala General Manager

Summary: We stayed two nights, Saturday and Sunday.  Check in and out was easy and efficient.  The room (339) was not facing the freeway, which helped keep traffic noise to an imperceptible level.  The only things missing from the room were a refrigerator and a microwave, which would have been very convenient for us.  Room maintenance was excellent, as we were supplied with clean towels each day, and our beds were made each day.  The included breakfast was very good, with a good variety of breakfast items, including scrambled eggs and the usual hot and cold  breakfast items.  All in all, a good motel experience, and would consider staying here again.
Manager Response: Hello Kacanga,   We appreciate you taking the time to share your comments, and write this review about your recent stay experience. I have shared it with our entire team, as we are very happy to hear about the great overall service provided by our staff, the cleanliness of the room,  and that you have enjoyed our breakfast. We will commence renovations soon, and it is in the plans to add the refrigerator & microwave as part of every room amenity. Thank you again, and hope to see you next time you visit this area,  Cordially,  Juan Navarro-Sigala General Manager

Summary Heading: Howard Johnson Fullerton - you get what you pay for
Summary: This hotel serves a great full breakfast buffet.  It looked like it has not been remodeled in a long time - looks old and tired.  One night we returned and found our room had not been serviced - after a long day it was disappointing to come back to a messy room/bathroom.  The hotel is right near the freeway and we could hear that sound all night long.  The inexpensive price to stay here reflects that quality of the hotel - very bare bones.  If you just need a place to lay your head at night and will not spend much time in the hotel, then this might be the place for you.

The room seemed clean. One night we were sitting on the bed and the bathroom light went off and no one turned it off scaring my daughter. She wanted to leave then.  I was unhappy they don't have  small refrigerators or a microwave. Even Motel 6 has them.  Their website said they were 1.7 miles from Disneyland, but they were 7 making the rest of the family angry at me. The breakfast was ok, but I have had better.  All in all it was ok. Also since I didn't have transportation or microwave/frig I had nothing to eat except fresh fruit and veggies from Sprouts Market across the street, but couldn't buy much....no frig.
I stay here often and this stay was less than usual and it should have been better than usual because there was not  many people staying in the hotel
No queen beds.  Website says queen and they are fulls.  I will not be returning with my family.  Also the room was not clean. Dirty cups underneath the bed. Gross!

The staff 2nd shift manger Frank and his crew was very nice and helpful when we needed thing and helped us find the places around fullerton area and gave us a good room that was perfect for my family and the hotel was very and the pool was very clean and also ther breakfast was very good and filling.
it was a great hotel. I thought it was close to Disneyland. It is driving-wise but not walking distance. Convenient if you don't want the hassle of traffic on the freeway.
Excellent service. We had a wonderful time. The room was clean and welcoming. You will be my first choice on my net trip.

Overall very disappointing and unsatisfactory. Property in need of update, repair and maintenance. Staff was apathetic. The room had no hotel information: e.g., is there food available, what TV channels are available, etc.? When I called to ask, I was then given a couple of local takeout menus and was told no channel lineups were available. Insufficient electrical outlets were available and some did not work (plugs too loose). Internet was a crawl.  I think if you didn't oversell the quality in your marketing, it would not have been so disappointing. Instead, that property is an example of what gives HJ not such a good name.

Very ordinary hotel experience. I have stayed here once a year for about 5 years for a conference weekend.Management and service has improved drastically over the past years. Current renovations are well handled with few problems for the guests. Renovated style is early 1960's discount designer but the common area's are fine. This hotel caters to International Disneyland tourists so they don't have much motivation to be a destination spot. Lousy Wi-fi service threw-out (slow and spotty) and only one ice machine for the entire hotel is a serious discomfort.

Summary Heading: Therse's a musty smell on the ground floor by the elevator...
Summary: Therse's a musty smell on the ground floor by the elevator. The hotel address printed on the phone in my room has the wrong area code, so that caused confusion while ordering pizza.  The clock wasn't set correctly (to standard daylight time).

Wasn't thrilled nor overly disappointed. No microwave, no mini fridge was a bummer. Had to go to top floor for ice. Our bathroom sink drained slow and was dirty. We let the cleaning person know and nothing was done. On the bright side receptionist let us check in early. Breakfast was delicious and the free shuttle to and from Disneyland was perfect.

This hotel is in desperate need of an update.  The room was ok, but the bathroom is horrible.  There is no counter space in the bathroom and I wish I would have known there was not a bathtub, just a shower.  The little "store" in the hotel has very odd hours and there isn't anything that I could find within walking distance, for food.  I asked the receptionist and she pointed me in the direction of the "car wash" across the parking lot.  Come to find out, it isn't a convenience store, but a tiny shack which was actually closed.  I ended up walking to a Sprouts grocery store, but I wasn't happy.  The shuttle to and from Disneyland was prompt and the drivers were friendly.  The main redeeming factor of this was the breakfast - they had everything you could ever want for breakfast

Summary Heading: Extremely friendly front desk staff can not make up for horribly slow internet and worn, tired room
Summary: I stayed at this property for 5 nights in January 2016.  Upon check in, I found Frank, the manager on duty, extremely friendly and his friendliness continued for the duration of my time. I was greeted by him each evening upon my return to the hotel.  Breakfast was included in my rate, and in this area the hotel is above average. There were many choices, including hot eggs, potatoes, rice, pancakes and french toast, cereal, fruit,  breads, etc.    However, the hotel has several issues that affect my rating and given these issues I would not consider staying at this hotel again. The largest issue I had was that their internet connection was incredibly slow. I appreciate the ability to FaceTime with my family while away from home, and this was not possible (by video or audio) with

Summary Heading: I've stayed at numerous Howard Johnson hotels , I used to...
Summary: I've stayed at numerous Howard Johnson hotels , I used to stay at this hotel before it was a Howard Johnson . I used to love it even when it switched owners , but this last stay was just nothing like my previous experiences . I was extremely disappointed and will likely not ever stay there again . From stains on the bedding to being switched around 3 times , to requesting specific amenities and still not having them met ( I'm pretty easygoing ) I don't make ridiculous demands or make picky comments about things .

We stayed at this hotel for our Disneyland trip. It was very easy to get from the hotel to Disneyland. Very close. Our room had a slight odor. Not sure if it was cleaning solutions or what it was but it didn't seem to go away. It wasn't unbearable though.

Awesome Customer service. Always a great stay here. Breakfast is an added  bonus. The manager Frank goes above and beyond. More than someone you'd  expect at a hotel. Can't wait for the remodel! We've stayed here plenty of times.
We stayed for a trip to Disneyland. The shuttles had an inconvenient schedule. There were not enough drop off and pick up times. The rooms were dark and dirty. The Internet was too slow to use.
Overall the hotel was very good.  We liked the location as it was close to everything and easily accessible from the freeway.

Summary Heading: STAY AWAY AT ALL COST!! THIS PLACE NEEDS TO BE TORN DOWN!
Summary: I usually never do reviews. Because usually everything is perfectly fine with hotel stays. Nothing ever stellar , nothing ever really bad. This place was SOOOOOOO BAD! First impression walking into lobby was not bad. It appeared clean and nice. Upon checking in the clerk acted like she had never done a transaction before. She was super annoying. No biggie though. Got the room key and headed towards the hallway to the room..and OMG..the carpet was literally from the 1970s ( like tacky Circus Circus hotel 1970s) totally stained, totally outdated,totally gross. The peeling and stained wallpaper and chopped up and dented doors were about the same.. I was like...."oh crap"! Got inside the room, BOOM! the smell...just what I was expecting..musty,smokey,old smelling.  Used the toilet ,

As stated above everything was excellent. Just wish they offered lunch & dinner. Lost my gold bangle at breakfast.called front desk they never called back to let me know of any out come. It must of slipped off my wrist at breakfast. So I lost it in your dinning room. Other than that happening our stay was amazing. But hurt full for me because  of my loss. No nothing was resolved and never received a courtesy regarding my bracelet.

Summary Heading: Thank you Howard Johnson's Hotel and Convention Center- Fullerton, CA
Summary: The staff was very courteous and accommodating. Everyone of them had a smile on their faces. Cruz Carrera was an excellent host for our Insugural Ball. We will definitely come back next year.

The worst hotel we have ever stayed with bugs crawling on tables and waking up seeing bugs on our pillows freak us out.    Some rooms are undergoing renovation and the nearest lift does not work means walking a further distance with luggages to our room.  Thankfully our tour agent arranged for another hotel in Covina.
Love this hotel is our new home away from home. Love the breakfast very yummy food my 3 yr old Eli said. Were looking forward to our next visit.
A small friendly hotel with an affordable price.  Within walking distance to dining and shopping area. Worth to try

Summary Heading: Have stayed here a few times now and each time it is...
Summary: Have stayed here a few times now and each time it is improving.  This property is in a safe area for families, easy access to transport and shopping, shuttle to Disneyland laid on also.

Summary Heading: close to shops and places to eat
Summary: Close to freeway. Close to shops and places to eat. Have a free shuttle to Disneyland.  The best part is the breakfast buffet.
84degree heated pool!  Maids cleaned up and refreshed the room, while we were gone! Front desk clerks were kind and generous. Bathtub plug did not work.

It was a standard, average hotel.  The only complaints I had was I saw a beetle on the wall the first night, there were a lot of ongoing visible repairs, and only one of our two keys worked.  The staff was friendly, and besides the bug, the room was clean.  I was not keen on the $100 "incidental fee" that they charged ahead of time to be reimbursed later.

Good hotel for the price! Free shuttle to Disneyland and a big breakfast in the mornings. The room was okay. Bathroom was a little dirty but not enough to make the stay unbearable. Bring your own towels because the ones provided are a little rough. Also, bring your own pillows unless you like a thicker pillow! Great price. I will definitely stay there again when I return to Anaheim.

We stayed for the night for a Wedding we had the same day. We were able to check in early with no problems. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. I have no complaints. The free buffet breakfast was also fantastic. It was a true buffet and they refilled our coffee and orange juice throughout our meal. Great service! I would definitely stay again.
Loved it. My family just recently moved out of Anaheim but we love coming back to stay close by when we have occasions near by....
Fell in the hall way over a maids cord and this hotel didn't even ask if I was ok only said you need to watch your step and move.

Summary Heading: The staff was great. The only problem I had was the huge...
Summary: The staff was great. The only problem I had was the huge cocroach that was in the room. .I killed it and flushed it down the toilet before my little niece saw it so I didn't even say anything.

Summary Heading: Everything was very good. We did have to contact front desk...
Summary: Everything was very good. We did have to contact front desk at 4:30am people sitting on patio chairs talking extremely loud.Front desk responded immediately.thank you.

I have booked here at this location from Howard Johnson and absolutely love it! It is very friendly staff that is willing to help you as soon as you enter. Location is family friendly & close to shopping/restaurant area. Clean rooms always! Complimentary breakfast is good if you do not want to go out of hotel. It is one of my favorite places to stay in Fullerton!

Hotel was good. A little tired and could use some freshening up to the rooms and hallways. The woman at the counter could use some help in slowing down, taking time to listen to the customer, and not being so scattered.
My room was in a real bad shape walls, carpets and bad room. But it the building has the same bad conditions of the room.
The area was sketchy. The front desk attendant that checked us in was a little rude. The room was nasty. The walls had damage. The carpet was dirty.

We found your hotel and room to be outdated and ugly - in desperate need of a remodel or a bulldozer.  There were cockroaches in the room too.  The complimentary breakfast was one of the worst I've ever had.  Only the french toast was ok.  I will never stay in this hotel again and I will recommend to my friends to stay away from this hotel too.

When I put my head on the pillow, I could smell the chlorine from the sheets but I also smelled something that smelled like mold when you leave your clothes in the washing machine too long. The pillows were very thick and strained my neck, and I still have neck pain from it, 2 days later. There was hair in the bathroom that did not belong to us. There were stains on the hallway carpets. One of the serving staff at breakfast kept loudly tapping out a beat with a fork and a knife for ten minutes that was very annoying.

Summary Heading: No sheets on our beds and refused to send up sheets bc staff was off
Summary: Over booked hotel came in late on vacation after traveling all day check into a room that was not the type of room we paid for....then when they tranfured us after trying to find the next room we arrived and there was NO sheets on the bed after we called down for sheets NO one was on staff to bring us sheets and no manager on duty we where sooo upset kids had to sleep on the floor with our own travel blackets we happen to have in the car....the staff didn't even care HORRIBLE PS I am NOT a picky person AT ALL I have slept in the worst places BUT this by far is the most horrible experience ever

Summary Heading: nice stay, but needs serious renovations
Summary: Staff friendly, breakfast was decent, shuttle service very timely and convenient.  Room carpets were stained, needs to be changed.  Walls need to be repainted...lots of imperfections.

The rooms were tidy and reasonably priced. Breakfast was reasonable with enough options to keep all the family happy and feed. Wifi coverage was terrible through out the hotel which staff blamed on Asian visitors.  Yet even when I tried at 3am in the morning I still couldn't get a connection in my room (or the lobby either) As it is so close to Disneyland it would have been nice to have had more options for times to get there but I guess you get what you pay for.  I had hoped to have been able to return to the hotel in the middle of the day so that young children would have enough energy to see the fireworks at the end of the day and avoid the heat of the early afternoon and time with the longest queues. Took ages to find the one ice machine in our building.

Cheapest place I could get for 2 weeks out. 3 miles from disneyland, free shuttle. Free breakfast, doable but they just reheat the items the next day. Unfortunately the power went out while staying there, they offered nothing in form of condolence.
Everything was fine until we found cockroaches in our room, that is just disgusting and am obvious issue. We won't be staying here again,

Summary Heading: Electricity was out when I returned at 11:30 pm.  No lights...
Summary: Electricity was out when I returned at 11:30 pm.  No lights in room at all. Pitch black.  Luckily I had small flashlight on my keychain.  So when electricity came on my room clock was then over an hour behind and I missed breakfast. Neither the restaurant or front desk staff cared.

Summary Heading: Pros: Check in was smooth, the pool was lovely and perfect...
Summary: Pros: Check in was smooth, the pool was lovely and perfect temperature, the rooms were comfortable and clean. breakfast was good Cons: Major ant problem throughout the grounds of the hotel. We woke up in the morning to ants having convered our truck and inside our truck too. Huge hassel and very gross. The shuttle to disneyland leaves at 8am, regardless of the park opening earlier than that. :-(
Rooms were nice, beds comfortable lots of pillows. Breakfast was good, not great. Pool was too cold for me. Even though I was on 4th floor,  still couldn't see fireworks from Disneyland

Summary Heading: It's was clean and cheap. My biggest complaint was the...
Summary: It's was clean and cheap. My biggest complaint was the customer service of the staff. They were rude and unhelpful any time we approached them. Breakfast was free, but gross. Would probably not stay here again.

Summary Heading: Worst hotel I've ever stayed in
Summary: The service at the front desk was good, and the complimentary breakfast was really good.  HOWEVER, upon first entering the room, we found DRIED BLOOD on the bed sheets. The hotel replaced our sheets promptly, but the housekeeping guy who came to do it said that meant that housekeeping hadn't cleaned the room before we got there, and that this wasn't the first time that had happened. Throughout our stay we continued to find bugs everywhere, and found that, what little had been cleaned before we got there had only been quickly wiped down. Then, as we woke up the last morning, we found that the last change of sheets that housekeeping had given us ALSO had DRIED BLOOD on them. The hotel didn't even offer to upgrade our room upon either incident of finding blood. Also, the shuttle to

The room they gave us was dirty, there was also a bad odor. I understand it was under renovations, but the walls of the hotel, the shower curtain and the bedsheets shouldn't be that dirty. Also the TV wasn't working properly.

Summary Heading: Staff could be better to there guests.
Summary: First got here and thought it was a pretty nice place. There are alot of stores around the area and all the fast food places we dont have back home which is cool. It is a non-smoking builing so we got a balcony. Turns out we got a warning for getting caught smoking on the balcony and we apologized for the mix up, but the guy was still pretty rude to say the least. Our key cards are constantly being deactivated and my boyfriend/fiance accidently got locked out. Then they told him he would have to sleep outside!!!!! What the what?? And also i have had to show my ID everytime i had to have my key card re-established.  So other then the fact that u have to pay for amenitys like a fridge and microwave(daily charge i might add), the rooms are decent and if u get the right one u get a
Hotel is Good... the only thing is that in the last romos smells really "old" but... other things... really good!.

Good location. Just needed a place for one night and was fine for the price. Easy to check in and out. Downfalls: hotel had a weird smell that was also in our room; breakfast, though complimentary, was not very edible.

Summary Heading: The hotel lobby was nice and we got to our room and it was...
Summary: The hotel lobby was nice and we got to our room and it was dirty, no refrigerator which was an amenity they told me online  it was in the room. the bedding was dirty the curtains smelled like smoke it was defiantly in need of an update.

Overall it was OK. The staff was extremely helpful and nice specially Frank Zuniga he was kind to give us ideas about what do and how to get a great deal for  park tickets. The room was below our expectations the beds were super old  they had no back  board and one of them was separated  a feet away from the wall. That space had no rug and it looked like a spider would crawl any minute.  I didn't report it because I thought  they were not going to have another room available. The price was ok , breakfast and surrounding we're amazing. It was great that  parking was free.
The place needed cosmetic work and was not as clean as it should have been. I felt that even though it was very busy I didn't get the personal attention that I am normally accustomed too.

Summary Heading: Far below hotel standards today...or even 20 years ago
Summary: My stay here was nightmarish.  Where do I begin?  The check-in process was very easy and nice but things went downhill quickly.  Only stayed one night btw.  The room was filthy!  I like to check the linens before I sleep in the bed and I find about 20 strands of hair from two different people (long blonde hair under the sheets in one bed and short black hair in the other).  They obviously just make the bed when they can get away with it.  One of the beds also had fluid stains (hope they weren't body fluid but more than likely).  Walls were all scuffed and had dark streaks of luggage stains on just about every wall.  Towels in the bathroom also had hair in them.  Lets just say that this place would fail miserably if a TV news show ever did one of those hidden camera episodes.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but needs to be revamped
Summary: Good location not far from Disney included a free buffet breakfast. Rooms are a bit outdated and need to be upgraded. Nice pool area, the hotel is right next to a shopping centre and close to a fair few restaurants.

Good value considering free Disneyland shuttle, free parking, and free buffet style breakfast. However, beds are uncomfortable, room had a strong paint smell, walls weren't painted evenly, halls were muggy and musty, window wouldn't open

They accused my wife of smoking marajuana within 30 minutes after we checked in after the maintenance manager tried to gain entry to our room while she was there alone. We had our service dog with us which thwarted his attempt. We suspect he is a sexual predator. They are trying to keep our $75 deposit plus $250 cleaning fee as well as $99 for the room we were in for 45 minutes. They are ripoff artist. We're waiting to hear from corporate now.

I felt like I was in the Twilight Zone. This was my 3rd stay at this hotel. The first 2 times were great. Night Managers George & Frank very pleasant and stayed on the 4th floor with great views of the pool.  This trip, Night Manager was Michelle, rude, lacks customer service, barely makes eye contact. Stayed on the 2nd floor with views of the parking lot and garbage bins. Room was dirty, stains on the carpet, cigarette burns all over, stains on the towels in the bathroom. Attempted several times to address issues with Michelle who had the same response each time...."I'll let someone know." I jokingly made a remark to Michelle that she was charging me .01 cent more for my room then what was listed on my confirmation, which I had given to her. Trying to invoke some positive

This has to be the worst hotel I've stayed in. Room was dingy and musty. I was afraid to touch anything. Carpets were worn. Bathroom floor had a gross slimy film on it. There was a handprint smudge on the duvet. Curtains were filthy. The driver for the shuttle for Disneyland wore no seatbelt, and answered a phone call while driving. I have an annual pass to Disneyland and I have stayed in many hotels with my family for the past 4 years. This one is the worst. The Hojo right in front of Disneyland was so nice and clean, I expected the same from this one. Cough up the extra money and stay at a different hotel.
Loved our stay. Every was great. THE Bus To Disneyland WAS So helpful. Breakfast was awesome.

As this will result in anything, but maybe by writing I will feel better.    This rating is not against the staff or local surroundings.  It is noted towards the hotel chain and what appears to be failure to support and maintain the towers we stayed.  A site visit is suggested by corporate.  If the corporate person visits and leaves with an "acceptable" report to their bosses for investing in repairs, shame on them.      It is not as if I paraded the towers of each floor and room.  I am only writing from my entry to the towers we stayed, the ride in the elevator to the sixth floor, the walk down the hall to our room and the room.      ALL STAFF WE ENCOUNTERED FOR TWO DAYS WERE FRIENDLY FRIENDLY FRIENDLY.    Lobby and room with free breakfast very acceptable and gave a different

We saw this room's pictures on their website. The room was the opposite of the pictures. We stayed in the tower building room 471. We entered a very gloomy building it was old and dirty in the halls. The elevator seemed like it was making noises to break down soon. We entered the room and the carpet was filthy and had dirty spots all over. The walls needed paint like years ago. The beds were a king and a double which were not awful but the sheets and comforter were used for a long time and needed to be replaced. In the morning I saw 2 roaches on the counter and they entered the little speaker holes on the tv. We were disgusted as we ran out of the room. We checked out and told the front desk what happened.  The women told us she would let maintenance know. That's was it. We
The hotel lobby is very nice but the rooms are not the best comfy stay. Breakfast was poor quailty. The staff is very friendly
Quick stay for our family. Room was nice. Hotel was one of the best looking Howard Johnson's I have been to.

+ It was cheap on a busy weekend + There was a bed  - Maybe it was because I was in the "tower" section of the hotel, but everything in my room just looked and felt dirty (stains on walls, floors a few on the sheets etc).  - WiFi didn't work all weekend, which prevented me from doing some important work. When I called the front desk they just said there was nothing they can do about it and it'll be that way until more people leave. I wouldn't have been so irked if the guy had at least offered some sort of apology, and no I wasn't impatient or rude when I asked, the guy just didn't seem to care.  - The air conditioner / fan in the room broke down and wouldn't turn on. Had to have a repair guy come to the room at fix it at 1130pm. He was very nice and fixed it quickly (wasn't his

Our first night there a fight breaks out right outside our door with a girl screaming and one man badly beaten. My husband had to call to the front desk as the fight kept slamming into our door. No apologies made nothing at all. Our TV was out the second day and night even though we reported it nothing was done. Again no apologies or anything made. We had originally debated staying an additional night but with the lack of service we left and checked out. When I last spoke to the front desk and mentioned everything we had already reported all she told me was she would send up maintenance which is what we had been told the day prior. By far one of the worst stays ever!

Summary Heading: Frank at check in was amazing and super friendly. The room...
Summary: Frank at check in was amazing and super friendly. The room was clean, the beds are sooo comfortable and the buffet style breakfast was delicious, something for everyone. The area was safe and I felt very secure staying here.

When you walk into the lobby The hotel looks really nice and clean. I got a room in the tower. When I got to the tower the walls were dirty and the elevator looked like it was about to break at any time. Once in the room it was clean yet felt very dirty and extremely outdated. The T.V. was an old school tube type. I was not Happy with the hotel.

Great Hotel and the location is awesome.   Staff is super friendly,  rooms and hotel not only smell and look clean they are clean.  We stayed a week and would choose this hotel as our standard go to hotel when visiting Disneyland or surrounding areas.  Beds were super comfy also

My husband and I stayed here before, so we thought we'd stay here again, but when I was using the water from the sink, I had it over to cold and the water was coming out hot, I let it run for awhile and it didn't change, so we called the desk to let them know. They changed our room, when I tried the water it was cold, but then through out the evening it was warm/hot again. Then I went to use the blow dryer and it didn't work. I tried plugging in my own appliances and they didn't turn on, the electrical panel didn't work. UGGGG.

Summary Heading: Need remodel. Looks good in the lobby but the room is not that great!
Summary: Staffing are great! Awesome service counter n the man standing in the lobby is wonderful! But the room is too small and smelly n the bathroom is not that great. The faucets are so old. The elevator is too old needs new carpet/floor inside. Surround the elevator area looks so unorganized. The housekeeper is so helpful n works very hard. Over all staffing wise is great but the room needs to renovate.

We chose this hotel because we were taking our daughter to BIOLA University and needed a place nearby that was clean, breakfast was a nice plus.  The staff had great service and smiles.  The grounds are relaxing and close to our destination.  It is quiet even though placed near the highway.  The main thing that kept us from 5 star across the board was the floors in our hallway being filthy and huge spills/stains up and down it.  Also the ice maker on our floor (only two available in the tower) was out of order.  The rest of the grounds were quite clean, so I can only assume that our floor was waiting to be cleaned when some remodeling was finished as there was a pardon our mess sign/remodeling in the building.

Summary Heading: A few bumps along the way, but overall good value
Summary: We stayed here during our trip to Disneyland.  It was a great price, and the free shuttle was a must, as my husband had severe sports injury and walking was not an option.  The shuttle was very prompt, usually, HOWEVER the size of the shuttle was an issue and one day we were trampled over by all the other tourists and then left behind because there was no space, despite having waited the longest in the lobby, forcing us to wait for the NEXT shuttle, scheduled an hour later!  My daughter also cut her foot badly on a rough edge of a door that could probably use some work.  Breakfast was great, though, hotel was clean, etc. Just a couple bumps along the way (luckily she cut her foot the night before we left, or she would've been limping around Disneyland).

Summary Heading: Not the best place to stay
Summary: It wasn't nothing like the ad said or the look of the place was beat down and horrible the staff was my very responsive or friendly they didn't offer any help or provide any help the pool area was very dirty and towels left all over the place along with trash I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone
Jennifer at the desk was very helpful. room was clean  and the hotel was better than expected. I will most definitely stay here again

We thought this hotel was good value for money. Our room was comfortable however there are no microwaves or fridges. Fortunately we managed to keep our food cool by making a makeshift fridge out of the ice machine and a bucket. The pool was clean and the area was convenient with many shops and restuarants located nearby.

Summary Heading: You HAVE to have wifi when you say you do
Summary: Not a bad place. Packed with Disneyland tourists at the really good breakfast - though the shuttle doesn't go that often. But, MY WIFI DIDN'T WORK. If you're a business traveler, know that their internet service is inadequate. Had to fine an internet cafe - I hate that.

I booked 2 rooms at this hotel based on price. It was for family members who were in a budget and we're going to Disneyland with us. They were polite, but said the rooms were dirty and run down. The property is in very poor condition. The phones in both rooms were broke. They said the breakfast was worse than the worst Denny's in the filthiest city you could imagine. They said it would be  like staying at the cheapest dive in Vegas. You know, like the ones you drive by and say "Ewwwwwwww! I bet you would get a cockroach in your mouth or get lice from there! There  were more than one bug and numerous spiders in each room. The mattresses were dingy and were probably found in a dumpster behind a brother. The hotel was very busy with foreign travelers, so it was noisy when the big

Summary Heading: Still not sure how I feel.
Summary: We arrived at hotel about 1045a.m. and because it was before noon I didn't want to pay a early check in fee so we jumped on the free shuttle to disneyland (leaves hotel every hour until 11 and then not again until 5pm until 12a.m.) Hotel looked nice from what I saw just in the few moments of being there... we got on shuttle at 6:15 from disneyland and once we pulled up to hotel I saw numerous people getting off 2 charter buses... so I almost ran off the shuttle to get in line to Check in. There were 3 people at the desk and check in went pretty smooth except wasn't expecting the $75 refundable deposit... got tickets for breakfast buffet which only served until 9am just off the lobby. We had a tower room on the 4th floor. We walked through lobby, past a small gift shop, 2

This hotel is very good looking but has missing very important items like, no microwaves in room, no fridge and no hot tub outside. If you need to warm milk for kids etc then you have to wait in lobby until someone is free to warm it for you. Also they have limited shuttle times to Disney land, Rooms were ok.

it is a really nice place to stay. close to disney land with free shuttle service is a nice deal. plus the rates are perfect. needs renovation though. needs toilets fixed, specially showers. and please install fans in the bathrooms. also the wifi service was terrible. the bed covers had a cigarette-burn hole in it. overall it was better than i thought and i would stay here again if i am again on limited budget.

Summary Heading: Very disappointed with the mold in the bathroom and the...
Summary: Very disappointed with the mold in the bathroom and the filthiness of the carpet in the room as well as the poor condition of the hallways om the tower.
I love staying here. Staff always so friendly. Breakfast is so good. This place is always clean. Pool is so fun for the kids

really cannot complain or expect more in view of their low charges but they do need improvement on wifi which was too weak and refurbishment as the hotel is a bit old. Must thank their front-desk lady Chung for her courtesy and helpfulness in taking care of my elderly mother while I was away for sudden personal reasons. My mom was very happy to have found someone who speak so good Chinese as like majority of our group members my mom does not speak English. Will stay in this hotel again.

Worst hotel I've ever stayed at! Locked out of room multiple times. No towels for room despite multiple calls. Tiny beds they claim can accommodate 5 but can't sleep four. No fridge and no microwave. Shuttle to Disney only runs certain times in the day, can't do magic mornings or even be at the park when it opens,  unless yout drive yourself.  Food is terrible. Internet worked for about 5 minutes. Never received extra pillow. Sketchy neighborhood. Must use key to walk from tower to anywhere else.  Elevator never went to correct floor. No stair access to go upstairs. Ice machines empty a lot.

When we first arrived around 6 pm, our room wasn't even ready yet.  When I first saw our room I was dissappointed, it was really shabby.  The next day after a long day at Disneyland, we find out the hotel's elevator was broken...and we we were on the 6th floor.  Luckily the hotel staff was willing to move us to the second floor, a balcony room facing the pool.  this room was much nicer and had much easier access.  The breakfast was good, but the dining room was packed, and the tables were dirty.  In all, the breakfast hours were too early, it would have been nice to have extended breakfast hours, maybe to 11 am to alleviate the breakfast rush.  The main reason we chose this hotel was a free disney shuttle.  The driver picked up in a different location than we were dropped off

Very quiet room soundproof from freeway noise. Soft bed and plush pillows. Aside from loud people in hallways hotel was quiet ideal if you need peaceful night sleep. Close to metro station and quite a few options to eat.

Very comfortable stay in a quiet neighborhood, close to Disneyland and shopping. The breakfast was superb. The free shuttle to & from Disney made it very convienent. Our shower didn't work the first night but it was promptly fixed.

Summary Heading: At check in bed had not been changed and saw a couple of...
Summary: At check in bed had not been changed and saw a couple of bugs.  I asked the head of housekeeping to change it.  Complimentary breakfast was horrible. Coffee horrible.

Some of the towel had some type of black ink several times. The bed was comfortable. They need some serious updates... Marks all over the walls and very disgusting. Would not pay 117 a night for the kind of room. Service was good and the breakfast wasn't not so good. Overal they just need a update. Would only pay 50 for a hotel like this. I stayed in a king room.

Summary Heading: OK, but would not go back
Summary: The breakfast is great. The beds are ok. However the window curtains had rips and we found a weird looking cockroach in the bathroom tub. You need to keep the batthroom door open as the ventulation is non-existent.
The hotel was old. Disappointed there was no fridge or microwave. Front desk ran out of swimming towels. Room was just muggy. They need more elevators. Double beds were super small!!

I looked this up on the Internet and it was close to where I needed to be. Great location, staff good, everything else awful. Torn carpets, smelly in the wall air conditioners9, old stained lounge chairsvatbpool, no towels, no shower curtain. A run down hotel that only stays alive because it is in the tour bus loop. Sad that the visitors to the U.S. Stay in this place. Totally not as advertised.

Worst hotel I have ever been so far in my life. They dont care about you. They have a tie up with some Chinese corporates. Hence they keep getting their customers. So they dont bother about others. Wifi does not work, even though they say it does. Poor rooms. Breakfast menu never changes. Had breakfast for 3 consecutive days. Not a single thing changed!!  in short, it is pathetic.

It's an older hotel but the rooms have modern conveniences. The rooms were very clean and the staff at the hotel were very nice. The beds were so comfortable. The only problem was that the Wi-Fi was very slow.
Rooms where dirty and smelled .. Found a spider in my bed .. Carpets where filthy.. Very disappointed

Summary Heading: Won't see me again at Howard Johnsons
Summary: Hotel room was in poor condition and in dire need of an update. Wall paper peeling, TV did not work and did not get fixed while I was there.

Summary Heading: horrible! Don't stay at this place.
Summary: I will never stay here again. It was dirty the bathtub didn't drain they said they had to charge us more because they said our reservation was only for 1 adult not 2. Corporate said that the rate should have been the same. They still have not fixed It. Do not go here!!! Pay the little extra and go to the red lion in Anaheim!

Summary Heading: Excellent staff and nice place and location.
Summary: This is an excellent place to stay.  We would like to thank you the staff Frank Zuniga, Liz and food manager, Tommy for providing a bag breakfast when we had to leave at 5 in the morning.  He made  this  happen for  us

I booked my reservation through Hotwire. Although my stay was supposed to be 2 days, I ended up leaving after the first night because I could not deal with the poor condition of the hotel.  Although the hotel lobby and conference room areas are pretty nice, the area where my room was located was  dirty and very poorly maintained.  The hallway walls had long scratch marks, dirty carpets, and  some of the hotel room doors had chipped paint. Not very stunning for a supposedly 3-Start motel!  The inside of my hotel room was not much better.  There was dirt on the walls, doors, and the light switch, and the duvet cover was missing part of the zipper.  If you are accustomed to staying at nice hotels, you will probably be disappointed with this one. But if you are looking for something
The hotel rooms need an update.  The bathroom had no ventilation and the lay out was not adequate

Seriously avoid this place.  Needed a one night stay and decided on this property.  First room they gave us was smoky and the carpet was full of cigarette burns.  Asked to be moved to a different room and while there was no smoke smell there was blood on the sheets, pubic hair all over the bathroom, and torn carpet.  I wouldn't be surprised if this is a hotel used by ladies of the night or transient people.  Seriously avoid, you would be better off sleeping in your car.

The first room they gave me had a tampon in the toilet! Need I go on? Extremely dirty elevator, hallway carpet, walls.... My room was the same. Dirty, slow drain in bathroom. Fortunately I was by myself. I would never have stayed if my family was with me. It reminded me of what it would be like to be in a state penitentiary!

Summary Heading: It's a nice hub for the travel agency bus pick up to Las...
Summary: It's a nice hub for the travel agency bus pick up to Las Vegas and Grand Canyon. We stayed there, get a bus tour then come back. It's nice and convenient.

We utilized this hotel as we wanted to extend our vacation an extra night. This property was adequate for the price and within minutes of Disneyland. The morning breakfast was a great start to the day and the kitchen staff did a great job ensuring food never ran out. They also offer shuttle service to the park which is a nice perk.

Summary Heading: A clean Place to Rest is all we Required
Summary: I had booked this Hotel trough www.dnatatravel.com and had received a very good rate inclusive of breakfast. It's a Hotel which is good to rest in the night. Nothing fancy but obviously way better than a Motel. The hotel is very clean and Many Chinese travellers stay over as the pickup point for many tours are from this Hotel. Shops are there walking distance and this is a very laid back area. The hotel provides a Free shuttle to Disney land. If you arrive at LAX Airport make sure to get Supper Shuttle at the arrival area as it cost only USD17 for a sharing shuttle. This Hotel was excellent for us and we had no complains. The front desk assistance provided by both male and female staff are excellent. We required an adopter to charge our phones however upon giving a refundable

The Howard Johnson Fullerton is a property in transition.  The lobby of the hotel is quite nice.  I wish that same quality transitioned to the actual rooms.   The property itself is in transition and it's quite evident.   The rooms are in dire need of renovation. The condition was not horrible by any means.  You could just tell it has been a while since the property got extensive attention. (it still had an old fashioned 32 inch CRT Tube TV).   Pluses were that the hot water in the bathroom was nice and hot.  The property itself was fairly quiet.   The breakfast buffet was quite nice.  The free shuttle too and from Disneyland was also a nice amenity.     Negatives:  Towels were very rough, duvets were itchy and fairly old. The internet connection was non-existent.  You could

Summary Heading: Breakfast was the highlight. The staff was friendly and...
Summary: Breakfast was the highlight. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room I stayed in had A/C problems both nights I stayed. Maitnance man had to fix it every night.  Location was not convenient but I would stay again just for the breakfast.

Summary Heading: breakfast is good compared to other hotel, Francisco...
Summary: breakfast is good compared to other hotel, Francisco( server)  is very friendly and dedicated.  Violeta( housekeeping) is very cooperative, Martin( Maintenance team) is very helpful and made my last impression good to HOJO.

The rooms are dirty and the stucco is cracked and peeling on the ceiling. Our comforter on the bed was stained and the pillows on the bed were over fluffed and stuffed to discomfort and it did not promote a very good nights rest. The Tv's in the room had poor quality in picture. The air conditioning worked great and the staff was helpful if we had a question or needed an item from the check in desk. The check out process was confusing and there was no clear way to check out. I was instructed to just drop our room key in a basket that had a sign in another language. Also be prepared for hectic mornings as both mornings we were there, 5 tour buses full of tour groups are checking out and milling around in the mornings.

I use to like staying at this hotel. I got a free night here through Wyndham Rewards and I enjoyed my stay until I went to check out and get my deposit back. I went up to the registration desk to check out and they said the maid told them it smelled like cigarettes. I don't smoke and would never smoke in a hotel room. Needless to say they would not give me back my deposit and wanted more money on top of the deposit I left. I told them they couldn't do that. Well they did. I will never stay here again as long as I live!!!!!!

Summary Heading: Very poor maintained hotel, tried to book a room in Anaheim...
Summary: Very poor maintained hotel, tried to book a room in Anaheim but was booked in Fullerton, was not hotel that was on website pictures.
Very nice stay, quiet and nice,  staff was very friendly, breakfast awesome, shuttle to Disneyland was very nice. room was clean. location is close to most everything, cosco, sprouts etc.

Summary Heading: Hotwire must change their rating of this hotel
Summary: I am currently in this hotel room writing a review because I'm so pissed, and I hate to complain but it's necessary to save others from my experience.   This hotel is cheap for a reason people! At first glance I was convinced our room was dirty. Upon closer inspection I realized that our room hasn't been updated since 1973. The towels are the worst in the world (paper towels are softer) and our bathtub doesn't drain (sooooo gross)! Our room smells like smoke which makes me sad because I have two small children with me.  I booked this through Hotwire and I'm disappointed they allowed this to be a 3star hotel on their site. It's bad here, guys, very very bad.

The hotel construction is very old. Wrinkles all over bed linens made us wondering if it was changed. Kids found one spider on the bed. No hair dryer, no bathroom sink counter, and no fridge. The bath towels were damp we had to call for replacements. Quality of complimentary breakfast was sub-par as compared with we had experienced before. Overall old, dirty, and cheap quality hotel. It doesn't worth a 3 star rating, be aware.

Stayed in room 671, a king and queen bed. The room was good size, clean, and what we hoped it would be. The breakfast was fine, eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes, and the like. It was included in price, a nice perk. The bathroom was clean, shower good, no complaints. Lot of Disney people staying, they had shuttles coming thru to the park. .    Didn't use the pool, but it looked fine and never was it too crowded. Some fast food places less then 3 minute drive, Inn and Out, Carls Jr, Denny's. Good what I hoped for at a good price, all the staff I ran into were nice. WIFi was free, but worked poorly though, if that is important to you.

Good location to anaheim stadium and knots berry farm. Great pool, actually heated unlike many others in the area. check in great. Yessica was great. Check out fine. Breakfast ok- nothing bad , nothing great. Looks like an old Holiday conference center attempting to be updated. Ice machines did not work , but front desk brought it up to room.

Summary Heading: Remote didn't, although staff replaced it an hour after...
Summary: Remote didn't, although staff replaced it an hour after reporting problem.  Hotwire advertised as 3 star hotel, this is inaccurate.  Hotel is rundown, free breakfast was a feeding frenzy.  Food was cold and bland.  Bedding was comfortable. Staff was nice.

This was a last-minute reservation made by a friend while I was stuck in traffic north of Santa Barbara.  The staff was terrific, sending up a bag of ice, when it turned out that the ice machine on my floor was out of service.  I would rather have had a refrigerator, but that was not available.  Bed, linens, pillows, towels, and elevated surfaces were excellent.  The carpeting did not appear very clean. I'm glad I brought slippers. I did not use the TV. The internet connection was adequate for my needs.  The room was acceptably quiet despite the volume of guests staying there, and the proximity to the freeway.  I slept well. The outside of "the tower" where I lodged looked quite worn and unclean. The doors leading outside from the banquet room hallway were not kept locked and
I forgot that Howard Johnson's doesnt have microwaves and refrigerators in the rooms like other hotels do so I probably would not choose it again.

Good customer service, but you defenitively shall imorove your cleanliness. Closest are not being vacuum. I was able to see the exact same trash for all 3 days I spended there and a niddle was found on the closest of the first room was offered to me.
Although it's being remodeled, this hotel was a pleasure to stay in. I'd come back again. Thanks Howard Johnson!

To me Howard Johnsons used to be a trusted family friendly lodging with good resturants on site. The room my family was issued was very old ....as in stale smell, wall paper peeling off walls. Bathroom dirty with no supplies left for showering. Wi dows and curtains dirty. Food was very disappointing and watching the handling ...unsanitary. Outside grounds not kept up. Complained to management and was told very sorry. My family will not utilize HoJo in the future.

Check in went smoothly stayed 4 nights breakfast was good on to the bad internet didn't work carpet was dirty stained made the room seem dirty the bath towels are old and rough air conditioner had a smell when running the fan

The hotel was dirty, spiders everywhere. The security harassed us because our parking permit was not seen fully, our windows were tinted. The front desk was rude and treated us like crap because we were young. The breakfast was nasty, and very stingy when it came to how many plates we could get. Overall, we will never stay here again. Horrible experience.

They had messed up the room the first night we were there. The room they had gave us was someone elses. They quickly fixed the problem. They had over charged us for the room. I went back to talk to the manger they quickliy fixes that as well

We arrived road weary and were pleasantly surprised by the large room with a lovely sitting area right by the pool.  Plenty of space, ironing board and iron which we needed, big bed, quality and comfort. The hot breakfast was quite good, and there was all you cared to eat.
