With the exception of elevator was out of service for a bit had to walk up stairs. Hotel is under remodeling. It was a good stay. Needs a fridge and microwave in rooms.
Manager Response: Dear Adamo949,  Thank you very much for sharing your feedback regarding your recent stay at our property. It is thru direct feedback like yours that we are able to better our product and our service. Please accept my apologies for having the elevator out of service during your stay. We did acquire this property last year, and it is our goal to renovate it, and be able to provide our guests a nice product along with our excellent customer service. Thank you for staying with us, and look forward to see you next time you visit this area.  Cordially,  Juan Navarro-Sigala General Manager

Summary: We stayed at this hotel from May 16-19, 2015.  Our room was very noisy and had not been maintained very well.  The smoke alarm went off the first night  and our TV quit working twice.  At 2:30 AM we were awakened by someone banging on our door.  The person was delivering a pizza, and the hotel apparently had not had him verify the correct room!  Although we had asked the hotel to fix the smoke alarm two or three times, the next day the smoke alarm went off again!  We tried to speak to the general manager, but he was never available while we were there.

Summary Heading: Myself and my family enjoyed our stay at your...
Summary: Myself and my family enjoyed our stay at your establishment.  The service was was top notch, especially the staff at breakfast time.  I would definitely recommend this location to anyone that needs a place to stay while in the Anaheim and Fullerton area.
Looks pretty online, ugly once there. Not a good place to stay. Too expensive for the quality of the hotel.
I felt the rooms and hallway were rundown but the breakfast was great. I wish they ran the shuttle to disney land more often. There were too many gaps.

Summary Heading: Hotel needs renovations. Rooms are so old and needs new...
Summary: Hotel needs renovations. Rooms are so old and needs new curtains.Carpet is old and dirty. Breakfast should be extended till 10:00 AM. Ice machine not working well. One good thing about this hotel is, staff is very accomodating and helpful!

We were very happy with our 2 night stay. The breakfast was wonderful. I appreciated having a Bible in the room very much. This hotel was very close to our wedding that we were attending, and also very close to many good places to eat. Thank you.

Summary Heading: Friendly Staff but hotel needs updating
Summary: The staff was friendly but hotel rooms need serious updating. Desk chair had cigarette burn hole in it, bathroom mirror had paint on it, tiles were dirty, room always smelled of mildew, keycards rarely worked, 4 keyed gates to pool and only one gate keypad would work, INTERNET NEVER WORKED DESPITE OUR COMPLAINT, interior door lock had screws hanging out of it and continued to even after repairmen claimed to fix problem. Breakfast was well done but didn't like the need for a breakfast ticket to eat. Pool was clean and water nice and warm but no pool towels available. Landscaping needed help, fountains where empty and unappealing, foliage needed pruning. Location was ideal with mall next door and gas station on corner and access to highway.
The people were very nice but the hotel is old, dilapidated, carpets are stained and dingy, this hotel is in dire need of a makeover and because of that I would not recommend it.
The buildings need to be updated including furnishings.  The staff were very friendly and professional.  Banquet rooms are great.

Summary Heading: Not worth the price but not horrible
Summary: The good: The suite I was in had a pool facing balcony that got plenty of sun and had one lounge chair. The living area is separate from  the bedroom. The bathroom was typical but clean. The customer service was good.  The bad: Unfortunately, I had a few issues with this place. For what you pay I feel like things that can be fixed, should be before anyone stays there. There were numerous rips in the drapes. The shower didn't drain. The TV did not work. The mini fridge did not open and shut properly. The wifi worked for maybe 10 minutes total. They were remodeling part of the hotel, although I didn't see or hear any of the work being done, it was very unsightly and I feel like they should have told me before hand.   They did however work with me through these issues and were very

Summary Heading: Willing to give the hotel another chance
Summary: we rented a suite without knowing they were under construction. The suite was a mess the comforter had dried food remnants, the curtains had big obvious stains on both sides, the tub black marks on the bottom that started to came off after we used shampoo and a wash towel to scrub them. When we reported it to the staff the said all the suites were under construction and new comforters and curtains will be put in after the remodeling was completed. They were aware of the stains and construction but never told us until we arrived into the room. The hotel seams like it has potential for a really nice stay given its location and good breakfast. Next time we go to Disneyland I'll ask more questions before we book the suite.

Checked into the HJ and I couldn't even stay the whole night. I checked in and when I got to the room there was a hole in the wall. I warned from desk. Then the maintenance guy comes, grab some toilet paper, wet it and sticks it in the hole.. The room had popcorn ceiling and was very moldy it flared up my asthma. I wouldn't return here ever.. They also gave me a hard time at checkout. My wife payed cash for the deposit and they make me go 15 miles to pick her up.

Summary Heading: Great service, great lobby, but upgrade needed.
Summary: The staff in this hotel were efficient and friendly. It has a great foyer, a great onsite shop and an efficient shuttle service to Downtown Disney...but the rooms, the rooms...they are old, tired and dirty. We actually stayed in two rooms in the hotel, the first having a rather large crack in the ceiling. I know they are a busy hotel, but the need to take some of the rooms off line to fix and upgrade them..new carpets, new furniture etc and get some towels that are bigger than a handkerchief,and have some fluff left on them. They also have a server waiting next to the bacon at breakfast to make sure you don't take too much.

My husband & I truly enjoyed our stay here. They had a wonderful heated pool, that was very relaxing and pleasant to swim in. The bed was very comfortable, and the continental breakfast was one of the best we had ever had. Usually it's just cereal and bagels at other hotel's, but the Howard Johnson had hot pancakes, eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes, oatmeal, fruit, muffin's, cereal, coffee, orange & apple juice. It was a very enjoyable stay. We would definitely stay here again.

I stayed 2 nights. The first night, I went to the nearby WalMart to buy flip flops so I could walk from bed to the bathroom. That's how dated and stained the carpet was. Mold in the shower and on walls around mirror, stains on the chair and bedspread, a 25 inch TV from 1980. TV so bad that I could not read the score of a baseball game. No book in the room letting me know where business center, excercise room, channel guide, etc were at.  Next morning I did speak to the front desk and got moved to a much better room but still far below the cleanliness and standards I would expect. 2 ice machines on a property of nearly 500 rooms and one was broken. Very nice  man repairing it went and got ice in the kitchen for me and a manager walking by overheard our conversation and offered to

Summary Heading: It was a good experience except for the internet...
Summary: It was a good experience except for the internet connection. Too slow. And i wish breafast could have a better variety of foods
Staff was friendly, needs were met promptly, breakfast was wonderful, shuttle to Disneyland was reliable and convenient, rooms were clean and spacious.

The front desk staff were very friendly from the moment we walked in. They were very helpful. I had reserved 3 rooms and someone my 3rd room was cancelled and they took care of it with no problem. They were able to get my family and I right next to each other. The hotel was very clean, breakfast was decent. Shuttle was very convenient as well. The only negatives were the Wi-fi was horrible and you cannot take breakfast to your room if you have some one that is unable to come down to the serving area.

Summary Heading: Review Howard Johnson Fullerton Hotel-Conference Center
Summary: I was satisfied with our stay at the Howard Johnson's Fulerton the Buffet Breakfast was nice and George at the Check In Desk was very Helpful and Friendly ...

Summary Heading: In need of a major remodel
Summary: Rooms were old and smelled old. Popcorn ceilings old tube televisions old bathrooms and the air conditioning has a gap in the wall to the outside that you could see theough so im sure there is mold and bugs in the room as well. Will never stay at this hotel again when in anaheim.
During our stay at HJ was awful our room was dirty carpet badly stained and our bedding didn't looked like it was changed . Way over priced for the condition of the room.

Customer service is everything to me, it is why I rated this hotel poorly. Stayed 1st time 4wks ago, couldn't get a good picture on tv at times and carpet had a strong humid smell. 2wks later came back to give them a 2nd try (why not)mentioned last stay, they didn't seem to care because they said/did nothing. Upon check-in, was not asked if I was Wyndham Rewards member. 1 employee at front desk so I waited. FYI-$175 returned deposit  needed upon check-in because its a non-smoking hotel. Aside from my being located across other end of hotel, my room had no ice bucket nor the extra amenities I requested online and the phone in room didn't work. Called front desk with cell to get what I needed. I asked the employee where ice machine located, wasn't sure but to check end hallway on

Summary Heading: not what was shown on the web.
Summary: we were not pleased at all with the hotel, especially the rooms. When I booked on line we booked and paid for 2 rooms. 1 room with 2 queen size beds and 1 room with a king. The hotel that booked us gave us a room with full size beds and they said this hotel they had no queen beds and that we needed to get with the booking company and tell them. Not happy.

Summary Heading: Three nights in a very average hotel.
Summary: This hotel doesn't have any bells or whistles. Let me make a list of good and bad.  Good.  The breakfast is actually a decent set up. (Pancakes,eggs, potatoes, sausage, bacon, fruit)  We went to Disneyland and the free shuttle is a nice perk.  The staff is nice. (other than the women who snapped at me when I said the wifi was terrible. She said its cause there are so many people using it. Mind you this was at 11-1130pm.   Free parking, saw security in parking lot  Price is very fair. You get what you pay for.   Lobby is nice.  BAD  Elevator is a joke. Takes forever. Stopped at floor 3 no matter what.  Wifi was pathetic. Ipad would show a "strong signal" but only was able to open a website once in 3 nights. But it wouldn't go beyond that first page. Basically pretend wifi is
Rooms were clean staff was friendly breakfast was good.

Management was terrible, mean, and extremely rude. Not only did we wait half an hour to be attended, when we finally got to the desk the manager was rude and kept raising his voice at us. You would think after having to wait for so long the management would at least apologize for the wait. You could tell the young man working next to him was embarrassed by the managers attitude. The rooms were filthy! The carpets were sticky and dirty, the walls were dirty and the drapes were covered with white stains. There was no microwave, no mini fridge and the room was extremely small. They give you tickets for breakfast and if you misplace them you have to pay to eat. For $90 a night, terrible service and a dirty room I would have rather have stayed at a Motel 6 for cheaper and cleaner

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disneyland!
Summary: We stayed at Howard Johnson in Fullerton due to it's proximity to Disneyland, the free hot breakfast buffet and the free shuttle to and from Disneyland. It served our purpose perfectly!

very disappointed that the reason we stayed was because of a breakfast on Sunday morning and it was over by 9 a.m...we had a very long day and didn't check in until midnight and check out was noon so why does included breakfast end so early.

Summary Heading: Rooms are outdated, room and hallway needed vacuuming...
Summary: Rooms are outdated, room and hallway needed vacuuming, there was no trash can in bathroom and the ramp to that leads to the bedrooms needs immediate repairs. Breakfast buffet was impressive and made up for the imperfections...
Our stay was memberable. The water in, he pool was nice & warm and the hotel room was large and comfortable. The breakfast was tasty and the staff were very helpful.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you very much for taking the time ans sharing your experience about your recent stay with us. I will share your kind comments with our staff during our daily huddle, as we welcome all feedback in order for us to know what we are doing great, and what areas to improve, and is always satisfying to advise our associates that our guests do notice when they do their job right, as well as when we fail to deliver what our guest come to expect when staying with us. Thank you again, and We hope to see you back soon.  Cordially,  Juan Navarro-Sigala General Manager

Summary Heading: You Get What You Pay For
Summary: I stayed here twice within a week as part of a tour, once on a Friday and the again on Monday and I had two very different experiences. I was bracing myself for a hotel with run down rooms and bad customer service however I could not have been more wrong.  First of all there were two girls at the front desk who were so helpful and polite. I arrived super early and they checked me in as soon as they could and the room I was given was spacious and the bed was SO comfortable. The bathroom was spotless and I couldn't believe the reviews I had read. But then I got there on Monday and it was totally different. One of the ladies checking us in told a gentleman (quite loudly) to go to the back of the queue, which is fair enough but she then allowed three separate people to skip me.

Summary Heading: No complaints. Best hotel for the price,location. Very...
Summary: No complaints. Best hotel for the price,location. Very clean and staff was very accommodating. Would definitely recommend.

Was scared to stay after reading the reviews. But it's okay for night. No doubt the entire hotel including the rooms require a massive overhaul, but its compensated by the friendly frontdesk staff. Avoid if you are looking for aseptic and classy rooms. Strictly for the budget traveller willing to compromise.

Summary Heading: The room was not what I expected!!!
Summary: I was happy with the breakfast. Other I think guests should be aware the tower is under "being remodeled"  the room was not what I expected!!! Don't trust the pictures, I was disappointed!!! I had to continually go down to the desk for more towels, after requeting extra towels in my reservation. No ice machine expected for 2 out of seven floors!!! I personally would recommend staying elsewhere!!! There were problems with WiFi, and random outlets hanging out from the walls, and the alarm clock didn't work!!!

Overall great value and location. Have stayed here numerous times in the past year, hotel has been making improvements and have made a great difference. Hope they continue to update all the outdated areas.

When you walk in the lobby it's like "wow nice" then you go to the building to your room and your like "ugh", very outdated rooms, dirty hallway carpets, No fridge or microwaves, I guess it goes with the value, Ok stay
Everything was good! The staff was really helpfull and attentive to me and my family. Great breakfast, nice pool and cleaning room.

First off, it lacked everything. The walls were dirty, the bathroom was filthy and the bed spread had stains. I purchased my own sheets and left them there. I could only get three channels, when it marketed free HBO. Lights in room worked only if I plugged them in. Curtains had holes in them and I had to stay there two nights.

booked 2 night stay while on our los angeles trip.  For the price and amenities, this was the best hotel  of the trip.. my kids love the pools and their pool was nicely heated and a lot of fun..   As part of the booking , free buffet breakfast was included.. this was much appreciated since we woke up , had breakfast and were on our way to the attractions.  it is out of the way a little,  but it by far makes up for this with what is included.    gets you away from the busy disney area. they do have a shuttle that leaves each hour.

The second floor bathrooms don't have fan vents so the wallpaper was molding and peeling. The elevator kept breaking and there were no easily accessible stairs to the second floor so my family had to walk to another elevator far away from our room to get upstairs. The bedding was stained and the walls definitely needed cleaning. For some reason we kept receiving wake up calls at around 3-4am even though we did not request them.

Stayed here several years ago and notice that HJ has made positive improvements overall. Although check in was hectic-we had requested early check in and had to wait way past normal check in.  We would come back.
Your hotel is nice and good looking. no one told us about where from we get shuttle in Disneyland. So that day we hire taxi to come.

Frank, you night manager was great and upgraded our room. Initially, I booked a King bed but only double beds were available. When Frank heard that my partner and I just got engaged he upgraded us. However, the room was near falling apart...drapes not closing, stains, peeling paint the duvet cover was installed inside out. Hotel key would not work and the cleaning staff didn't speak a bit of English. Further, as I was going down in the elevator a cleaning staff and her cart also entered the elevator. It took her several minutes to get the cart in because the elevator was too small. Although she made it in she left me stuck in the far left corner with no room to move and had to shimmy my way out. Horrible experience over all. Oh, at breakfast, we arrived at 8:58 am and as we were

The first room we were given had a bathroom that had rust and chips around the bathtub, and an area of carpet which looked like there had been a fire on it!!! We switched to another room which had a better looking bathroom but the sink drain control was not connected, the bathtub stopper did not work, and the hot water mixer for the tub did not work with tub and shower not tolerable for a bath or shower. By this time we were too tired to change rooms again and just gave up and slept and then left the next morning without showering. Very, Very disappointing!!!

The hotel has always done a good job over the last 8 years or so that I have visited.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  The rooms are comfortable and well cared for.  The location is excellent for getting around the area.  The breakfast is a nice touch and is in a large room so tables are available.  I did NOT know this was a Wyndham Hotel so I id not give my Wyndham # nor did anyone ask for it.  It was part of a marble show being held at the hotel with a special group rate so maybe that is why.

Started from the moment I checked in.  Yessica at the front desk was a waste of time.   Then they give me a room with two beds instead of one King.   The reason??  They over booked the king room.     When I got upset the answer I was given was to check with expedia because Howard Johnson will not help me.   Wifi sucks.  Towels stained and smelled funny.  And be prepared for staying inside the compound.   Spiked wrought iron fence all around the property.     This is not a place to stay if you have kids.

Summary Heading: OK for just a place to sleep.
Summary: We checked in after midnight after doing a full day at Disneyland. Check in was quick. We walk to our room: the floor smelled of marijuana, but once we get to our room we couldn't smell it. Upon getting to the room we find that one bed was half made. We couldn't be sure that the room wasn't entirely cleaned, and didn't feel comfortable sleeping in this bed, so we went back to the front desk where they promptly apologized and assigned us a new room. At the time it was frustrating due to exhaustion, but in retrospect I appreciate how quick the front desk was about rectifying this.   For two twenty-somethings who just needed a place to sleep for a few hours before heading back to the parks, our stay was just fine. The water pressure and temperature in the showers were AMAZING.

It is nice hotel very near to disney world , free shuttle to disney from hotel,good breakfast , good value for money, nice staff, location is good, love to visit again,near the lobby area room wifi good , but little far no signal. Rest is ok.

....smells bad, nasty room, poor quality all over for the price! Bathroom was clogged, iron dropped all of the water on my clothes (only set i had for the night) had to sit and wait to try to dry them off made me late for my engagement!!!

My family and I choose this hotel when we went on our vacation to Disney.  Pros - 1) decent hot breakfast buffet was included with our stay, but they were limiting people to 2 pieces of bacon so they wouldn't run out.  2) Free shuttle to and from Disneyland always was on time. However,it doesn't  operate from 12-late afternoon but we didn't mind because we were at the park from open to close. CONS 1)Ghetto location.  We walked the short distance to Panda Express the first afternoon and passed by at least 15 homeless people.  2) Our TV didn't work. We called to have it fixed. The guy came and replaced it but just left the broken one outside our door all night in front of our room which we had to move to get the stroller in and out. 3) Air Conditioner broke. It would not blow cold

Summary Heading: I don't even know how to start, the room they gave us was...
Summary: I don't even know how to start, the room they gave us was so bad I had to take pictures, the stains the smell the black hair in the tub, the walls. I have never experienced a bad room before and read online reviews and always thought yeah right... this was THAT bad. The night manager moved us to a better room and TG he calmed me because my feet actually stuck to the carpet in the first room that I was crying. He told us to talk to the manager when we check out and he e-mailed her the pictures. She was not nice and could care less that it had happened and then said what do you expect me to do, I said I don't know I was told to speak with you and she said she would take a % off the first night stay which she credited to my cc. That was nice but honestly if it wasn't for the night

Summary Heading: Loved the free amenities, but more of a motel than a hotel.
Summary: Great experience with a quick stay with my family. The pool area looked great, but we didn't have time to swim. I absolutely loved the amenities - free breakfast buffet, parking, internet, and best of all....free shuttle to Disneyland! I would stay here again if I needed a more affordable hotel stay during our disneyland vacations, but it was more of a motel feel.

I have stayed at the same Howard Johnson before. I came in early on the day of my check in to make sure my guests had acess to the room since I was working late that day. I asked Yesenia for a roll out bed and paid extra. I come to find out at the the time of my arrival which was 11:45pm that there was no roll out bed. I walk to the front counter where a gentleman name George checked the notes and said there was no request for a roll out bed and did not have any. I had my guests slept on my bed and I took the floor. Unfortunately, because of this experience I will no longer book any rooms at the Howard Johnson.

Summary Heading: Ok For the Price, but Nothing Special
Summary: This hotel is ok, but not anything special. The lobby is very spacious, but you can tell immediately that the place is completely out dated. From the dingy looking floors, to the out dated fixtures and furniture, it's reminiscent of days way past. (Like the early 70's. The afternoon staff was just boring at check in. No real enthusiasm at all, like it was just the most boring part of the day. No smile, just too much info about the lady's son that wasn't even relevant to our stay.   I made my reservation on the hotel's website directly, asking for a clean room, with no smoke smell and quiet. Well.... That was NOT what I got. Our room was #200, and it was directly across from the elevator. Definitely not quiet !! As soon as we opened the door, that older smokey hotel smell greeted

My husband, my two teenage kids and I decided to take advantage of the Disneyland SoCal resident tickets to visit the Happiest place on Earth. We have always stayed at either the Grand Californian or the Disneyland Hotel in the past. This time we booked at the last minute and over the Presidents Day weekend so we certainly couldn't afford to stay where we usually stayed in the past. Searching on Hotels.com I came across a deal that I couldn't  pass up.  I booked a standard double room for $71 .00 a night at the Howard Johnson Hotel in Fullerton, which is only 15 minutes away from Disneyland. I initially was very concerned of what to expect since we have never stayed in any Howard Johnson property before.  I'm glad to say, that they truly exceeded my expectations.  Property is

My husband and I stayed here for our Valentine and president day wknd. We had such a pleasant experience. We will definitely go again. It was conveniently located in near Anaheim. The hotel gave free shuttle to Disney. Breakfast was a hot buffet. The pool was nice. They actually have cable tv. The room and bed was comfortable.... the room didn't come with a microwave or fridge. But other than that it was perfect.

Summary Heading: They couldn't find my reservation upon check in
Summary: Good hotel overall and nice rate.  Front desk staff needs to I prove on customer service skills. I would probabaly stay here again.

Summary Heading: Rooms aren't kept in good condition.  Peeling paint on the...
Summary: Rooms aren't kept in good condition.  Peeling paint on the doors and walls.  Shower curtain was stained/dirty. Our shower did not work, had to request another room for the 2nd night stay.  Didn't care for breakfast only good thing was the fruit.

Summary Heading: Great Service and Accomodating for Diverse Crowd from Travel Groups to Conference and Pleasure Guests
Summary: The Front Service was awesome in checking me in and made sure I knew where everything was at in the hotel eventhough I was only staying for 1 night.  The workers are 5 star & hotel is 3 star. For the price of the hotel, it's totally worth staying.

After the bad very reviews I tried to find I different hotel but couldn't so I hoped for the best. I was delighted to see my room looked nothing like the pictures. It seemed to be renovated with a new flat screen TV, new carpet, and bedding. It was very clean and there was no weird smells. The shuttle to Disney does have a very limited schedule, so we drove most  days and the breakfast could be better. Overall I was very pleased and would stay again if I couldn't find a reasonable priced hotel on Harbour( I would rather walk to the parks.)

I agree with many other travellers here that the hotel is in need of repair- however when I was there they did have some signs of renovation going on, but what they were doing- not sure! The rooms themselves are average, but do seem to be relatively clean. The TVs are quite old and not many extras such as fridges etc.   My main concern with this hotel is the "free wifi" they advertise. During check-in we asked if there was free wifi, only to be yelled at across the lobby "did you hear that, we have free wifi?". No, there isn't free accessible wifi in the room- thats for sure! We were on the second level and the reception was basically nothing. I never loaded a page on my iPhone! While it worked fine in the lobby, guests aren't going to be camping in the lobby just to access the

Summary Heading: The manager and staff at the hotel are always helpful and...
Summary: The manager and staff at the hotel are always helpful and friendly. Perfect location near downtown fullerton. As well as  stores/resturants walking distance. The breakfast in A.M. Is fine too!

I only stayed the night her with my daughter. The bed was comfortable. The TV worked well. The room was clean. The weekday rate was excellent for this type of Hotel. The employees were friendly. Breakfast was great. the only thing I can find to slightly complain about is the room was not completely shut when we first got to it. It was a bit eerie to open the door without the keycard. We went in with the door open and looked around before we shut and locked it. It was safe and everything else was great.

Summary Heading: Caliber of accommodations did not match expectations of a Wyndham property
Summary: Peeling paint, stinky hallways, peeling wallpaper balanced by a decent breakfast.  Although if I'd had to pay the $9.95 for breakfast it would have not been worth it  1:30am fire alarm. Very disconcerting.

Clean with hot breakfast, helpful staff, 15minutes to Disney\walk to namm by hourly shuttle. Carpets old and repaired,hallway shabby in tower. Tower ice machines broken, security door to tower broken, not much in security cameras. Pool and grounds clean. Owner not reinvesting but staff hardworking. Free parking. Good restaurants up the road by the Fullerton railway station. WiFi.

The hotel is under construction.  A very much needed construction. The elevator in the "tower building" always stops on the third floor (whether you want to or not).The breakfast is free and it's worth every penny. The eggs were warm.  The French toast was chewy. The toaster did not toast the bread on the first pass.

This facility is basically a dump. A once lovely property it is badly in need of maintenance and remodeling.No ice machines, worn, very uglycarpeting, dingy walls, 1950's TV's, minimal old furnishings. I've been coming here once a year for a trade show since before HJ bought the property and it feels like HJ is just letting it go to pot. The free full breakfast is a nice try but the Denny's up the street is a better value. Given that the clientele is mostly geared to Disneyland visitors and heavily foreign tour groups I can understand the non-caring attitude but I'd never stay there voluntarily.

Summary Heading: first stay at a Howard Johnson
Summary: check in was fast and the staff was informative on my questions. I liked the breakfast and fresh fruit.

Were checked into a room that wasn't even clean, The beds weren't even made. The phone didn't work. The fire alarm kept going off in spurts. Finally we had to evacuate our room around 1am...with no explanation as to what the heck was going on.

Room could have been cleaner- older in need of renovation.  Furniture well worn.  Common areas very nice, and breakfast was excellent.  Made reservations thru AAA for 2 nites.  Did not realize it was a prepay until we got there and hotel could not give a receipt.  We had something come up and wanted to leave after first night, but could not because of prepay.  It was through some 3rd party website due to contract with AAA and Howard Johnson.  Became very disgruntled first when AAA told us we'd have to talk to hotel and make arrangements with them.  The hotel passed the buck to the 3rd party website and would not contact them or help us at all. Thus we had to cancel our appointment and stay the extra night.  Will not stay at a Howard Johnson's again.  Last time(years ago) we

Loved having breakfast every morning!  The room was comfortable.  Located less than five miles from Disneyland--can take Harbor straight there.  The hotel is only slightly worn down, but you cannot beat the price.  Staff is super friendly and accommodating.

Summary Heading: Old and dirty... With a friendly staff
Summary: Stayed for two nights in this hotel just to enjoy Disneyland. Rooms are dirty and smelly. Very old, doesnt see renovation since the 80s probably. Breakfast is bad... Yet decent. However, there is a shuttle every now and then to Disney and staff in desk was great. Specially Frank. He helped me to get tickets for Disney, printed them in the office and helped me call the next destination (LA) for car rentals.

Don't stay here.  The rooms are old, musty smelling and the property is in dire need to a remodel.  Pay the extra $10-15 and stay elsewhere.  Website is very misleading and stated nothing about breakfast vouchers (2 per room).  Then when you actually get to the breakfast, it's a huge disappointment.  I witnessed staff eating food in the area near the kitchen doors rather than serving the guests and making sure the breakfast items were stocked.  The shot glasses they give you for juice, etc. is embarrassing.  It's obvious this property is trying to cut corners but sadly at the paying guests expense.  Close down this location and do a serious remodel and staff training!!!
It was a good value but there was some sort of odor in the hallways on the floor I stayed on.

the front desk was great. friendly, helpful, courteous.  The only part of our room that I loved was the bed. Extremely comfortable. The rest of the room was at or below average. A makeshift shelf next to the sink was odd. The wall paper in parts of the room was blistering due to the bathroom not having a fan. Parts of it were just odd. Fortunately, we did not need to spend a lot of time in the room, just a place to sleep. I rate this "very good" instead of average because of their great complimentary breakfast. That, besides the bed, was the best part. delicious, plenty of food.

The front desk staff that checked me in was rude. There was no reason to start an argument over breakfast coupons. 1 room had no hot water and we weren't even compensated for it or apologized to. I've stayed here before and it's never been this bad, it's become a motel 6 status

The property needs updating and general maintenance, with a focus on the HVAC system, improved beds, fixtures and lighting in the rooms. Incredibly basic accommodations that lack the comfort that Howard Johnson is known for. Stayed here due to wedding we were attending.Would only stay here again if absolutely necessary.  Pros: Location, free parking, free breakfast, extremely nice staff, clean, shuttle to Disneyland, rugs and linens are updated.  Cons: Uncomfortable squishy bed, when laying on it, our heads were much lower than our feet (room 226), noisy [you can hear everything in the next rooms and corridor], ice machine only on 1st floor, small and very slow elevator, it is obvious they have hard water and shower faucet was covered in unsightly hard water deposits, same for
The carpet was worn and the tv was a crt! But everything else was fine and the breakfast was better than it had to be.

Summary Heading: Room was too chilly because the window was broken or had...
Summary: Room was too chilly because the window was broken or had some space from where cold air was coming in.

When I stay at hotels, I go with zero expectations as to not be let down. The Howard Johnson managed to still be lower than my zero expectations.   Hotel rooms in general are not the nicest places in the world. However, I at least would like to see some effort to make it comfortable.   My biggest critique is of the atrocious choice of art pieces hanging in the room.  First of all, the locations of these pieces was not one bit intuitive or pleasing. One large piece on the wall you cannot even see from the entrance. Two small pieces over one bed. At least be symmetrical. They made the entirety of the room displeasing to look at. Not to mention the acid-washed, striped, salmon wallpaper.   Secondly, these pieces of so called "art" were disgustingly hard to look at. Pastels mixed
The hotel was very clean, the staff were very friendly, and it was easy access to Disneyland and some of the other attractions near by at a very reasonable rate.
I love coming to this hotel friendly receptionist . Great breakfest in the morning. We absolutely just love it. Would go anywhere else while visiting disneyland.

Summary Heading: Great Price for a Good Stay
Summary: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights with my boyfriend.I booked this hotel because it was 2 miles away from DisneyLand. The front desk named Sean was really nice. They offered a shuttle to the park, however they had scheduled times for the pick up and drop off. It was perfect for me because I hopped onto the first shuttle at 8am since the park opened it at that time. But for coming back to the hotel, the last pick up was 11:15. So for the people that wanted to stay at the park til it closes at 12am you would have to find your way back. The complimentary breakfast was just okay, I liked their biscuits and saved an apple for the park. The beds were comfy and a big bathroom which was nice. The tv was out dated but had good shows and movies playing. I was a little shocked to wake up

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for!
Summary: Marginal at best.  Very noisy rooms (plumbing), dirty bathroom (grout, floor, etc.), hairs on the sheets upon arrival, pillows not supportive, carpet soiled, not enough towels for the number of people in the room, shuttle run down and driver lacking any warmth, breakfast just okay.

Summary Heading: Older hotel with good proximity to Disneyland. No frills.
Summary: We stayed in this hotel for two nights with our two young children. The advantages are the proximity to Disneyland, only 2.2 miles, the friendly staff and the clean room. On the down side this is an older building so the walls are a bit thinner. We would also like to have had a refridgerator even if it was a small one. Also the breakfast left much to be desired. We nearly always have the standard hot breakfast available when we travel (eggs, pancakes, fruit, etc) but this time it was cold and chewy. Anyone looking for a no frills hotel that is clean and has a friendly staff should be satisfied.
Enjoyed the fact that we could do a Late Checkout and the included Breakfast was wonderful..A Real Breakfast!

The only advantage of staying in the hotel is that it is nearby to Disneyland and has got free shuttles to and Fro to it.  Apart from that, a very boring breakfast(same old bread, muffins, potatoes, scrambled eggs)... we tasted the same in our 4 day stay :(.  The room facilities and exterior decor as well as the room itself and the lobby area and the building looks like they havent been painted for ages, even the facilities are that of age old time. Plus they charge you extra for Oven... Oh common, after having spend around 70$ a night, you ppl charging me for microwave oven that too 14$ a night???? really???  The bathroom accessories, the door locks, bed,lamps,coffe maker, etc... all that of age old time.  Still like i said it serves you free breakfast and has free shuttle
Quiet, clean comfortable, good food, complementary shuttle to Disney, friendly staff. Will stay here again in the future.

our room was filthy, carpets were very dirty, bedspread has cigarette burns and looks about 25 years old.  I checked out immediately and found something else.  I refused to stay here.  it's a low rent rendezvous.  my son's room had ants and crawling things in it and they were moved to a different room but not much better. the carpet had a big piece cut out and a piece put in and it was all frayed around the edges.  right beside the bed.
3-star rooms.  4-star breakfast.  This is a nice place to stay.  My family and I enjoyed the property for 4 nights on a Disney Vacation.  Excellent staff!

Where can I begin first of all this was my wedding suite. On 11/29 and 11/30  I booked, I am very unhappy with the condition of the room we received . The phone to our room wasn't working, the lights in the hallway flickered all night. I called the maintenance staff they couldn't fix it ? The carpets where dirty . The sheets looked stained! I'm upset I was never offered another room this was suppose to be my honeymoon suite ... I'm not happy

Summary Heading: Did not like look of motel,,looks like it needs a face lift...
Summary: Did not like look of motel,,looks like it needs a face lift from the inside.. Was there last year, looks like in one year it hasnt changed.. Entry doors not working in back, needs  paint job an new carpet.. Ply wood covering hole on floor was not safe, was lefted up from floor an could cause an accident

The hotel has undergone renovations.  The lobby is brighter with less clutter.  The smell of smoke comes from the large ballroom when there is a party or event there.  The no smoking policy is not well enforced. The food at the breakfast has been updated and there is a better selection and people there to help you.  That is an improvement.  The room was not right and after a call to the front desk we were moved with no problem to a room that was just fine.  There were no excuses given, they were not able to fix the problem and we were asked if we would be willing to move. Genuine concern for the issue and a quick courteous solution. That has also been the case in the past. They look for solutions that suit the customer, not the staff.  The issue that could not be helped was the

The only part of this hotel that look good is the lobby. Very deceiving. The breakfast is great! Parking is free! No wifi. The water stays hot when you want to take a shower. This place really need upgrading! The carpet need to replaced. I will not stay here again.

Summary Heading: Have stayed at this hotel in the past, looks like there is...
Summary: Have stayed at this hotel in the past, looks like there is some new ownership, as the lobby and breakfast area have had some updates.  they have gotten rid of a lot of the goddy clutter and painted some areas.  Needs to continue with the updates to include new carpet and flooring though out and updating of guest bedrooms and bathrooms.  Great value for what you pay and easy to get to Disneyland.

unsafe room needs updates with the smell of mold very strong in the restroom and our balcony was wide open when we came  back from our day at disneyland not just a crack half way open someone had been going through our stuff we reported it but the front desk said sorry well put it in our notes so we were left with two towels for 4 so we had to keep asking every morning for more...when we checked out of the hotel again we told them about our room it had been left open someone had been there they said we didnt know why do they ignore people when theres complaints about those types of issues we will  not be back to any howard johnson hotels or whyndome properties for that matter the issue will not get resolved..

The staff (with the exception of the assistant manager, bald short man, rude and condescending) was excellent and extremely helpful to all of us. After check in, I took a shower and found that the valve was leaking around center which resulted in my hand getting a very minor burn from the hot water leaking out of the bottom of it. After the shower, I turned on the TV to find only "snow" on the screen. (BTW.. The toilet tank flapper apparently needed to be replaced as the toilet would periodically refill itself which was quite annoying) I phoned to the front desk about the TV as I had nothing to do at that point. She said that they would have a person come to check on it in about 45 minutes. It seemed like it was more than 45 minutes but I heard a noise outside of my room and saw

Great price, considering the location. But in the future I will definitely spend more in order to get a better experience. The staff was unfriendly, the breakfast was awful (they managed to serve bacon with no flavor whatsoever!) and extremely disorganized, and the whole place was just old feeling.
Booked online. Enjoyed accessibility without discomfort, really enjoyed breakfast. Simple and inviting.

Stayed for two nights, booked through Expedia. Front staff was friendly and even upgraded my room to a balcony room overlooking the pool. They also helped me by printing some work documents and saved me from having to go to staples. The general areas including hallways seemed a little dated but there was construction/painters during my stay. Overall the room was clean, comfy and had wifi and cable programming, the pool looked a little cold this time of year (would be great if they had a Jacuzzi). I would definitely come back.
Carpet was damp when first walking in  Heater was turned on instead of AC  The alarm for the alarm clock was wrong  Room and decor around hotel was dusty
Room was clean, friendly staff, good breakfast but the whole hotel smelled like mold and had a light haze in the hallways.

Summary Heading: I wish this hotel the best
Summary: Very nice and helpful employees. Nice property location and nice swimming pool. Room was horrible. I was told there is new owner. If I ever decide to return, I will ask if ALL rooms were repaired prior making reservation. We had 3 cockroaches in the bathroom within 48 hours...

Summary Heading: Trying hard to be something it isn't
Summary: We stayed here because it came up as a great deal on Hotwire (so it named the hotel and gave the rating).  It was supposed to be a 3-star hotel, but the experience was anything but that.  The rating is certainly not based on the rooms they give to people who booked through Hotwire..  The staff was friendly, but seemed annoyed by my questions, and that I had booked online for a significant discount.  Upon checkin, we were given a "tower" room.  The elevator that services the tower was extremely slow (there is one elevator for all of the rooms in the tower, we waited more than 10 minutes), so we packed everything up 3 flights of stairs.    In the room, the air conditioner buttons did not work, and we could not get the unit to come on.  The TV volume was turned clear up, but we
The breakfast and staff were nice. Location needs some updates, and the rooms were "clean". 15 minutes from Disney and free shuttle to it as well.

The employees are very friendly and helpful! This hotel is clean and our room was big enough with a king, full, and a cot to comfortably fit 4 adults and one child.  We all had a comfortable sleep.  It did not have the 'extras" like a blowdryer or coffee/tea pot in the room.  It shows definite wear and tear and needs to be updated.  Overall a good stay but I would pay a little extra to stay in a nicer hotel next time.
The only issue we had was the pool had not been skimmed - lots of bugs in the water.  Otherwise - very refreshing in the 98 % weather.

DO NOT STAY HERE!  No matter how cheap this appears, I wouldn't let someone else's dog stay at this place.  I did not get to experience any other rooms but ours was horrific.  As usual we signed a waiver stating if we smoke we pay a fine, understood from a non-smokers perspective.  Walked into the room and was punched in the face by old cigarette smoke and must.  Kind of like a moldy ashtray, as my wife would describe.  As soon as we turned on the lights we noticed more and more upsetting details.  There were two large red stains in the carpet that looked like blood or like someone had a water gun fight with red wine.  There was a 1/2 inch cigarette burn in the comforter,  a missing lightbulb from one of two lights in the room, a dark and short, curly hair between the sheets and

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for.
Summary: Cheap hotel. Very old and there were dirty carpets, elevator and walls. There were pictures in the hallway with frames that were broken and missing. My TV did not work. The maintenance man can and said "I can't fix this but here is what you need to do to watch TV". He than showed me a five step process to watch TV.  I would not feel safe having my wife stay here by herself.

The friendly staff was very helpful when I checked in to my room. They accommodated me when I asked for a later check out time. My room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. Also it was right next to a great bar where I have my high school 20th reunion. I would so stay here again.

This hotel was disgusting. The rooms smelled musty/moldy and were in a horrible state. Our bathroom counter was coming off the wall and the walls and artwork were all water damaged. The only good thing about this hotel was the free shuttle to and from Disneyland. The free breakfast was alright, but I'd much rather have paid to eat somewhere else, like Denny's.

The front desk was not helpful at all! Every time we needed towels, they only had a few and never any wash clothes - they couldn't help with transportation.  The room smelled terrible and was humid constantly. All of our clothes smelled like mildew. The beds and floors were filthy. The shuttle to Disneyland only took you from 9-11 & 5-10 which wasn't very convenient if you want an afternoon break. We tried to take the public bus system but they had no idea how to help us with that. Would never recommend this hotel to anyone!!!!

To sum it up: smelly floors (3rd flr) really cheap and super filthy carpet, especially in font of the elevator. The breakfast was almost as bad, very cheap quality food but it's expected I guess because it's free. The shuttle to Disneyland and back was great. I will never use this place again. Sorry....

This hotel was a very good choice for an affordable hotel near all the attractions in Anaheim.  They had shuttle service to the Disneyland locations which we used twice. Once to go to downtown Disneyland and once to go to Disneyland. The shuttle was easy and convenient.  The Howard Johnson also has a great breakfast buffet that has something for everyone. They even accommodate the visitors from other countries with a few different cuisines which we enjoyed trying. The girls loved the pool and I loved the comfy lounges by the pool where I could enjoy watching them swim.  A great family hotel that I highly recommend.

Pros: The room, bathroom, and pool were quite clean. We were able to check in early which was a bonus.   Cons: There was no coffee pot in the room despite having bagged coffee grounds in the bathroom. We wanted to see if we could check in early, so I called the contact number listed on expedia for the hotel. I spoke to someone who stated I must call the hotel directly for this help. She then proceeded to tell me about a promotion that includes hotel coupons and vouchers, when I responded "No, thanks", she kept saying that it is very easy to sign up for and would not take a long time. When I asked her if this would cost me anything, she did not answer the question and stated that I should sign up anyways. She immediately transferred me to another women who finally told me that

Summary Heading: the room would benefit from updates specifically the carpet...
Summary: the room would benefit from updates specifically the carpet flooring. I had an allergic reaction to dustmites bite and i still have the bites. Due to old carpeting, the overall smell of the room is not pleasant as well. The staff members are nice.

So, basically they hold 100$ til you check out and credit it back in a few days, and breakfast is complimentary for 2 people only, but when you have a family for vacation that really adds up, I think it was 9.00 for adults, 6.00 for kids, which they don't tell you until you check in! The breakfast was not worth that at all, you might as well go to a breakfast at Dennys for that same price.  Also the elevator permit was expired! The rooms were not accommodating at all by the lobby, they only had 2 elevators so they were always packed, the staff was courteous and maids, that's all id give it, at the end of our trip we lost tickets for breakfast because they were so small, and I asked the front desk, she asked" what room are you in"? I told her my room #, then she said no we don't
Amazing price! My family stayed 3 nights. Free shuttle to Disneyland was great. Breakfast was not good, but coffee, cereal and bacon was ok, and Free. Room was clean and you can't beat the price!!

Summary Heading: Shabby not chic - not worth the low rate
Summary: Booked a package on Travelocity that included this hotel - I hesitated booking reading the variety of poor reviews.  I opted on price and the perks of free parking, free wi-fi, free (so-so) breakfast, and close to Disneyland.  On arrival I was surprised by the location - looked nice, well lit, and shopping/Starbucks/decent gas stations nearby and off freeway.  The lobby and pool area looked nice.  This is an older hotel - needed a good renovation about 20-30 years ago.  Signage at check in states that they are operated outside of Howard Johnson and how they keep use of that name I have no clue.  My room was on the 7th floor and was very clean.  The shabbiness others described is accurate - peeling wall paper, stained carpets, peeled cabinet tops, older style televisions.  Bed

First of all, let me say, "Sorry.", to my Asian friends who bought a tour package  and this hotel was your given place to stay.  This group make up most of the guests that you will see in the hotel.  This is a low budget, older hotel that is in sore need of a renovation. At two and a  half stars this hotel is OVER-RATED.  We were upgraded and given a tower room.  The elevator ride to the fifth floor was breath-taking.  We literally help our breathe hoping and praying that this box of junk would make it up to the floor. I wish I could have avoided the elevator but I am in a wheelchair. I would constantly encounter people that had started on the 2nd, 3rd, or 4th floors that pushed the down first foor button that ended up going UP before going down.  Our room was musty, small and

It was the worse.  If u want sleep don't stay here.  Its by the freeway and rooms are not sound proof.  You will hear every car, truck, rig, bus that drives by it.  We were there for 5 days.  1st day, tv and bathroom vent were not working.  Second day air conditioner was not working.  3rd and 4th day our rooms were not clean. They look on there files that maids turned in and it said they were cleaned.  They argued as if I was the one lying.   I went both days to speak to manager and manager was never available.  Manager was always off during complains.  As I'm complaining, others were there also complaining.  When I when to complain they said that there someone to service our room.  What that meant was all they were doing is bringing towels to our room.  What kind of service is

Summary Heading: The beds were comfortable. Room was clean. Bathtub could...
Summary: The beds were comfortable. Room was clean. Bathtub could use a good bleaching. Hotel needs more ice machines.
BBBadddd experience!!! My room did not have the AC working, there was n o ice in the entire complex, the computer(only one) in the "business center" did not work.

I have stayed at this hotel for many years and it is getting run down.  It needs to be updated throughout.  The updated tower had to have been updated more than 7 years ago and has had a lot of traffic through it since whenever the update was.  I have stayed for its location to Fullerton.  I think it is now time to look elsewhere.

Arrival experience was fine.  Front desk staff were friendly and efficient.  Room was disappointing.  Bed comfort was OK and cleanliness was OK, but there were several large, unsightly stains in the carpet, and one of the drapes was torn.  Hotel overall is older and in need of attention around the edges.  Doorways and elevator doors exhibit numerous scratches, scuffs, and missing paint that gave the interior hallways somewhat of a dingy, run-down feel.  None of the security gates that supposedly require a room key to gain entry to the hotel grounds actually worked, so anyone off the street could get right to your room door unnoticed.  We stayed here because of its proximity to Disneyland and a low rate, so we didn't spend much time in the hotel other than to sleep and eat

Summary Heading: This is a horrible place to stay!
Summary: First let me start off by saying that I try and see good in most things and am generally very forgiving, this is my exception (read my other reviews).  The outside of this hotel appeared to be nice upon arrival.  Front desk staff was pleasant but seemed clueless.  Gave us the first room and we immediately went back for an exchange.  Second room felt like a jail cell.  Third room in the higher tower was better but they forced us to pay an additional $30/day more but gave us a special "deal" for $11/day more.  Hallways are filthy and in bad need of repair.  Elevators are worn out.  Room was decent is size but clearly upon walking in you say to yourself "what have I just done?"  Beds are well worn and our bedspread has blood stain's on it.  TV's are the old tube style.  Furnishings

Conditions of this hotel were very poor.  Run down, unclean.  Free breakfast was disappointing with nothing healthy like yogurt, fruit or oatmeal.  I have never been asked for a $100 room deposit before checking in.  Said a lot about issues here.  Then computers were down when I left, couldn't print receipt.

This hotel is on an impressive piece of property. The landscaping is beautiful, multiple conference rooms... but nothing updated since the 1980's??? The curtains in my room were torn and they didn't close. There was mold in the bathroom. It looked like there were construction crews in the adjacent rooms for the two weekdays I was there, but I didn't see any evidence of updates in my room. Maybe I was a week too early for the updates!

My photos will tell it all.  Just left this morning.  ROOM:   tube TV (not flat screen) with blurry picture.  Moldy curtain above the a/c.  The patio door felt like it weighed a ton, was very difficult to open/close.  You had to put all your weight behind it to get it to move.  Patio furniture on the balcony was very heavy, when anyone else nearby moved theirs, you could hear the dragging.  Noticeable stains on the bedspread.  Very small pillows.  Light bulbs installed in the lamps were way too bright (start out dim, then brightens when warmed up).  Large hole in the seat of the office chair.  HORRIBLE cell phone reception.  Had to step out on the patio to make/receive calls.  No microwave or refrigerator (you have to pay extra).  BATHROOM:  Thin scratchy towels.  No fan in the

Told at desk to use a 3rd party for best rate. Microwave/refrigerator $11.00/day each. One ice machine for 4 floors. Elevator so slow took stairs for 4 days. Caters primarily to Asians tourists. No variety for breakfast.

I stayed there June 23 /2014 and I paid with My Debit card, the room with charge had to be $113.00 but they charge my card $623.14, I called 4 times and e-mailed twice, they did not answer the e-mails and when I call them each time put me on hold to 20 min them picked up the phone and again put me on hold for another 20 min, this was going on each time I called to asked them whey they charged my card 590.00 more then what they should, I am still trying to get hold of someone and I guess I am going to call me back account after all to dispute the charges,   David K.

The hotel is just awful. Smelly, dirty room with ants (!!) on a floor. Lots of noise from the highway all night. TV had no sound, hotel staff was very unfriendly and charged us for a kids breakfast (even it was marked as included on hotels.com when I booked). And later what - the breakfast itself is awful too. Never stay there again!

I wanted the hotel for one night and I got charged 117 and the room didn't have a microwave or a fridge why don't you have those items at a price like .second of all the cleaning crew shouldn't knock and super fast open the door while I'm inside I woke up very disturbed by that action that I immediately left and I needed a goodnight rest for my lifeguard training in the morning never going back there again .

A nice property, great location, close to a lot.  Having lived in the area for years I've seen the property change hands a few times.  The service and breakfast are great.  The (full) breakfast is in the restaurant so it's made in an actual kitchen.  The property and rooms are fantastic with very comfortable beds which are new with granite countertops in the bathroom.  The furniture I thought was nice, a lighter wood and the desk was wide (from side to side as well as front to back) which is nice if you need room to spread out.  The room is a good size, no stand to put my suitcase on though.  the closet posed a challenge, probably not able to lay my suitcase flat to get clothes in/out.  The property does need updating though.  Although the property and rooms are clean, things
The hotel stay was okay. We enjoyed the breakfast, the pool and shuttle to Disneyland. The some of the rooms smelled and did not look like they were cleaned thoroughly.
Nice place to stay.  Rooms were clean and well taken care of.  I am a person of few words but this place was well worth  the money.

I planned a trip to Disneyland, and knowing how much money I would spend there, I opted for a cheaper hotel preferably with a shuttle to and from the park. So I found this one. I was a little scared at first because of all the terrible and poor reviews this hotel received. I thought I would give it a shot anyhow, because the price was right. I was pleasantly surprised. At check in, the staff was very friendly and accommodating. We stayed 4 nights, but we did have to put down a deposit of $200 for incidentals, which was a surprise, but I understand. The hotel advertised free breakfast, but please make a note that it only includes 2 people. The rest of your party have to pay. Its not listed on the website, however it should be. We proceeded to our room on the fourth floor, room
The air went out in my room, I woke up at night to spiders on the ceiling. Was unhappy with my stay.

Rooms were nice size and clean with comfy beds, but no microwave, free breakfast is only for 2 persons with same menu repeated, kids or family members are charged for breakfast even if you are triple/quadruple sharing. Disney free shuttle is good and timely but does not run from 11 to 5, Free wi-fi is good, Overall economical and ok.

Summary Heading: Gave is a different room then was reserved.
Summary: The room we got was not the room we reserved! The room was dirty and blankets had suspicious stains. Was no where near worth what they charged.  We were told by the front desk that we could get what we had reserved for $30 more, then after we said we'd pay they changed it to $60. Luckily we were able to get full refund through expedia

They advertise a free breakfast but the truth is they give you two tickets and charged my children. They charged one as an adult. They offered only the basics and had a staff member guarding the sausage and bacon to keep you from taking too much. The hotel is very aged. They have timers on the A/C so the room doesn't get cool enough to sleep. I kept waking up in a pool of sweat after it shut off, over and over again. The front desk and management was oblivious (or just plain didn't care) that the room wasn't comfortable. The other staff was very polite except for the lady running the breakfast, she was rude. There were no ice machines that we could find. There were signs for vending and ice that led us to vending but no ice. The pool towels were covered with women in bikinis

Summary Heading: It was an OK place to stay
Summary: When you book online the features and   amenities are a little different then what they really offer... the rooms online that they show and view are totally different-bedding if not the same-not very comfortable! it features complimantary breakfast for guest; but doesn't specify that its only for two guest even when you booked for several guests- and any additional guests have to pay $10 each for breakfast at hotel... where the food comes out cold and there is not a whole lot of variety- Not worth paying $10- There were several issues with the hotel - The first day be checked in when we walked in to room- There was no running water - They failed to mention any problems. So we had to wait a while for water...and lastly the elevators weren't workin properly I found myself and

The hotel was in a good location to Disneyland,which is why I chose this hotel. The room was fine and the staff was very good. I must say that I was disappointed in the shuttle service and advertised "free" breakfast! The shuttle service hours do not fit the overall schedule of your guests. Check in isn't allowed until 3pm, yet there is a long lag time to get shuttle service to Disneyland!!! There is a morning schedule that ends at 11:00am and than not again until 5:pm. When you are traveling with children, you do not want to wait two hours to get a shuttle to Disneyland!! Also the free breakfast, upon making your reservations, it is clear how many people are in your party. So to offer only two free meals is really unfair! No where is that advertised in you list of hotel

The front desk is so rude and had horrible service there managment team should be embarrassed.  Never stay here!!! The promote free breakfast and thats a lie they charge you for it .. think befor you book here

This hotel offers a "free" breakfast however they charge family members for it.    Even when the manager was shown the booking in writing he refused to honor it.    They provided no hand towels, almost all the TV stations were in Spanish and the pool towels were a Mexican band with a woman with a handcuff around her neck.   Customer service ranged from poor to down right rude.
This hotel is not like they embri√≥n on their website. Curtains are ripped, no airflow in the bathroom. Carpets really old not as expected and bad customer service.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: We had an unexpected stay in Fullerton and booked this hotel last-minute.  We usually stay at Hilton properties, but decided to opt for the HoJo this time to save a little money and for it's proximity to where we needed to be in the morning.  After our visit, we will most definitely pay the extra $50 to stay at the Hilton!  The front desk staff were very friendly and check-in was easy.  I guess this hotel is used to having a different sort of clientele because they made us pay a refundable $75 deposit up front.  We did get this back in the morning but most hotels just keep a card on file an don't actually charge you unless you accrue expenses/damages.  Luckily they booked us in a separate building from the very loud parties that were going on in the main building.  This hotel
Nice size room but no flat screen tv or refrigerator.  Full breakfast included. Close to Disneyland.

Our family stayed here to save money on a Disneyland trip and wished we would have stayed elsewhere. Rooms were dirty with crumbs on floor, spots on walls, and mold. Breakfast was gross. Front desk attendant Elizabeth was very rude, and our key to our room locked us out 2 times. I wasn't going to let the dirty room ruin our trip so chose not to complain but when all you want is a room to come back to for the night after a busy day at disneyland and sleeping children, and you get locked out, it was horrible. Our children woke up when we had to trek down to the office and get a new key that worked to get us into our room. This happened two nights. When we talked to front staff(Elizabeth) she said it was probably our fault for putting it against credit cards. We had the key in an

I have stayed here 2x before without issues.This time I was charged twice for my room. I called the hotel upon my return home to settle the situation. They informed me that they only charged me once. This was after telling me they charged me a No-show fee. Well, my reservation was for one night and I stayed one night! No-show?? My bank is investigating on my behalf. I think this property allows long term tenants, some strange and questionable people around. It does have a nice pool and has the lowest price around. I think I'm going to spend a few extra $$ next time and not "hope" that things are better at this property.
Check-in was not satisfy. I got my reservation through HoJo.com  one week early and i got handicap room at 9:00pm.

This hotel is terrible.  Room was dingy, with stained carpets throughout.  Found several pieces of dried fruit on one of the beds.  Internet was criminally slow.  Huge bus depot with massive tour buses full of tourists taking up all the space.  I had to sleep on the bath towel, which was the only thing verified to be clean.  Not worth the $95 bucks charged AT ALL.  Thank god it was only one night, for business.

Summary Heading: very disappointing. computer was down and it took 1/2 hr to...
Summary: very disappointing. computer was down and it took 1/2 hr to get a room assignment. Once in the room had to call for mainenance , TV remote totally  dead, and toliet would not stop running. Mtnce came got the remote working minus the CC and Sleep timer. tempy 1 flush fix on toliet. Desk said they would change our room BUT computer still a problem, Stayed in room removed toliet tank cover and adjusted after each flush...............

Summary Heading: It was filthy and even the room with "new" carpet was infested with ants!
Summary: Clean up your act! You don't represent anything nice about staying Howard Johnson Hotel more like staying at a dirty Motel 6. Don't stay at Howard Johnson Fullerton that's my advice. I was quoted one rate over the phone including my owner discount and billed at a different rate when we checked out.

My children stayed at this hotel with their school group.  On arrival, the hotel had not prepared the rooming lists they were given so after a 7 hour bus ride, the students had to wait in the bus for another hour while the hotel sorted their rooms out.  The rooms were of a very low standard.  The quality of everything from the linens to the furniture was poor to begin with and worn out and dirty on top of that.  The carpet, mattress and linens had unidentifiable stains and the coffee cups had mold in them.  On the day of arrival, a group of a dozen girls got stuck in an elevator for 30 minutes.  The chaperones advised the front desk who called the fire station for help.  Not one hotel employee ever came to the elevator to assess the situation or offer assistance and no one

Summary Heading: Hotel looks descent from the outside, once inside it seems...
Summary: Hotel looks descent from the outside, once inside it seems like you traveled back in time. Room was dusty, paint was chipping off various places and doors and door frames looked like they been repainted a few dozen times.

During check in, we are a family of four and they were only giving us 2 breakfast tickets, because they said that in our reservation we only put two people, we told them that we use their facility at least once a month and we never have an issue with this, they really gave us a hard time about it,  they also asked about the ages of our children, we told them 4 and 12, they said that my daughter was counted as an adult we told them that in the web sited it says that 18 years and younger stays free.  They gave us a hard time and gave us attitude about this issue, it was a bad checked in experience, we have never experience this.

I was amongst family & friends. My camera was stolen off our table, had my name, phone number & Address on it. The staff did not turn it in. My family would have known it was mine and given it back if they found it. Obviously it was an employee at your hotel who was cleaning up afterwards. Very disappointed, especially since all my info was on it.

Not a bad stay if you're just looking for the bare basics, and something cheap. The wifi is slow, the service is friendly but VERY understaffed, the rooms were clean but old, the breakfast was better than continental but cold and not great for vegans, parking was good.  The gift store has an ugly "God Bless America" poster in the window and looks like one of those cheap touristy stores in Hollywood.  Bathroom has no ventilation.

Summary Heading: I had a really great experience! It was a very beautiful...
Summary: I had a really great experience! It was a very beautiful hotel and the staff was very friendly! Overall a wonderful weekend!

I got the conference rate of $70, which is about as good as it gets around Disneyland. The free breakfast bar was mediocre, with good potatos but rubbery "scrambled" eggs.  Otherwise, this hotel was fine.

Summary Heading: I was in room 136 which was connected to 137 and children...
Summary: I was in room 136 which was connected to 137 and children stayed in 137 and they were a bit loud and attempted to get into my room through that door and woke me up - so sound proofing between rooms is not the best.
Property is old, not inviting - skip the free buffet, actually avoid the hotel all together - tried to find a redeeming quality but really i cant think of onr

Summary Heading: Better than a lot of the alternatives.
Summary: There are definitely closer, cheaper options closer to Disneyland, but this place is really worth it. The breakfast can get a bit boring if staying more than s couple of days but considering its free we had no complaints. The rooms are quite and the staff is really professional. We did not take the shuttle to Disneyland but based on our parking situation I would highly recommend it. The rooms are very clean except for the carpet but that's expected out of an older hotel. It is really close to food and shopping centers.

As a low expense hotel, it may meet your needs. Our stay was April 22-26, 2014. Our first room needed more vacuum & cleaning (rug & bed), and rugs needs replacing. We were then moved to a cleaner room. Cleanliness needs to improve. However, housekeeping during the last 2 days there was excellent. Check-in was slow (two employees in front desk, but only one attended customers). Free breakfast buffet was plentiful and servers very attentive, but no low-sodium/low-fat choices. Shuttle to Disneyland was timely and flexible. Small but good options at gift shop, in case you forgot a Disney souvenir. Some physical improvements were in progress, so hopefully should be better when completed.

Our room was clean..tho bathroom fan did notvwork (they said it did..it didn't..my husband,  a bldg contractor checked)..we would love if the free shuttle ran until Disneyland closed as well as not have such a gap when it doesn't run (between 11:00 and 5:00).   It is an older hotel BUT it was clean and they are rennovating it, loved the free parking..free breakfast...free shuttle...and comfy beds.

Where to begin. Took us 25 minutes to check in because they couldn't find our reservation even though we provided them with the confirmation print out. We get to our room, the shower was leaking non stop. Maintenance came and said he could do nothing. We switched rooms. Key didn't work so we had to wait outside the room 15 minutes to get in. The bathroom floor was filthy and there was hair everywhere. They also did not give us our breakfast tickets for both days we had to go back to the front desk and explain to them that they indeed did not give us our tickets since they where trying to charge us for them. The elevator was wet all the time due to people walking in and out of the pool. My girlfriend slipped and almost fell twice! Being since it is the only elevator they should

Disappointed with the service.  We checked in our rom to find pillows laid at the foot of the bed that were missing pillow cases .. called down to the front desk and waited over 30 minutes for service to come up to our room.  The next night a group of teen age student checked into the Hotel and a group was placed next door to our room, I notified the front desk that the group next door were knocking on the adjoin door to the rooms to let them in .. and a number of student guest were running through the halls .. the rep that answered my called told me that she could move us to a first floor room and was all she could do but to call back if they continue so she can tell her manager.......

My wife and I stayed here to go to Disneyland and first off its not close to the Disneyland at all and there last shuttle that picks you up from the park leaves one hour before the park closes so it is impossible to stay until it closes. We found this out the hard way and we were left waiting for a half hour for not shuttle. Luckily we had a friend in the area with a car and they picked us up and drove us the 20 minutes back to the hotel. Our room was absolutely horrible. The first thing we noticed when we entered was the moldy smell and gaping hole in the wall under the window. Also right at the entrance there was a huge hardened footprint indented into the carpet. It looked like someone had stepped in blood and then walked bare foot through the room. Totally sick. We arrived
It was a great stay! Close to freeway, they offer free shuttle to Disneyland. We would stay there again.

The carpets had ground-in dirt and had not been vacuumed.  The water system in both the shower and sink produced scalding hot water on both hot and cold settings.  Only after the "cold" water had run for 3 - 4 minutes did it approach being cold. The curtains were ripped.  The bedding did not smell fresh. The toilet paper did not fit the holder.   The kleenex dispenser had been ripped from the mountings.  It appears that no maintenance had been done since the property was a Holiday Inn.

As I write this I sit in my room with towels stuffed against the door so the unbearable reek of pot smoke stops penetrating my room.  I have small children with me and this is beyond ridiculous!! I was supposed to stay here 6 nights but I'm checking out tomorrow.  This is too much of a cost for the benefit if a cheap hotel.  The staff is very nice and the beds actually feel crisp and clean, but drugs are rampant in here.  We even walked in from a long day at Disneyland to find a notice regarding the smoke free policy and warmed us that if they smelled smoke in our room we will be charged.  I quickly called and said we better not, as they only need to come up here to smell this floor.  I don't know if this is common or if other floors are like this but this doesn't happen at the

While the staff was very nice they just didn't have enough to work with. The rooms were filthy, the hallway smelled like pot every day, bathroom electrical was falling out of the wall, the water was not working and had to be shut off multiple times. I would not recommend this place ever and especially not for families. Hopefully they will remodel but until then is personally think the place should be condemned.

Great value for what you pay. Have stayed here numerous time for trips to Disneyland. We prefer to drive to and from the park rather than take the outdated shuttle. We don't like the fact that service does not run for a few hours during the middle of the day so you are either stuck at Disneyland or stuck at the hotel.
