You could tell that the maintenance crew had "self remediated" the water damage as it left parts of the walls permanently water damaged as well as the musty smell of mildew that  was obviously growing within the walls.  The hole was covered but unattended as the management told me they decided to wait until their busy season was over in another month to begin repairs of the water line. One of the days I left our room late
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback.  The Wyndham brand is equatable to a 4 out of 5 star establishment.  They don't offer a free hot breakfast and charge about double what we normally charge.  There have been ownership changes since then and we are now a Howard Johnson brand which is more akin to a 2.5 - 3 star establishment.  Our motto is to save people money so that they can vacation better.  We've had to do emergency repairs due to some ruptured piping that happened to occur right before Spring Break occurred.  So in order to minimize the disturbance, we have opted to wait for full repairs until after Spring Break ends.  Regarding the housekeeping issues, I'm not exactly sure what happened.  If you can send me your reservation name and date of stay, I can actually look into the Housekeeping logs to figure out why your room wasn't serviced.  The way the housekeeping system works is that in the beginning morning, we assign specific rooms for each housekeeper to clean.  So ultimately, the responsibility to clean a stayover room would be a specific housekeeper rather than the entire staff.

Summary Heading: The staff was friendly, rectified my problems quickly and...
Summary: The staff was friendly, rectified my problems quickly and wasn't overbearing.  The breakfast was well organized, tasty and filling.  I enjoyed the stay.

Summary Heading: The location of hotel was great
Summary: The lobby look great. The hotel room had ripped sheers on the window I reported this to the front desk they said would fix was there six day no one ever fixed, The tolit ran all night I asked that to be fixed went to the front desk girl said would send someone to fix there of six days never fixed. I was surprised due to this being a Howard Johnson
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback.  I'm working with my Maintenance staff to ensure that they have better response times.  We have a system at the front desk that lists Maintenance work orders so that we take care of items in a timely manner.  I'm not exactly sure what happened in your case.  If you send me your reservation name, and date of stay, I can see if I can locate the work orders for your room.  If a room isn't to your satisfaction, don't hesitate to ask to be moved to a room that will be to your satisfaction.

Summary Heading: PRETTY GOOD VALUE FOR THE PRICE
Summary: This hotel wasn't half bad... The breakfast was pretty decent there was actual sausage and eggs which was a plus. The location was just far enough from Disneyland so that everything wasn't too expensive.. There's a grocery store right next door and plenty of places to shop. There's also a free shuttle that takes you to and from Disneyland that saved us a lot of money. The only negative i have is that the room is small and the bathrooms could have been cleaner. Still overall a very good value and definately will be returning.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback!  We are constantly trying to improve the standard of our cleaning and if we know which room you were in, we pass on the feedback to the responsible housekeeper.

Summary: This Howard Johnston's is a great value.  Really nice setting overlooking the swimming pool area.  Wish your bar was open.
Manager Response: Thanks for the feedback.  We are about 1/4 mile from Downtown Fullerton which has many bars.  In addition, across our parking lot is a bar called 2Js.  If there's a special event happening in our Conference Center, we often have a bartender at the event you can purchase alcoholic beverages from.

Summary Heading: Quality overall was mediocre. Bed very poor and musty odor...
Summary: Quality overall was mediocre. Bed very poor and musty odor in room.  Would not return there unless no options.
Manager Response: I'm sorry about your stay.  If you have problems with the room, please let the front desk know and we can usually move you to a room to your satisfaction.

Summary Heading: You get what you paid for, good value
Summary: I stayed @ Howard Johnson Inn, Fullerton for 3 nights while on a business trip. The staff is friendly and very helpful, rooms are clean but a little bit outdated. One thing I noticed - dirt underneath the beds. Otherwise house keeping did a great job keeping ip with my room and generally no other complaints. Restaurants, starbucks and convenient location close to highway. Would not go there for a romantic escape with the girlfriend, but if you need a place to stay that is average does the job great. Would not pay more than $50-60 for it( got it for $38/night- was worth every penny). Breakfast was Ok a little bit strange- potatoes, rice??? But was ok.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback.  I'll remind my staff that they should be cleaning under the beds.  Our International tourists like the rice, and the whole potatoes are as a substitute to hashed browns.

Summary: Close to downtown, but very dirty, with generally poor service. The lady who checked us out didn't look up at us or even ask how our stay was. Lobby looked great, but Bates motel once you leave the elevator.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback.  I think this is for a different hotel since we're not close to anywhere I would describe as "downtown".

Summary: Given dirty room at first: towels on floor, unmade bed. Check-in took forever. Buffet Breakfast cold
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback.  I apologize for the mix up in assigning you a dirty room.  If I can get the room information, I'll be able to research how it occurred.  The breakfast ends at 9AM, so if you get toward the end of it, I can understand why the breakfast may be cold.  We use Thermos underneath that have a life of 6 hours.

Summary: I was excited to find a Howard Johnson hotel for such a reasonable price close to Disneyland and was so pleased when I walked into the lobby. It is beautiful and portrays a sense of style. The front desk was very nice at check in and also when we were making the reservations. When we got to our rooms, though, we wanted to high tail it out of there that minute. In our room the floor was dirty, carpet torn, door was old and patched, toilet was also old but the main problem for me was the fifth in the bathroom. It looked like the floor was cleaned once a month, if that. There was hair and lint from previous guests in tub and the floor, as well as mold in the shower. The front desk took us to see other rooms in the new tower but their cleanliness was the same.
Manager Response: I'm sorry about your stay.  Please let me know what room it was in and we can make sure to discipline the housekeepers responsible for cleaning the room.  I've been in process of putting rooms entirely out of order that are not to our standards.  Also, if the rooms are not to your standard, you are more than welcome to let the front desk know, and we can move you to a different room to your standard.

Summary Heading: Great location but poor housekeeping skills
Summary: I had read previous reviews complaining about the dirty rooms.  I thought how bad could it be considering I have two small children at home that keeps are place in a constant disarray.  But I was wrong.  The place needs a full overall to get just a minimum standard.  I was really excited about the buffet breakfast but was quickly disappointed when the options in the breakfast.  I would have liked a couple of "lighter" options.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback.  I'm constantly trying to improve the skills of our housekeepers.  Some of them are better than others and your feedback is important to identifying our best (and worst) housekeepers.

Summary: Our checkin was great. when we got to the room, the first thing we noticed was dust/dirt covering the curtains-tv was box tv and all channel listings were incorrect; when i sat at the edge of the bed a puff of dust (and a noticeable dirt mark) were on the top comforter-the breakfast (for $9) I don't think I would have paid that much - and it was the same buffet each day. The next morning/day they came and cleaned - noticeable difference - you could smell the cleanliness of the linens-The cleaning staff were taking hotel items from the roller carts. The compensation should've/could've been more than the charge of the fold away bed.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback.  We have different housekeepers of differing quality and your feedback helps us weed out the good from the not so good.

Summary Heading: The water was not working when we got there at 10 a.m. and...
Summary: The water was not working when we got there at 10 a.m. and came back close to midnight when the staff had said that it was going to be back on in a couple of hours. House keeping showed up at 6 p.m. or 7 p.m. swimming pool was full of leaves. "continental breakfast" consisted of potatoes, rice, scrambled eggs with sausage and orange slices EVERYDAY! Walls and chairs were not very clean.
Manager Response: I apologize for your stay.  We have been making emergency plumbing repairs.  Please contact management for a partial refund.

Summary Heading: Great Disneyland shuttle service.  Good breakfast...
Summary: Great Disneyland shuttle service.  Good breakfast.  Comfortable room and a nice place to stay. A future suggestion;  they provide a means to print boarding passes.
Manager Response: If you email your boarding pass to the front desk, we can print it out.  We have a computer at the lobby free for use that you can email it from.

Summary: Construction was going on.  Also hallways were left with trash and towels from house keeping.  Room amenidies included a refrigerator but ours didn't have one.  Front desk said not ALL rooms have them.  They did bring us one.
Manager Response: I apologize for the mess.  We are currently doing emergency water repairs on the piping.  Refrigerators are available for an extra fee.  A public microwave is available by the front desk.  The Suites are the only rooms that have a refrigerator and microwave included.

Summary: I want to start off by saying the two ladies at the front desk were great. They were professional polite and listened to my concerns. The horrible issues were not their fault.  Yes I understand this hotel is not a Hilton or similar but it now officially ranks as the worst hotel I have ever been to. To start while trying to find my room the manager was literally yelling and scolding an employee about her not wanting to only work one shift. His tone was threating hostile and scary even to me as a guest. This was done with the office door wide open.  Upon finding room 297 I was in shock. An electrical wall outlet was loose from the wall to the point you could see wires. The bed had numerous stains and hairs on the sheets. The drapes had a large hole in them. A random non hotel pen
Manager Response: We have implemented numerous housekeeping rules based off your feedback and made some staff changes as well.  Thank you for your feedback.

Summary Heading: Not a 400.00 per night hotel ( Like Disney hotels)
Summary: If you want it all ,don't stay here ,not close to Disneyland.  a short drive or they have shuttle   We stayed two nights ,had a great time ,Very nice staff , better food than most offer ,and good beds and towls,We will stay again

Summary Heading: You pay what you get for
Summary: My friends and I booked this hotel because it is relatively close to downtown and it was cheap. However, the rooms were dirty and the service was bad. A lady w a clipboard barged into our room without knocking. She didn't identify herself but claimed she thought we had checked out already. The morning breakfast is free but not worth waking up for. Poor food and service. I would not recommend staying here pay a little extra and go to a nicer cleaner hotel.
Manager Response: I apologize for the mix up on the rooms.  We keep our housekeepers accountable, so if we find out the issue with the cleanliness, we can figure out which housekeeper was responsible.

Summary: Room was filthy, we called down for some new coffee and the staff never actually made it up to our room. In the elevator there was a gum flosser that stayed there for three days.  The shuttle by far was the worst part, often we were left waiting in the wind and the cold even when it was scheduled to be there.  Be advised, the shuttle to disneyland takes a six hour break from 11 to 5 pm, so if you are planning on going back to the hotel during the day, skip this one.  Would not recommend. In fact, I am going to tell everyone I know NOT to go here.

Summary Heading: Desperately needs room makeover but not the staff!
Summary: I just returned from 5 days here. When you walk into lobby you see two beautiful chandeliers and you think you are in for a treat. Well don't hold your breath! We had a long walk to our room (my mom is handicapped) but it was on the first floor. The carpet in the hallways and in the room were stained and dirty. We got to our room and found holes in our curtains and they faced the parking lot. Daylight shined thru too...annoying in early am. The light fixtures by our beds were as bright as stadium lights. We bought book lights cause they were so bright. The beds were comfy. The hot breakfast was good but only coffee and juice to drink. How about milk? There were Asian signage all over so maybe we were not their target crowd. Parking was free and easy as was the daily Disney
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback.  I will try and locate the room with the holes in the drapes and to wash the carpet stains.

Summary: In general the hotel needs a refresh.  In the public areas the paint was chipping and everything seemed "worn".   We were told that the pool was heated. We split our day at Disneyland so the kids could swim in the pool for a few hours.  It was so cold that they all had to take long hot showers to warm up.    When I needed more towels because the room only had two small towels I called the front desk.  They asked me to come down to get the extra towels as there was no one to bring them up.  Probably not a big deal as we at least got the extra towels but it was a hassle it was late and we had driven for 10 hours (should have been a 6 hour trip) because of a closed highway.  The staff was pleasant and the location was very good.
Manager Response: I apologize regarding the pool.  The water heater was broken at the time and we are currently repairing it.

Summary: This was the most disgusting hotel I have ever stayed at.  The halls and room rank of Pot because the people next door to us were smoking so much Pot they set the fire alarm off.  The carpet was black.  The sheets had hair all over them.  The comforter on one bed had, what I hope was syrup spilled all down the side of it and onto the carpet. The other comforter had blood all over it and was turned upside down so it was hiding.  The bathroom was untouchable!! If it hadn't been so late when we arrived I would have NOT stayed.  I had my small children with me.  I was scared of catching lice, crabs and being eaten by bed bugs! I don't think ANY of the rooms would have been any cleaner. It was the worst experience ever.  We were up and out of the room by 8:00am!
Manager Response: I'm very sorry about your stay.  It sounds like your room was not even cleaned by a housekeeper potentially.   Please let the front desk know about any issues, and we can take care of it.  It sounds like in your case, we should've given you a different room, and disciplined the housekeeper/supervisor that allowed your room to be rented.  If you're able to PM me your name and date of stay, I can even find out and hold the respective staff accountable.

Summary: I am VERY disappointed! I had 2 rooms, in one the air did not even work, stains on the carpet, front desk staff was very RIDe and SARCASTIC!!!!! The only positive was the housekeeping supervisor she was a doll!!!! I dont care to stay at ANY  Howard Johnson AGAIN!!!!! If this is how all the HJ's are then NO THANK YOU!!! I consider it a total wste of $200.00 for 1 night stay!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I would love to stay at a different HJ to see if they are the same but I wont spend or rather watse my money trying to see if its just that one or all HJ's!!!!! Want to give my a coupon to try another HJ in the area with my faimly of 7 I would be happy to reconsider my opinion of Howard Johnson as of now, I think of this paticulair HJ as run down,maitnance needing,old,money

Summary Heading: This hotel is old and needs updating.
Summary: The staff was very friendly and helped me get a room that was not on the freeway side of the hotel. (You can open the window and throw a rock and hit the 91 freeway, that is how close it is.  Very noisy) The rooms have dirty and torn carpet.  I would hate to walk in the room bare footed.  The room is musty like it hasn't been lived in for months.  Very cheap hotel.  It is a huge stretch for 2 1/2 stars
Manager Response: I'm sorry about your stay.  I can assure you that all our 289 rooms are not of the same quality.  It sounds like the room should not had been rented to you.  If a room is not to your satisfaction, we can always move you to a different room.

Summary Heading: This was the worst hotel I've ever stay at
Summary: My family and I stay at the Howard Johnson for two nights, and lets just say those were the worst two nights. first the hotel is very outdated and dirty, but I tried to look past that. The first night we were there the fire alarm went off two time for about 10 to 15 min. this was about 2 am. again I try to look past that but no... the next night the alarm went off three times 1:30am and so on at one point it went off for 30 mins. I had kids with me and didn't know what to do. should we wake up the kids and get them out or what everyone is in the hallway trying to get a hold of the front desk but when you called they just hung up on you. in then end we had two nights in a dirty hotel and no sleep. was not worth the cheaper price, oh and there free shuttle is gross and dirty and
Manager Response: I'm very sorry about your experience.  The fire alarm situation was a worst case scenario and were able to resolve the alarm issue by the next morning.  The alarm malfunctioned that night, and should not be a problem anymore.

Summary: I put a low score for 'sleep quality' solely because the fire alarm went off twice, for several minutes each time, the night that I stayed.  Woke me up, and kept me up.  And to be honest, the whole experience wasn't anything special.  Wasn't the worst hotel trip I've had, but nothing really that would make me seek out a Howard Johnson.

Summary Heading: A one nights stay - I just wanted a clean room
Summary: I was looking for something in Fullerton just for a one nights stay with a free hot breakfast.  Haven't stayed at a Ho Jo in years decided to give it a try.  The location was convenient but the clean, ornate lobby masked what was behind the door of our room.  The room was poorly maintained and visibly dirty.  The carpet was very, very dirty to the point I didn't want anything touching it.  On the left side next to the dresser were spots that appeared to be mold.  The bathroom was unsanitary and the walls and door were rotting away at the bottom looking as if there was a recent spill in there.    The floor was dirty.  The sink looked okay but because of the overall appearance of the room, I had no confidence that it was cleaned with clean water.    The room used a wall heater and
Manager Response: It sounds like you had one of our rooms that aren't to our standards.  Please let the front desk know and we can move you to a different room.

Summary: I stayed here during my trip for Namm 2013. My experience was a a good one. The rooms could use a little upgrading but I enjoyed. The staff was very nice and professional. Breakfast was good, money and time saving. The free shuttle to Disneyland was awesome also!!!

We first walked in our room we found used cups on the floor, there was trash stuck in the ceiling tiles and then we found a used condom in the corner. It took a lot for us the stay there even after a room switch.
Manager Response: I apologize for your experience!  It sounds like you were assigned a room that was mistakenly marked as clean, even though it was obviously dirty.  I'm glad to hear we were able to switch you rooms.  I'll research your room and try and figure out who was the one responsible for the mistake.

Summary: Carpets were dirty and the rooms were not as clean as they charge.  Needs a renewal. Staff and location very good The rent is high  Would not be a bad choice if the rate of rooms is around 50$ as compared to 88$.
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback.  We currently have a schedule to wash carpets with a carpet cleaner once every 6 months.  If we find out a room needs an extra cleaning, we'll take care of it.  It sounds like your room is one that needs to be done quicker.  Our hotel offers a better value compared to other hotels closer to Disneyland after considering: free parking, free shuttle (so no Disneyland parking), 10% tax rate (vs. Anaheim's 17%), no resort fee, free wi-fi, free kiosk computer usage, and free hot buffet breakfast (most hotels offer only continental).    Save Money.  Vacation Better.

Summary: I had an extended stay in this hotel for almost a year.  I found the hotel staff to be very courteous and friendly.  The location was very good, close to the 91 Freeway and many local restaurants and shopping.  It is just a couple miles from the entrance to Disneyland  with free shuttle service to and from.  Hot breakfast was served each morning, however daily variation was routine.

Summary Heading: What else do you expect of a HoJo/
Summary: We chose this hotel because of it's location and cheap prices.  We got what we expected.  The free shuttle to Disneyland was great.  The first room we checked in to, the heater was broken.  We got upgraded to a room with a balcony.  They certainly comped us, but when we went swimming, the pool was gross (floating hair.  Lots of it.)  The breakfast was repetitive (same thing everyday) and the service was quite slow.  I think it took them about an hour to deliver a crib to our room.  But again, you pay for what you get so I was comfortable with the cheap prices.
Manager Response: I appreciate your feedback.  I'll double check with my maintenance staff to make sure they're on a regular pool cleaning schedule.  They should be, but I'll double check anyway.  I agree that floating hairs are quite gross.

Summary Heading: Hotel gets worse each stay for some reason.
Summary: I have been using this hotel only for the last 5 years when visiting the area.  The past 12 months it has gotten progressivly worse in cleanliness.  When we checked in we were given a room that had not been cleaned.  We had to go back down stairs and get a key for a room that had been cleaned.  The room had about 25 sheets of toliet paper on the roll.  We had to call for toliet paper, which took a while.  The part that was really a turn off was the hallways on all of the floors.  For some reason there was ALOT of dirty towels piled in front of rooms and plastic bags ( I assume the bags were full of trash).  It was not just on our floor, it was on two others, which we had to go on to get ice.   We had someone meet us at our room to go out to dinner and I was embarrassed at the
Manager Response: I apologize for the delay on toilet paper.  I have also informed housekeeping to make sure to clear the hallways as soon as possible to minimize the mess.  During especially busy times, housekeeping doesn't always have enough room on their carts to put all the trash and dirty bed sheets & towels.  I'll try and figure out better solutions to less inconvenience guests.  Thanks again for your feedback.

Summary Heading: Cockroachs! If you love them, stay here, if not, stay elsewhere.
Summary: Every time we came back to the room there were cockroaches in the bathroom. I would have changed hotels immediately but I didn't have time to relocate and didn't want to upset my daughter.  So, I made the decision to stick it out for another day. Yuck! I will never return there. I canceled my reservation for the following weekend and am going to stay elsewhere.
Manager Response: We do not tolerate cockroaches!  Please let the front desk know so that we can call in the Verminators!  (We have a regular contract with Isotech, who are featured on Discover Channel's "Verminators" show)

Summary Heading: Had Excellent Service. Recommend Anthony Martino!
Summary: This is sort of an overdue revitsteele@hsolutionsonline.comew because we stayed here a few months ago (October 2012). I had amazing service and a terrific time thanks to Anthony Martino. My group seemed to lose our cards and our breakfast comps every which way. He was very kind, very reassuring, and extremely catering to our dilemmas. We had a terrific time and if not for his steadfast service, our mood probably would have been a very downtrodden one.   Thanks again,   -Jon
Manager Response: Thanks for the feedback!  I'm glad to hear you had a good stay.

Summary: room was in the right place, but the carpet had an odor to it. Someone had used the room briefly because one of the soaps was broken open and used. It was over priced for the quality I received. The bed was ok thankfully, and I had a cold. Good breakfast in the morning.
Manager Response: I'm sorry about the quality of your room.  We should not be renting rooms without it being thoroughly looked over.  So if it was, I apologize that we missed it.  Please let the front desk know about any issues, and we can make sure to take care of it or move you to a room that is acceptable.

Summary Heading: Gross,Moldy,Housekeepers dont do there job, Run from these places!!FAST!!
Summary: These rooms are very gross.. They have an stinky smell to them,never are they completely cleaned.Mold and Mildew on the drapes. beware if you have breakfast there the dishes are dirty, with lipstick. This place need to be remodeled and updated. I would not recommend this place to anyone..So RUN FAST.. FAR AWAY FROM THESE PLACES. SEE PHOTOS ATTACHED!!! Lobby looks nice but that just covers up the gross rooms..
Manager Response: Thank you for those pictures.  Mold is not acceptable and I apologize for your experience.  If there are issues with your room, or any hotel for that matter, please let the front desk know and we can move you to a different room.  I'll try and research who cleaned your room and hold them accountable.  Your room was NOT acceptable, and I'm angry that it was allowed to be rented.

Summary: The room was not very clean, there were alcohol, soda, water, and milk bottles left on the porch from the previous occupants. The bathroom sink was clogged and black gross crap was coming out of the drain and floating into the backed up water. The TV was in a box and to view it everyone had to sit in the middle of the room. there were two beds and four people, but only one chair at the dinning table? Not the greatest stay. We thought it would have been a better experience being that it was Howard Johnson!!
Manager Response: I am very sorry about the problems with your room.  Obviously the porch was overlooked by the housekeeping staff, and if you'll let the front desk know about any issues we can make sure our staff are held accountable.  Regarding maintenance issues, though not acceptable, they sometimes happen and a call to the front desk will allow us to take care of the problem quickly.  If that means we need to do a room change, then that's possible.    We typically don't have any dining tables in our rooms.  There is a business desk and an office chair, along with a lounge seat.  Any more furniture, and it may get too crowded.  Video room tours can be found on our main website.

Summary: The guest services named Shiela was very accommodating. She helped us and gave us a great feel of our stay.  During our request of extension, until 1pm was very well accommodated.  Though, sockets are loose.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  I'll let Sheila know you're a fan.

Summary: This review is based on three stays at Howard Johnson Fullerton.   My family and I stayed here for my cousins wedding back in October 2011. The room was decent and the in house breakfast was great.   Our problem then was with the rude attendant at check-in. Howard Johnson Fullerton clearly does not train its front desk employees in the art of hospitality. I realize that check-in is at a specific time and that hotels can not always accommodate early arrivals. My problem is in the way its handled. What I experience at other hotels when I arrive early is something close to the following..."I'm sorry your room isn't ready yet. You can check your luggage here with us and we will give you a call when your room is ready." What we get when we arrive early at Howard Johnson Fullerton is
Manager Response: Thanks for the feedback.    If you can let me know the name of the individual who checked you in, we can hold them accountable for their rudeness.  We have cameras that record audio at the front desk for this kind of purpose.  Regarding the Yelp deal, I tried enacting it a while ago, and didn't get much of a response, so I'll be removing it to minimize confusion.  The schedule for our shuttle can be found on our main website.  There is a local bus one can ride back and forth in between the down times for the shuttle.

Summary Heading: Great Staff Service, Hotel Needs Mayor Remodeling
Summary: Staff service was great specially kitchen staff 100% rating to them!! Hotel needs mayor remodeling. Carpet very worn out and dirty in all areas. Couches in reception area are not  at all inviting to seat on them they are worn out and dirty. The pillows had an old dirty smell. Shower pressure was horrible and no hot water. If this Hotel gets mayor remodeling it will be a great place to stay. Our Stay was brief and we just made the best of it, but will not return again. Must emphasize the staff was Great!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  We have replaced the carpets in numerous rooms.  If you have any maintenance issues during your stay, please let the front desk know so that we can send staff to fix the issues.

Summary Heading: deal was great but with service, thats just explained why!
Summary: Checkin with total of 5 at a 2 queen size room. Price was great except that the bed wasn't a queen size!  Left to disneyland which was about 15min drive since 8a.m-10.45p.m and left a cleaning note hanging on our door. Came back and the room wasn't clean, bed liner wasn't change, No towels!!  Horrible service really
Manager Response: We don't have any rooms with Queen beds.  If you'll let us know who told you or where it was mentioned as such, then I can make sure it gets corrected.  Also, a note to everyone, please look carefully at your door hanger.  Unfortunately, both sides of the door hangers look very similar and are easily confused.  I've let our corporate offices know, but in the mean time it causes mass confusion.  If you have any issues with your room, please let the front desk know and we can usually solve the issue.

Summary: Stayed here for 4 nights and i didn't want to come back each day if it wasn't paid for already. the facilities need a lot of repair especially the rooms and bathroom. though the rooms are big and spacious and the beds are comfortable. this is actually a decent hotel for the price if it wasnt for most of the staff being cold to almost rude. you have to pay for the mediocre breakfast too. its location is close to disneyland and other shops and restaurants so that is one good thing. overall, i would find another hotel if i will travel here again.
Manager Response: Breakfast is free for most guests with the exception of contracted rates we have with certain travel agencies that make packages.  If you have any issues with your room, please let the front desk know and we can usually send someone to fix the issue or even move you rooms.

Summary: The rooms were not clean and half the lighting of my mom's room did not work. We found hairs on the pillows in our bed and the carpets were terribly stained. We tried to use the fitness facility and it was a complete joke, no treadmill, and there were additional tables stacked up in there. We paid extra to stay in the tower with our group and all of the rooms were disgusting. The sheets in our room looked stained and then we realized they were so thin from bleach that it just looked tht way. The lounge chair in our room was so stained we didn't feel comfortable putting anything on it. We would have checked out the first night but we were with a wedding party that was staying at the hotel. Oh and when I went back to my moms room to grab something the maid was there and had her
Manager Response: I'm sorry to hear about the issues you ran into.  The issues you had are not up to the standard that I have for my housekeeping and maintenance staff.  Please let the front desk know about any issues, and we can send staff up to the room to take care of any issues or even move you rooms.  I'll also be able to trace which housekeeper allowed those thin sheets in your room.  In terms of the fitness room, I don't mention it on our main website because I know it's not to the standard that I have.  I'd rather remove all the equipment, but I figured it's better to have it in case someone did want to use some portion of it even if it's not as good as I believe it should be.  This is a tough call for me to make.

Summary Heading: This hotel needs to be cleaned up
Summary: My co-worker's first room smelled funny when he walked in.  He asked me to come in and take a look - there was a 3" (at least) dead cockroach on the floor below the window.  We moved from the 2nd fl to the 5th floor and didn't see anymore cockroaches. The breakfast sould include yogurt or fruit.  White bread only for toast - really?  How about some wholewheat or english muffins. The hallways & elevator floors are old carpeting and the woodwork is worn out looking.  The gate that requires a room card to open downstairs doesn't work - you just push it open.   One of my hand towels had 3 large holes in it, perhaps it was a rag that got mistaken in the laundry room?
Manager Response: I'm sorry to hear about the cockroach in your room.  Our pest control company is Isotech which have been featured on the Verminator reality show.  They must've ran out of Wheat bread.  We currently don't provide English muffins and yogurt due to their increased cost.  The fruit must've ran out as well because we usually provide that as well.  Pictures of our current breakfast can be found on our main website.  Hand towels should not have holes in them, and we can always get them replaced!  Whichever housekeeper put those in should be reprimanded!    I'll try and find your reservation information to make sure issues that you experienced aren't repeated.

Summary Heading: Hotel with free shuttle bus to Disneyland
Summary: I stayed in Howard Johnson hotel in Fullerton for 15 days, from 26 October to 10 November because I was visiting Disneyland for a 14 days vacation.   I found this hotel ok in general. My room was in the tower on Fifth floor Room 565 and it was reasonably clean with a comfortable King bed. The bathroom was very clean with clean towels and there is hot water when I took my shower.  The house keeping lady asked me if I wanted my sheets and pillow cases changed each time when they come to service my room.   The air condition can keep the room very cool but it does make quite a loud noise at night. The tv is old and therefore of very poor quality to watch.   Wifi from my room is very good and it's free or included.   Breakfast was the same everyday, but it was free or included and a

Summary Heading: Wonderful Customer Service & a Great Place to Stay
Summary: We chose this hotel because of its location and the easy access to parks. We had a great stay and very happy with the services we received. The registration was super fast and a special thanks goes to Sean at the Front Office who is very friendly and always greeted us with a hearty smile and went out of his way to make us feel at home. Must say we were pleasantly surprised as we didn‚Äôt expect this service.  Our stay was indeed worth for the price we paid and the rooms were nice and clean. Breakfast came free but it was bad and needs improvement ASAP. However we will definitely come back and recommend this hotel to all our family and friends.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review!  I'll be forwarding your review to the employee.  Our breakfast pictures can be found on our main website that includes eggs, sausages, fruit, and toast in a buffet style.

Summary: My family and I stayed at this hotel during the transition of our move. For the price we paid, since this wasn't a vacation but a temporary accommodation, we were satisfied. Our requests for extra towels and coffee were brought promptly. The staff were always friendly.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review!  I hope your move was a smooth one.

Summary: This Is The Worst Hotel Ever! You Couldn't Pay Me To Stay There Again!! Old, Carpets Filthy, Bath Towels Were Like Sandpaper!! Staff That Doesn't Care - Allowed An Entire Floor, For 2 Nights, From 9pm-4am Be Distrupted And Go Without Sleep Because They Let A Large Group Of Young Adults Run Drunk, Loud, & Stupid Throughout!!  Shuttle Service Is The Worst! They Say They Have A Restaurant - Be Careful. Only Positive - The Town Of Fullerton. Run, Don't Walk To Another Hotel & Fast!!
Manager Response: Video Review Response posted on our main website under the reviews section.

Summary Heading: Great stay for the price, good location
Summary: Great location, nice hotel for the price. We used this hotel during a visit to Disneyland. They have a shuttle service and it's just far enough away from the park that you can get away fromt he crowd but still close enough to be convenient. I would certainly stay here again.
Manager Response: Video Review Response posted on our main website under the reviews section.

Summary: Nice hotel with heated pool. Nice cleaning staff my room was spotless with fresh towels daily. Hot breakfast was good .I was sick during my trip so I only are breakfast on my last day. Beds were comfy cause I slept like a baby. Thanks Howard Johnson for a nice stay :-)  !!!
Manager Response: Video Review Response posted on our main website under the reviews section.

Summary: I am sorry to say that this stay was not at all what is described on the website.  The hotel lobby staff was very rude and not accommodating.  We were suppose to be placed in a room close to other members traveling with us but we were placed in the "old" tower and they were placed in the "new" tower.  Upon our arrival in our room, it was FILTHY!  The bathroom floor was so dirty that when I placed water on a hand towel and wiped it with the towel it literally turned black.  There was dirt and dust everywhere.  The carpet stunk and there were burn holes in the comforter.  When asked to be moved, I was told they could not accommodate us that evening that I would have to call back in the morning.  When I called in the morning, I was told there was not another room available and that
Manager Response: Video Review Response posted on our main website under the reviews section.

Summary: We did not even get to stay in this hotel, but got to experience the terrible service when we arrived and they did not have our booking, although I had a confirmation printed and the dates were correct. There were 2 staff on reception and whilst trying to find my booking they did not say a word. It was not until I asked if they had any rooms available that I was told 'not for tonight, but we do for tomorrow night'. There was no explanation offered as to why they did not have our booking, and no apology offered and not even the offer to help us locate another hotel at short notice. How hard can it be to give us a list of hotel to try?? We sat in the car and lucky for us had wireless internet and were able to find another hotel.They advised nothing had been charged to our card
Manager Response: Video Review Response posted on our main website under the reviews section.

Summary Heading: Worst experience in my 25 plus yrs of travel
Summary: This location is by far the worst most unprofessional hotel I have ever stayed.  We were greeted by an unfriendly females face that was out of uniform.  She was searing a "wife beater" tank top.  After insisting on seeing both of our ID's, she gave us a room with two very small beds.  My boyfriend is 6'5" tall.  We called the front desk right away.  The same female said that there was nothing she could do because that was the only room she had for us.  I asked to speak to a manager and her response was, "We don't have no manager".  I asked her to please please check about getting us a King bed; then she placed me on hold.  I was on hold for about 25 minutes and it was obvious no one was going to come back to the call.  It would re-ring, and without word would be placed back on
Manager Response: Video Review Response posted on our main website under the reviews section.

Summary: I stayed for 4 nights in one room and than after a couple of days for one more night in another room. The hotel is a bit tired and old as are the rooms. But the rooms are clean enough and the housekeeping does a good job so it`s ok. The atmosphere is a bit grim but the beds are huge and comfortable and if you get a room on the quiet side of the hotel you can have a nice sleep. If you`re on the side of the freeway, however, sleeping is not so easy. As a plus of the hotel I can point the free wi-fi internet which is really good and the 90+ TV Programs - more than any other hotel I`ve been to.
Manager Response: Video Review Response posted on our main website under the reviews section.

Summary: I thoroughly enjoyed staying at the Fullerton HoJo.  We had a double room (#464) in the rear tower (newer part of hotel). It was on the fourth floor and had a balcony overlooking the pool. The lobby, hallways and our room were all clean and well-maintained. The housekeeping staff was attentive, efficient and non-intrusive. Yvonne at the front desk checked us in and was excellent, the other agents were also helpful and friendly. The free parking, free WiFi, free breakfast and free shuttle to and from Disneyland were definitely perks of this hotel and were significant reasons we booked here. Another nice amenity is the free lobby computer which we used to check-in for our flight home. We didn't print our boarding passes but the desk agent said we could have them emailed to the
Manager Response: Video Review Response posted on our main website under the reviews section.

Summary: Enjoyed staying at this Hotel recently with the family.Were there to board a Bus Tour to Vegas. Found the rooms to be good and comfortable.Service was excellent, crew was very resposive to any requests.Lobby was nice and welcoming, breakfast was wholesome.Overall, we had a nice and very comfortable stay.Would definitely recommend and stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review!  I have posted a video response on our main website under the "Reviews" section.

Summary: Our stay was nice, average over all, but I wanted to praise a couple of the employees.  Patricia in the morning staff of dining room....she was very pleasant, friendly and always smiling even though she was busy nothing seemed to through her off, I would say she is an excellent employee!  We wanted to give her a tip and yet she was honest enough to place the money( that we wanted to go ONLY to her) in the tip jar. We would like to compliment our morning Bell man / shuttle bus driver Amando... he too was such a pleasant, friendly, safe driver, and always smiling!!!

I like to stay at this hotel because the location but this last visit didn't fill out my expectations like past visits!! Something must be happening with the cleaning in the rooms because there are all dust and bad
Manager Response: Thank you for your review!  I have posted a video response on our main website under the "Reviews" section.

Summary: The carpet was filthy and needs replaced.There were no comfortable chairs in the room.The chairs were stacked in the hallway.If you are going to replace the chairs in the rooms,get new chairs before removing the old ones.The fountain by the pool in front of my room didn't have any water or functioning lights.The wallpaper was very old and dated,it needs to be replaced.The tile in the bathroom was old and dated and needs replaced.There is not an exhaust fan in the bathroom.The lights in the bathroom were on an automatic system that turned the lights off if it did not detect any motion.Several times the lights went off while I was taking a shower.This is very dangerous.If a person should fall while trying to turn the lights back on they could get hurt seriously.There was not a
Manager Response: Thank you for your review!  I have posted a video response on our main website under the "Reviews" section.

Summary: When my mom and sister booked the hotel they had selected one close to the parks that we stay at anytime we go. However upon arrival we were greated by a very cranky employee who proceeded to tell us we had no reservation. Due to a computer glitch we had been rebooked by the system, when we realized what had happend, he would not help us, the hotel had rented out our room to a dance company. We had to drive 4 miles down the road to a questionable looking hotel. While the staff at this hotel was nothing but friendly and helpful the cleanliness left much to be desired. The room arrangement was nice, but the continental breakfast was also lacking. We will not be checking into a Howard Johnson if we only need one room again. The original hotel has always been great when we go with
Manager Response: Thank you for your review!  I have posted a video response on our main website under the "Reviews" section.

Summary: While I enjoyed the location with the cost close to Disney the hotel itself was not good quality. We had moved over to this hotel from one in Long Beach and the hotel in the ghetto part of long beach was bar far much nicer than this one. No fridge in the hotel and the amount I signed for at check out was not the amount that was charged to my card. That is still needing to be disputed. Even the hotel in Long Beach had better televisions and had connections to hook up a DVD player, yours did not. Also upon the day of checkout while loading my luggage into the car there was someone digging through your trash for food or whatever.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review!  I have posted a video response on our main website under the "Reviews" section.

Summary Heading: Take valuables with you, DON'T Leave luggage in room! Watch Out for Thieves!
Summary: Upon entering the Hotel we thought it looked nice..(different)Not what we saw online or thought we were getting... Looked scary to park out back as was suggested by desk person and was difficult to get to room as we were given no instructions! Old, dirty room, bedding was obviously NOT cleaned between guests and there was limited Hot Water. We arrived Thursday night and brought in ALL of our luggage. We showered and changed, slept in, since we knew we would be staying till Midnight at Disneyland for Halloween Party...Arrived back to Hotel to find some of our luggage had been STOLEN from our room! I went to desk immediately to ask and desk person told me manager Mr. Robert Vasquez would be in at 8:30 am that I could speak with him then that in the time being to call Fullerton
Manager Response: This issue has been resolved and passed onto the Fullerton Police Department. I can't disclose too much at this point publicly due to the ongoing criminal investigation that I don't want to jeopardize. The guests affected by the thefts have been contacted directly on the results of our internal investigation.  I heard about the issue Monday morning, and within 6 hours of investigation, including reviewing 24 hours of video surveillance, we were able to find the culprit.

Summary Heading: Great location but customer service is awful!
Summary: The hotel location and price was very good. The front desk staff is not the most helpful. I had several issues with my room keys. The staff did not seem to care about guests' complaints. I would not recommend this hotel based on the poor customer service!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review!  I have posted a video response on our main website under the "Reviews" section.

Summary: We stayed at the Howard Johnson in Fullerton. I had read lots of reviews abt how great this hotel was, but I was very disappointed and I will never stay here again. Our first room had carpet stains something on the bottom of the curtains not sure if it was throw up or powder. The sheets had come off one side of thetown bed and there was a huge stain, kinda looked like blood. I have 3 little ones and I did not want them staying in these conditions . The next day I asked for a different room, the next one smelled like smoke and it was a non smoking room. He finally went a head and put us in the newer rooms, called the tower (this is the building they show in their pictures to advertise). This room was much better and cleaner and no smells. The next day leaving Disneyland we had
Manager Response: Thank you for your review!  I have posted a video response on our main website under the "Reviews" section.

Summary: Reservation was last minute while driving from San Diego.  Price was right.  Staff was friendly and prompt.  Hotel generally has no bar but a wedding was being held there and bar was opened for it so we were able to enjoy a glass of wine.  Hotel needs major facelift.  Room was clean. Breakfast was bad.  Tasteless.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review!  I have posted a video response on our main website under the "Reviews" section.

Summary: My family and I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights .   The rooms were OK for the price, I guess but the resturant was really bad. It has no menu, only 4 or 5 choice which were either stirred fried chicken or beef for dinner.  Then all of a sudden, the resturant closed for business on the night our family came back late from Disneyland and we thought we could tolerate a meal at the place. Lucky it was opened up again the next morning for breakfast.  Talking about breakfast, not to mention it only had limited choices but there was no milk for the coffee . They let us use coffee creamer .  However, the staff there were friendly .  BTW, apart from the bad points, there are good points as well . I'd like to mention that staff at receptionist counter were nice and helpful and also the

We needed a place to stay near our daughter's place for a few days.  This was the closest.  The room itself needed upgrades:  sheer curtain had a huge hole; bathroom faucet leaked, air condition/heat unit noisy; old tv.  Housekeeping:  needed better vaccuming...ran out of tissues,  not enough towels

Summary Heading: Great staff, nice hotel but could use some remodeling, great pool area!
Summary: We arrived with a large group for a trip to Knotts Berry Farm......courteous check in and our rooms were all as we had requested, including 2 handicap rooms.....which was great as 1/2 of the times we request these kinds of rooms, we don't get them....there were no refrigerators in the rooms, you could request one for an additional $10 though....fair enough I guess.  No microwave either, but there was one available to use down by the front desk...This hotel was nothing fancy but comfortable and fairly clean...it served its purpose....pool area was awesome, nice cabana's to use for free.....nice gift shop that our group spent much time in:)....there was also a breakfast bar available that was "ok", nothing fancy, but good.....it does cost extra though....

Summary Heading: Better options are out there, but you can make it work if you are on a budget
Summary: I stayed one night at this hotel.  I would not stay again.  I was in town on business and the people who brought me to Fullerton recommended the place.  I have been back to Fullerton since and stayed at other, much better properties, for about $10.00 more per night, which I feel was worth the additional expense.  If you are on a tight budget and can‚Äôt afford other options, than I think this place will work ‚Äì it is okay, but strange.    The room was clean, but bare and the furniture / finishes were very basic.  Getting to the room from the front desk is a bit of a maze.  I believe the hotel caters to tour groups from Asia, which I think accounts for some of the strangeness of the property (to an American).  I found the hotel d√©cor in the lobby to be over top and rather tacky when

Summary Heading: Our Stay - Patricia in the dining room
Summary: As far as the hotel itself goes I felt it was fairly average, about what I was expecting.  What was exceptional was Patricia in the dining room.  We had her every morning of our week long stay and was always pleasant, more then willing to go the extra to make us comfortable and with a quick smile.  You could really see that she takes pride in the job she does and treats that dining room just as if it were her own.  This is a rare find in an employee these days.  Also I wish I had gotten their names but the two guys who ran the shuttle service while we were there were also very pleasant gentlemen, quick with a smile, helpful and always wishing us a good day.

My family and I had a VERY bad and scary experience at this hotel. We had staff members and people that didn't work at the hotel knock on our door more than once and ask for money at 930 at night! There was no manager on duty. The room was a non-smoking room but smelled terrible. We did not feel safe staying there. When we called to get our money refunded for the two nights we would not stay, they told us they would only refund 1 night because we didn't check out early. HORRIBLE experience, never going back.

The Howard Johnson Hotel & Conference Center in Fullerton, CA, is an extremely nice place to stay.  What it offers and the cost contrast sharply at least with the hotels I've stayed in in Huntington Beach and Long Beach, by far.  The hotel is gracious, decorated beautifully, large pool with cabanas, sculptures, little table settees here and there.  The rooms are large.  Everything is immaculate.  Breakfast, which is free, is more than ample and the coffee, both caffeinated and non-caffeinated, is organic, also free, served in a large, lovely dining area.  The maids are sweet and the young people at the front desk are nice.  I especially enjoy Seaan, who is always smiling and gracious.  I've been to this hotel twice for 4 days each and look forward to staying there when I am in

Our first room we received immediately had a very unpleasant smell upon entering.  We asked staff if we had a smoking room.  They said no.  The room was laid out in an odd way.  You could see markings on the walls where furniture used to be placed but was no longer there.  We asked for a room with two beds and one of our beds was a Murphy bed with the hydraulics all exposed and unsightly.  The lighting was poor. The carpet was filthy. But the worst part was the smell.  It was musty and old smelling.  We called the front and asked to be relocated.  The room they moved us to was a renovated room so it was much better.  In the new room we did not have a hair dryer.  So we called asking for one.  They said they would send us one.  After 45 minutes I had to call again. They then sent
Hard to find the hotel. Would not stay here again. Breakfast buffet was not good. Quality of food choices poor, grounds in coffee and breakfast room was too hot!

Summary Heading: Good value for money with buffet breakfast included
Summary: It was refreshing to stay in the Fullerton area rather than within the tourist cram of Anaheim. We stayed here as it was one of the drop off hotel locations from a tour. This hotel is very well priced for the stay.   Some of the added perks of this hotel was the simple, yet delicious comfort food buffet breakfast, complimentary shuttle to Disneyland, free wi-fi, walking distance to nearby supermarket, restaurants and Best Buys, free parking, and close to the entrance of the freeway.   The rooms were clean and spacious with good tv channels. Reception staff and staff in general were so friendly and accommodating. I did not go swimming but the courtyard and pool looked amazing.   I would recommend this hotel to families, business travelers, couples and friends looking for great

My family and I had a great experiance with the stay. We have had 3 mini vacation the past month and all of our stays have been here. It's nice to wake up to a free breakfast on sight and not have to rush out the door with the kids to find a quick hot breakfast. It would be nice to have more kid friendly meals. Another bonus is to have a free shuttle to Disney and various times to leave and return to the room. On one of our stays we had a nice pool view with a balcony.   The service is quick and friendly, the rooms are nice, bright and most important clean. We have absolutely no complains and will continue to choose this hotel for our future needs. The price is also unbeatable.

Summary Heading: A Good place to base your Disney trip from
Summary: This Howard Johnson facility is located just a few miles from the Disneyland park and offers a complimentary shuttle service.  The drop-off location for the shuttle is on the east side of the park, which makes it a convenient place--much easier than parking yourself, and you save the parking fee.  The hotel itself was not special, but the rooms were clean and well-maintained.  The complimentary breakfast had a good selection of hot and cold items.  The exercise room was acceptable.  We never could find the ice machine, and I think there may not be one.  Finally, the place must have gotten statues on sale.  There are dozens of them all around the property.  If you are a Doctor Who fan, you will find them rather amusing ("Don't blink!"), but otherwise you might think they're a
Manager Response: Video Review Response posted on our main website under the "REVIEWS" section in the upper-right.

Summary: I was really put off by the reviews but because of the prices choose to stay anyway. My family and I stayed here for the 3 days for our trip to Disneyland and were pleasantly surprised! The hotel was very clean and very nice looking and the staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The hotel offered a free shuttle to Disneyland and it was fast and punctual. The pool was open until 10pm and it was very clean. Breakfast was buffet style and free. The only down side was breakfast however. It was the same thing every morning (eggs, sausage, rice, pancakes, watermelon, potatoes, coffee and orange juice) and the potatoes were never fully cooked. But, it was free and filled my family up before we went to Disneyland and saved me a bunch of money so
Manager Response: Video Review Response posted on our main website under the "REVIEWS" section in the upper-right.

Summary Heading: got what I paid for, lesson learned
Summary: I found this hotel for a last minute trip on Bookit.com. I wanted to take my Italian cousins for a quick trip to Disneyland. Where do I start, first of all the rate was great, $69.00 per night on a package which included a Hot breakfast and free parking, shuttle to park. The hotel is located next to what I think is a strip bar, the sign outside said "Hot chicks and cold beer". My husband actually saw a hooker looking for tricks the second night we were there and he went to get gas in the car, nice. The rooms are very old and tired looking and really need a remodel. While the bed was comfortable, the linens were old, dingy and our bedspread had a stain on it. There was a small coffee maker in room but only one bag of coffee, not the two that hotels normally offer, one caffeinated
Manager Response: Video Review Response posted on our main website under the "REVIEWS" section in the upper-right.

Summary: We stayed here for three nights during our visit to Disneyland. The hotel was perfect for what we needed and my children had a great time in the pool. Breakfast was fine, but it was the same everyday.  Eggs,toast,rice,potatoes,pancakes and fruit. My only suggestion would be get rid of the huge lob of community butter and jelly ( it is gross and cant be up to health code) and change the menu up every day or have more prepackaged items.  My other suggestion is they need to FIX THE BROKEN SIDE DOOR.  It is a safety concern to say the least.  All in all I would absolutely recommend this hotel for a visit to the area.  Well priced, shuttle to Disney, and free breakfast made it well worth another stay.
Manager Response: Video Review Response posted on our main website under the "Reviews" section.

Summary: While attending a conference in Fullerton, I stayed 2 nights at the Howard Johnson Inn  on 5/22/12 and 5/23/12.  The price was right, the room was comfortable, and staff were friendly. I did experience some difficulty in finding my room but the issue was resolved once I obtained assistance from staff.
Manager Response: Thanks for the review!  I've posted a video response in the "Reviews" section on our main website.  Just Google, "Howard Johnson Hotel and Conference Center" and it's the top result.

Summary: Overall very pleased with the stay. They were doing a lot of landscape cleanup while we were there trying to make the hotel look nicer. The rooms were clean and we got a great value from Travelocity's Top Secret Hotel. Breakfast was fine and hot; had eggs, potatos, pancakes, juice, coffee, etc.  The loud nightclub that was mentioned was closed down, so I'm not sure if the earlier reviews are correct. Also I would get a room facing the pool as you can definitely hear the freeway on the other side.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but some strange things going on...
Summary: Booked this hotel through Tracelocity's "Top Secret Hotels" for a very good price. I felt like I was getting a great deal before I went, but I don't know if I would ever pay more after being there. The lobby is really nice with old fancy antique looking furniture that is really classy. The rooms are also nice even if they have older tvs. However nice rooms and lobby's don't make everything in a hotel, experiences do and our experience was interesting to say the least. When we got to the hotel it was pretty late at night and I noticed an attached bar that was quite busy. Many of the patrons to this bar we're members of some sort of biker group or gang and were all over the hotel hallways and lobby. Not the friendliest environment if you have small kids, luckily we didn't. The bar
Manager Response: I posted a video review response on our main website blog.

Summary: We stayed last april in this hotel. The rooms were clean and it has a big space the restroom are ok as well the tv in the room are a bit old we stayed in the tower bldg the lift is slow it has only 1lift. The free hot breakfast is good but limited choice and everyday it has the same choice of food. The front desk officer was able to answer my queries. It also has a mini store  in the corner of the lobby the chinese guy was friendly but the store closes around 10or11 pm. Overall the hotel was great will visit again when i come back in fullerton.
Manager Response: I posted a video review response on our main website blog.

Summary: Front desk was very friendly and helpful. Plenty of parking available. Room was a good size and we had a king and queen bed. Housekeeping cleaned every morning and left fresh towels. Only 15 mins from Disney and Target is the next shopping center over. Pool was very warm even at night. Obviously this is not a new hotel so I expected older carpet and furnishings. But I would never give a hotel a bad rating for decor or thin towels. Our needs were met and for a great price. Will be returning next year
Manager Response: I posted a video review response on our main website blog.

Summary Heading: 2nd time Ive stayed here and was pleased again
Summary: 2nd time Ive stayed here with my family.  This time was an improvement.  Carpeting in room was clean.  What I like.... Beautiful Lobby and Gardens, Convient parking,  Convient shopping All kinds of shops very close by.  Pool very warm and nice.  Beds are comfortable,  Staff did a nice job of getting us the room we wanted.  Room was very clean.  Staff did a good job of cleaning room.  This hotel has shampoo, conditioner and lotion available.   Breakfast is still ok its better than other locations around Disney.  But there was a Korean Lady that would yell at many of the guest about breakfast toast.   Although we personally never had a problem would her.  I think she could treat people a little nicer.  The only other problem we had is the shuttle times were cut back futher than
Manager Response: I posted a video review response on our main website blog.

Summary Heading: Convenient Location, Good Value, Great Pool Area
Summary: Just finishing a 3 night business stay in this hotel.  This hotel is very-well located to most major destinations in Orange County, not to mention close proximity to Disneyland.  From the statuary on the property to the marble floors in the lobby, you can tell that this HoJo's was once a very fine (and proud) resort-style property.   It was originally known as the Anaheim Park Hotel and I believe has been some other brands along the way.  Sadly, the current Korean owners are pretty obviously cheapskates who are "milking" the revenue stream and NOT putting much cash back into the property, much less making any improvements.  Somebody should take them to the wood-shed and give them a good read-out on how to be good stewards of what could still be a first-class place.  I own a 100
Manager Response: I posted a video review response on our main website blog.

Summary: Upon walking into the lobby, you can tell this was once a nice property, but, it now truly is a Howard Johnson...buyer beware.  My daughter had purchased her vacation package here, and we decided that we wanted to be close to family, so purchased at the same hotel.  This wouldn't have been my first (or my last pick). The rooms were below average, beds were okay, and the room size was small.  Even though I had four children traveling with me, you think they would have given us adjoining rooms...no, but, they were next to each other on the same floor.  The hotel's web-site indicates there is a restaurant on site -- not. The breakfast, is adequate, but is the same warmed over food day after day.  Now, make sure that you are there before closing time, or you will get a lecture from
Manager Response: I'm sorry to hear about your experience.  Please let us know in advance if you prefer to be on the same floor.  We try to our best to accommodate, but sometimes the room types are not available on the same floor, and it becomes even more difficult when people extend their stays and when we're at peak occupancy.  I have contacted the webmasters to remove the restaurant listing. We're within walking distance to many restaurants, grocery stores, and department stores to help you save even more money for your vacation including the famed In-N-Out.  Pictures of our breakfast can be found on our main website.  I can assure you that we are one of the few hotels that offer a free, hot buffet breakfast.  Pool towels are available at the front desk.  NIGHT CLUB We have a full events staff for our conference center that regularly holds weddings, birthday celebrations, church services, and community strengthening events, such as the Fullerton Mayor's Prayer Breakfast.  I am constantly in search of ways that I can bring value to our local community because I view our hotel's mission to go beyond simple, tourist lodging.  The Night Club has been approved through local, county, and state agencies and has minimal impact toward your safety or noise levels in the rooms since the space for the night club is essentially in a different building than where the lodging rooms are located.  We have adequate security and plan the night carefully to ensure that we remain a beneficial addition to the City of Fullerton and minimize impact toward hotel guests.

Summary: We had called 2 weeks in advance to ask for a top floor room in the new tower.  We had also asked if there was a microvwave and fridge (which they do not and will let you have one if they charge an extra $10each per night).  We asked for the fridge so that the food can be stored and was willing to pay. We arrive late on Sunday evening and the reception who checked us in was going to put us on the third floor on the older tower and we had informed her that we had already made arrangements 2 weeks ago already.  She said nothing was noted and when we further told her that we had spoken to a male person about this, he said everything was fine.  It toke her 5 minutes to read the note before telling us that yes, there was a male that logged into our account, however, nothing was
Manager Response: I appreciate the very thorough and fair review.    I apologize for the mix-up at the front desk.  Pictures of breakfast and video room tours can be found on our main website.  All our rooms are 2 full size beds and we do not have any 2 queen size beds.  If there's any place that states that, please let me know so that I can correct that information.  I urge customers before deciding to go to a hotel closer to Disneyland to consider ALL hidden costs such as: 17% tax rate, resort fees, parking fees, Internet fees, and breakfast costs.  By staying with us, you'll find that we provide the most bang for your buck and can save you almost $80 per night.

Summary: Service was okay. Rooms are small. Hallways need an update, it reminded me of the Haunted Mansion at Disneyland. Traffic from the bar thats in the same parkinglot was annoying. Cops were there a couple times but they didnt bother me so who really cares.

Likes- The room was spacious enough for 2 queen bed. Everything was working well from hot water bath, tv, etc. Nearby, there were food and shopping malls. Staff were friendly and helpful. There were free shuttle bus ride to Disneyland every half an hour. A big Plus Dislike-The decor were old . Need major upgrade.

Small Lift to cater 55 rooms in each floor, Carpets are not clean. Outside sounds come in specially when near the exit door in ground floor. Room is however spacious with Good size Bed, Large space for clothes, Good mirror. Clean bathrrom. TV is the old big one.

I must say, to start with the front desk staff I found to be very helpful right from the start. I arrived over 2hrs prior to check-in. I was greeted by a smiling staff member ready to assist me. Now, if security is one of your main concerns I would say perhaps this is not the place for you. Every side entrance I tried from the outside parking lot did not have a working lock. The rooms were clean as was the bathrooms, however my wife did feel some damp spots on the carpet..not the greatest feeling I suppose? As far as the "complimentary" breakfast I would highly recommend skipping it and eating elsewhere. And now on to the complimentary shuttle service, my family and I used it 4 times since we only stayed 2 days. But the times we did we found it to be convenient, for the

Just leaving the hotel today, I have to give a big thank you. We were staying at another hotel across the street from Disneyland, and though it was convienient, it was terrible. We checked out and stayed at this hotel. By far it was so much better...and less expensive! The rooms were spacious and the beds were clean and VERY comfortable. The staff is helpful, the bar is nice if the adults want to relax. The shower pressure was great, though the tile in the shower should be upgraded. There is room service and breakfast in the morning. I had my own car and checked out before breakfast, but honestly, there is nothing to complain about! I will be back!

Summary Heading: I normally don't review because I'm not picky
Summary: Bed options are two very small full-size beds or one king. Bad for a family of 4+. One 5lb heap of butter everyone shares (or sheds in) for your white-bread toast option. Outside card-entry doors disabled (scary if you don't want just anyone in LA coming to your room). My bathroom never swept for 5 days, nor tub cleaned (soap bar stuck to tub bottom all week); maid left lipstick on our table; previous customer items under our beds; Hotel also only brought a 20 passenger shuttle-style vehicle to pick up some 50 people from the hotel at the closing of the park.  35+ people and tiny kids I counted stranded in the cold with no promise of a return shuttle for an hour! Fried food only for breakfast with 4oz tea cups for coffee, 2 sugar/creamer shakers for 30+ people in line "cafeteria

We have stayed here for the last 5 Christmas holidays.  We have had very good service and found that the staff is very friendly.  We have always found that the rooms are clean and quiet. The shuttle that runs to Disneyland is nice also.  The pool is usually heated all during the year and is very nice to swim in.  The location is good for us because we have family members who live near by. There is plenty of choices for food and shopping in the area.

I just recently stayed at this hotel and at first I was little worried about staying here due to the negative reviews. However, I was impressed.and their is a couple of ways that they could improve and then I would be more than willing to give it a 5 stars.   1) I arrived late on Monday night 9:30 via Orange County Airport. I took the super shuttle from the airport. I would recommend doing that because taxi's is very expensive.   2) At check in, was easy. I am very fortunate that I don't have credit card debt or owns any credit cards. There is a $75 hold they put on your debit card & at check out you will get a refund. There is a sign that says banks usually take one month to return to your checking account. I specifically requested a Tower Room because I read that those are

I visited California from June 30th to July 8th of 2011. It was my first time in California. It has always been a dream of mine to visit the LA area. I had high expectations. This hotel was okay but it wasn't what I had hoped for. When I first got to the hotel I noticed that there were a few noticeable cracks in the wall on the fourth floor. It made me nervous. Right then I knew it was going to be a bad stay. I was scared that the building was not up to par with the new California state building codes for earthquake safety. I couldn't go to sleep that night I was so scared. Everything else was somewhat normal. The food was decent but lacked variety. I really wished I would have stayed elsewhere. It would have made my first stay at California more enjoyable.

Summary Heading: Nice from far, Far from Nice
Summary: We stayed at this hotel during our recent vacation intermittently for 2 weeks. It looks very decent from the website in its pictures and description. Apart from its close proximity to the Disneyland theme parks, the overall service level and amenity is far far far needed for improvement.   Just to name a few flaws we have experienced:  1) The bed covers look like they have never been washed regularly as we could feel the stickiness on its surface.   2) The temperature of the heater/air-conditioner is difficult to adjust.   3) The coffee cups and plastic bag in the ice container are not automatically topped up unless we call the front desk to do so.   4) The elevator in the Tower block broke down once and that is the only one in the building. When we called up the front desk to

if your planning a trip to Disneyland and considering this hotel because of price, pay more and actually go to a good neighbor hotel. unfortunately for us, we found out too late that this property is 5 miles away from disneyland and not the real Howard Johnson Anaheim. thanks to the hotel's "no refunds" policy we were stuck with it. the hotel was better than i expected but that's not saying much after i read all the reviews. first of all there is a bad estate sale going on all over the property of really ugly nude greek/roman life sized statuary, EVERYWHERE ! i don't even know were they got their whole collection but its massive.not to mention the fountains were they placed more statuary inside of! then there is the rooms. we got upgraded to the "better" tower rooms but if those
Manager Response: I apologize for the mix up.  It sounds like we tried our best to accommodate by giving you a free upgrade.  I'd like to point out that you ended up saving over $80 by staying at our hotel.  Here are some of the savings you received compared to the Howard Johnson in Anaheim:  - Much lower rates (we typically charge $90/night whereas the other Howard Johnson routinely charges above $150) - The other Howard Johnson doesn't offer ANY breakfast - Taxes in Anaheim are around 17% whereas for us it's only 10% - We offer a free shuttle to Disneyland.  I recommend for any shopper considering any other hotel, to seriously consider the "hidden" fees associated with your stay.  These "hidden" fees include, Wireless Internet fees, parking fees at Disneyland and the Hotel, resort fees, higher taxes, breakfast charges, etc.  After you consider all these extra expenses commonly found in hotels in Anaheim, I'm confident that you'll see our hotel as the superior value.

Summary: We got a great deal on the HOJO Fullerton.  I checked out the reviews on here and  was terrified (but thought oh well i dont spend that much time in the room anyway) I expected the worst however I was surprised.  We had a good stay.  All of the Hotel employees met most of our request and were pleasant to deal with. Our room was good although I do agree that the carpet in room needed to be cleaned (it has some white crusty spots on it)(I didnt even want to think about what it could be) and there was a very large spider web in the corner.  But it was livable.  The breakfast was good and my daughter was happy.The shuttle to Disney was never crowded and mostly on time we had one nite that the driver showed up 1/2 hour late and I do wish it would have a midnite pick up but it was
We had a nice stay over there...we went to Disney in the free shuttle provided by them..but we personally don't like their breakfast...overall our stay was pleasant...

Stayed two nights there in August. Room was dirty and missing serious maintenance. The hotel seems to have contracts with local travel agencies and you will always find large noisy touring groups flowing in and out and crowded around the lobby.

Summary Heading: Not a bad hotel, food excepted
Summary: The Howard Johnson's clearly used to be another, classier kind of hotel, It's a big place, with an imposing lobby. Now it caters to the tourist trade, including a lot of Asian groups. Service was helpful. The room was clean, though it showed signs of wear -- wallpaper edges peeling upa little, for example. The bathroom, similarly, was clean.
