We had a handicapped room, which meant we had a walk-in tub and a wide bathroom door. Oddly enough, an iron but no hair dryer. We asked at the front desk, and they sent one right down.   It's a few miles from Disneyland, which is a plus. They seem to run buses to and from the park, though we drove ourselves.  The bed was reasonably comfortable -- not a pillowtop, but okay.   Then there's the food. They make a big deal out of the hot

I had read other reviews and I was worried about this hotel.  Our room was great - and the front desk staff was so awesome.  The breakfast left a little to be desired but the free shuttle to Disneyland was great.  They put a schedule when you check-in so you can plan your day accordingly.  I would stay at this hotel again, for the price.  I booked it through Hotwire and was worried when I read the reviews - but was very pleased once we stayed there.

Summary Heading: Believe the reviews..wish we did. Poor Quality
Summary: We had to switch rooms the first try due to wet stinky carpet. Next room was ok but had a moldy smell. That afternoon we were locked out and couldn't get back to our room due to the elevator broken again AND they locked the door to the stairs to get back up! Forget the "free" breakfast buffet! Unbelievable! Flys on the huge clump of margerine (not butter) the bread literally had MOLD on it..the eggs were dry and very poor quality. Rice and peas for breakfast? HUH? The pancakes weren't cooked and had zero flavor. Pretty gross place..do not stay here!

Summary Heading: Smell, Ugly, Terrible Customer Service, new carpets? yeah right...
Summary: After all the negatives reviews we decided to give this hotel a try (October 2011) because the manager tried (here in Tripadvisor) to explain all the time things like "new carpet installed on the first floor" or "compare with other hotels, we have free disneyland shuttle and free breakfast". Well... big disappointment...  Carpet all around the hotel is old, ugly and dirty. I even called months before my reservation to be sure that I was going to receive a room with new carpet (after all the reviews) and the front desk told me on the phone (about a month ago) in a rude way that they can't reserve a room with new carpet and I will get what is available the day of arrival.  So I took the risk and they gave me a room with a terrible carpet and I asked to change the room and front
Manager Response: I apologize for any confusion I stated about the carpets.  I meant the first floor "hallway" carpets and not the first floor rooms.  If you come by now, you'll be able to see our team in the process of replacing some of the carpets in the rooms.  I'm not trying to do a bait and switch on these review responses.  Our main website has video room tours, pictures of our breakfast, shuttle schedules, and just about anything you could want to know about our hotel.  I encourage you to compare our rates with hotels closer to Disneyland.  After you factor in all the hidden fees, the free hot breakfast, the free shuttle, the lower tax rate, etc., you'll find you can save 73% by staying with us.  Details on the breakdown can be found on our main website blog.  We might had been busy that day.  Ask to speak to a manager, Robert, and if you have issues with your room, he may be able to upgrade you for free.  I am quite aware of all the reviews, which is why I've responded to them even in video form, including this one which can be found on our main website blog.

Summary: Thought this was the hotel across from the park..it is not.  Several miles away.  Infrequent shuttle service, had to drive and pay for parking.  Seemed old and dirty and the breakfast made my stomach turn.
Manager Response: I apologize that you confused us with the Howard Johnson across the park.  I'd like to point out that our rates compared to the one in Anaheim are much cheaper, and you probably ended up saving about $50 per night.  In addition, we offer a free hot breakfast, free parking, and a free shuttle.  The hotels in Anaheim don't offer the same free perks we offer and you may be surprised by the hidden fees.  More details on the hidden fees on our main hotel blog.  An example shuttle schedule can be found on our website, or you can call in to confirm the times.  Pictures of our breakfast can be found on our main website along with video room tours.

Summary: Our group of 50 Aussie students, teachers and parents stayed 2 nights at this hotel as part of a tour of the West Coast.  Our tour was arranged by a tour company so we didn't choose the accommodation.  This hotel was awful and inconsistent with the good to very good quality of accommodation elsewhere on tour.  The hallways were dark, dingy, and smelly, the carpet was dirty or stained and the paint work around door frames was chipped.  Not a good first impression.  The lifts were very slow (it's only a four floor hotel).  One of our group had to ask for a new room because there was an overwhelming smell of smoke in the room.  The sheets on my bed were too small for the bed and there were no fridges in the rooms.  My room and particularly my bathroom was not cleaned well after the
Manager Response: Compare our hotel with any hotel near Disneyland that charges higher room rates, higher taxes, doesn't serve breakfast, and has extra hidden fees (including the $14 parking fee at Disneyland).  You'll find that we offer the best bang for your buck.  We just replaced the first floor carpet.  The main building has two elevators in case one of them is slower than you'd like.  With over 200 rooms in the main building there are peak times when any elevator can get overwhelmed.  I apologize for the room that smelled of smoke.  We are a non-smoking hotel that sometimes is ignored by the previous guests.  We do not expect any guests to stay in a room with smoke in it and we can always move you to a better room.  The housekeepers do a full makeover of the room between checkouts and not necessarily if you're staying in the room another night.  If you have a major, unexpected mess, please let the front desk know and our staff can do a full makeover.  If the room next to the freeway is too noisy, you can request a room away from the freeway.  Some people really like the breakfast.  We offer full pictures of the breakfast at our main website.

Summary: Took me 45 mins to check in. There was a large tour group checking in. Front desk staff was very helpful. I was skeptical after reading many reviews but optomistic seeing that most were written in 2010... hoping conditions improved. Sadly disappointed. Hotel lobby was just a tacky front. Once you walk down the hallways, it all sadly goes downhill. The carpeting, windows and walls and baseboards are dirty. The elevators look dangerous and smell. Our FIRST room had filthy carpeting, dirt and markings on the wall of the room and bathroom, burn marks on the furniture. My kids even walked in saying "ewww" because of the mixed odor of old cigarrette smoke, and just. Odor. After moving 3 more times I was finally "upgraded" to a room whose only UPGRADE was newer carpeting and view of
Manager Response: Sorry to hear about the experience!  The traffic at our front desk seems to depend on tour groups, but usually it's pretty quick.  We just changed out all the carpeting in the main hallways.  I'm sorry to hear about your room issues!  They shouldn't have had to move you 3 times before giving you an upgrade.  Or they should've given you a TRUE upgrade into the tower building.  We don't claim to be 3 stars.  We try to offer you the best value for your money, and after taxes and all the hidden fees, I think you'll agree.

Summary: I booked this hotel due to wanting to try a different place other than hotels right accross from Disney.  Our room was kind of strange. Beds were nicely made, and very comfortable.  The bathroom was very old, there was no hot water, only luke warm.  The mirror in the bathroom needed to be replaced and the blowdryer didn't work.  Also, the motion sensor in the bathroom would turn off the lights when you were showering, which was super annoying.  The breakfast was acceptable for free, but we only ate it once, then we needed some other variety.  The second night we stayed, there was a wedding, and we could not find ANYWHERE to park.  The exersize facility was a complete joke, with two eliptical machines and some free weights.  Overall, our room was clean, the area is close to
Manager Response: There should be hot water!  I'm not sure what room you're in, but that's not typical.  Perhaps maintenance would've been able to fix that issue.  The lights are motion sensor, and it's really easy for us to adjust that light.  I'm sorry about the parking issue.  Usually we never have any parking issues.  I'm ashamed of the exercise facility too.  But I like the pool area :]  Thanks for your suggestions and I think after comparing the taxes and all the hidden fees, you'll agree you get a great bang-for-your-buck with our hotel.

Summary: My family of 12 travelled to Anaheim, USA as part of an organised tour and put up 3 nights at this property from 3-5 Sept 2011. Initially I was really worried about our stay after reading all the negative TA reviews but it turned out to be acceptable.  Lobby - Lobby was huge, brightly lit with sofas and a concierge tour desk.  Downside was there was only a small lift servicing the entire block so waiting time can be long esp during peak hours (in the morning or evenings). There's a Wii console and TV which keeps the kids entertained while we wait for our room keys.   Rooms- Rooms were of good size with 2 twin beds, and the connecting rooms proved to be very convenient for families. Some of my family members complained of damp and wet carpet but our room #203 was fine. Beds were
Manager Response: I love reviews from frequent travelers!  They know a good deal when they see one!  Lobby: It's actually a Kinect :]  Rooms: If you have issues with your rooms, we can usually accommodate a move.  Location: And also our free shuttle to Disneyland!  Breakfast: Sorry about the issues with the breakfast.  It can get busy depending on the time, and I'll be working with my kitchen staff to see what we can do to improve breakfast.  Thank you for your extensive review!  I agree, we may not make everyone happy, but if you know what you're getting and the great value compared to those super expensive hotels closer to Disneyland, you'll be a fan!

Summary Heading: This was a lousy place to live and we would never stay here again.
Summary: We booked this place for a two night stay but regretted it and could not cancel due to online booking.  There is no local calling facility and all the payphones in the lobby have been deliberately disabled so that guests end up using the phones in the rooms and getting charged for them. We enquired at the front desk about the above situation but they were not very helpful and recommended that we go outside and use payphones.
Manager Response: Ouch!  Sorry to hear!  You can call toll free from your phone in your room without a charge.  I wish the payphone company would remove those pay phones, but they're refusing to do it!  I'll inform the front desk that you should be able to call toll-free from your rooms.

Summary Heading: Unfriendly staff and grungy hotel - don't bother.
Summary: We stayed here because we thought it would be a good deal - maybe we saved a few dollars, but I would have rather had a hotel that cleaned their carpets once in a decade!  Generally grungy and run down.  Windows in room were covered with fingerprints - ceiling was dirty - carpet was old and buckled up and greasy feeling - bathroom mirror rusty.  Key cards wouldn't stay magnetized for more than one day, and as we were here a week, it was quite a pain to constantly get them replaced.  At least the staff could tell you that you need to remagnetize everyday, so you would be ready for the inconvenience.  In general, the staff were all unfriendly and unprofessional - a smile and a friendly word makes a big difference to someone who is in an unfamiliar place.  Breakfast was okay, but
Manager Response: We have since cleaned all the carpets in the hotel.  If you have issues with the rooms, please let the front desk know and we can move you.  The keycards had issues and we have received a new batch that will hopefully fix the issue.  If we added extra items to the breakfast further than our hot items, we would need to increase the room rates.  I posted pictures of our breakfast on our main website.  It will be difficult to find a hotel that offers a free shuttle and free hot buffet breakfast.  Parking alone in Disneyland is $15.  If you find someplace that is a better value, please let me know.  Check out our main hotel blog for video responses to these reviews.

Summary Heading: Couldn't pay me to stay here again
Summary: Hotel was filthy. Hard to navigate hall way to get to elevator. Highly doubt this place meets ADA standards. Breakfast had little variety and the orange juice smelled of tap water. Hard to navigate layout and staff was rude. Gift shop closes during the day and is supposed to reopen at 4:30 but didn't reopen until after 6:30. If you want a good Disney hotel go play the priceline game - I've gotten 3 1/2 star hotels for $50 a night. This hotel is barely a 2 star hotel.
Manager Response: I apologize your stay wasn't to your satisfaction.  Our breakfast consists of scrambled eggs with sausage, country-fried potatoes, pancakes, fruit, toast, coffee, and juice.  The gift shop is leased out to a separate company.  There is a Sprouts grocery store and Target in the adjacent parking lot that many guests utilize since they typically offer more affordable prices anyway.  If you can let me know which staff member you're referencing, I can address it directly with them.  Thanks again for your feedback.

Summary Heading: WOULDNT STAY IF IT WAS FREE
Summary: Recently was at the hotel for 3 days for an event with my daughter.  Sad to say that this is the 3rd time we have been at the hotel for an event.  Nice sign on the door reads:  Temporarily out of order...  sign has been there for 6 months.   Really?  115 degrees and no AC in the hallways and the ac in the rooms barely worked.  As we  were there for an event, and knew we were headed to the ball room about 15 times within the next 3 days I asked the following questions:  Which floor is this person staying on?  Can I be on the same floor?  Can I be next to the elevator?  Needless to say, 3 rooms later within 20 mins... and a horrible experience with the Customer Service Manger.. really?    Save your money, and find somewhere else to stay!!
Manager Response: It can get hot in the hallways if the doors are left open in the hallways.  The weather in Orange County does not get to 115 degrees.    If there are any issues with your room air conditioning, please let the front desk know and we can usually take care of it.  If not, we can move you to a different room to your satisfaction.  We feel that with our free hot breakfast, free shuttle to Disneyland, and lower 10% tax rate, we offer a great value for your money compared to other hotels in the Disneyland area.  I hope your future events are more successful.

Summary: we stayed her recently for an event with my daughter, Many of our friends stayed as well. First thing checking in , the person at the counter, who happens to be the manager, was hardly understandable. It was 110 degree's outside, yet they refuse to turn AC on in the hall ways of the hotel. Rooms were decent and generally clean, but after the event ,we wanted to relax in the lounge. The person behind the bar did know (seriously) how to make any drinks.  We had to tell him how to mix them. At 9:40 he told us the lounge was going to close, so we asked to get some last drinks, but he refused saying if it took him longer  than the next 15 minutes , his boss did not pay over time. Really? would have taken 5 minutes. So since he kicked us out of the lounge, 15 minutes before closing,
Manager Response: I will be trying to clarify some of the issues that came up in this review:  - Our front desk agents speak fluent English.  If you are having problems understanding any of them due to their accent, please request to speak to a different representative.  - The weather does not get to 110 degrees in Orange County.  It does sometimes get hot in the hallways when the exterior doors are left open while the air conditioning is running.  - The restaurant/lounge is currently under a different management company and is not completely open yet.  I'll bring up your issues to them.  - We do not have a valet staff.  That individual was most likely the bus driver.  We are working on fixing that door.  - Room damages are reviewed on a case by case basis.  After careful consideration, we determined that the guest was responsible for the damage.  - Most billing disputes are ultimately resolved through dialogue.  There are times when a refund is requested by a customer which we can't accommodate.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for.
Summary: The front desk was courteous and check in went well. Upon entering the room it smelled, seemed dirty and there were burns and stains on furniture. I assumed most of the rooms are like this after reading other reviews. I also had to get new keys because they stopped working after one day! That also seems to be a problem with some other guests as well. The location is good for Disneyland visits and getting around but i will definitely pay a little more to stay somewhere nicer next time!!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  The room you had is not typical of the hotel.  We do not expect any guest to settle into a room that is not ready.  If you have any issues with your room, please let the front desk know as soon as possible and we can try and take care of the issue.  Worse case, we can move you to a different room that is to your satisfaction.  There were issues with the key cards, and we believe we have since fixed them.  Give us a chance again, and you will receive a better experience.

Summary Heading: OK, however won't stay here again.
Summary: On the positive side - the beds were comfy and the pool was nice, however the pool side chairs were dirty and stained - not very appealing to sit on.  Breakfast was OK but the same thing every morning and no cereal or milk available.  Lots of shops and restaurants in the area within walking distance.  Staff were friendly and answered our questions.  We stayed at this hotel to go to Disneyland, they did offer a shuttle, which was very prompt (approximately 10 minute drive) however the times for the shuttle were not very convenient.  The last shuttle in the morning was at 11:00 and then the next available one wasn't until 5:00 p.m.  The last one from Disneyland was at 11:15 but the parked closed at 12:00 midnight.  The hotel is old and needs lots of repairs, we had a broken lamp
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback.  The last shuttle for our hotel lasts until after closing.  Due to the constantly fluctuating Disneyland hours, please check with our front desk for the most updated times.  We have pre-printed schedules that tend to get outdated periodically.  The shuttles don't travel in the afternoon in order to provide a break for our drivers and to minimize costs.  A more detailed breakdown of the schedule can be found on our website.  If there are issues with rooms, please let the front desk know and we can send someone to repair any issues you have, and if the issues are major, we can often move you to a different room that's to your satisfaction.  Also, with having 289 rooms, each room tends to have a different quality.  The tower rooms are the newest ones, and cost a little more, and the main building also has quality rooms.  Before checking in, feel free to check out different rooms until you find one to your satisfaction and settle in.

Summary Heading: Horrible experience for families with young children
Summary: In addition to having had to get new room keys 6 times (2 of which while trying to bring in a sleeping toddler from the car) and none of them ever working on the pool, having to have the broken key lock replaced during a very inconvenient time, and having to wait more than half a day for a simple tub plug to be installed so we could give our son a bath, we experienced a less than kid-friendly, substandard breakfast every morning in a very unprofessional dining room, and a hotel staff that, while friendly, was not pro-active in trying to help us with our concerns. The most frightful thing of all was that the crib provided in the room the first night was actually broken and we had to get it replaced the next morning. We are just so disappointed with our stay as it was not the
Manager Response: I apologize to hear your experience wasn't to your satisfaction.  It seems a lot of minor things ended up turning into a large headache.  Thanks again for your feedback.

Summary: Thought this was the Anaheim Howard Johnson but ended up a good choice as it was close the Fullerton mega centre shops which were really good, as well as plenty of places to choose to eat. Most staff were really efficient and friendly (there was one exception on the front desk - blond). We had a great room that was near the pool and could sit outside on the ground floor. Nothing too flash but good value for money, including the cooked daily breakfast. Sausages, scrambled eggs, mini pancakes and maple syrup - not my usual breakfast but I enjoyed it.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  I'm glad to hear that despite the mix-up with locations you were still happy with our hotel.  You pointed out some of our greatest strength - Value.  There are some extra savings you had for staying at our hotel rather than one in Anaheim that is further explained on our hotel blog.  It's possible you saved almost $60/night.  Thanks again for your review.

Summary Heading: Stay Away if cleanliness is important to you
Summary: OK , I usually do not base my choice of hotel on other people comments but in this case I should have. We reserved this hotel because we got a low price, hot breakfast included and free shuttle to Disneyland. You get what you pay for. We went through the main office to reserve and specifically requested to stay in the tower based on the previous reviews. When we got to the hotel, we were told that the price we paid for was not for the tower and there were no availability in the tower. As soon as we got to our room, we wanted to leave (rooms 248 and 250). The carpet was sooooo dirty. I had to wear my flip flops to take a shower because the bottom of the bath was dirty. AC very noisy and didn`t work properly, very humid in the rooms. We stayed away from the hotel as much as
Manager Response: I apologize for the mix up on the reservation.  I'm not exactly sure what may have happened.  For tower rooms, there's typically a higher charge and the rooms are reserved specifically for the individuals who pay specifically for the tower rooms.  If you have any issues with your room, PLEASE let the front desk know.  We have a full staff on duty pretty much all day and evening that can take care of most issues that come up.  In the worse cases, we can usually move you to a different room that will be to your satisfaction.

Summary: If you are looking for a place to just rest up and leave this hotel may be okay.  Hotel room was a bit dirty and no connection to the internet.  The hot breakfast buffet was okay also.
Manager Response: I'm sorry your stay wasn't to your satisfaction.  If you have issues with your room, please let the front desk move you and we can move you to a different room.  If there are issues with your Internet in the room, the lobby should have strong Internet signal and there are also kiosk computers you're welcome to use.  Thanks for your feedback.

Summary Heading: We would definitely stay there again and wouldnt hestitate to recommend it to others
Summary: We booked a last minute trip to Disneyland for our family of 4 (14 year old, and 9 year old).  This was our third trip to Disneyland but our first stay at the Howard Johnson in Fullerton.  After we booked the trip, I went on line and read some of the other reviews posted on Trip Advisor and those reviews made me quite nervous but went ahead as planned.  The hotel lobby and grounds were nicely decorated. I found the rooms to be clean, comfortable and quiet.    The staff weren`t overly helpful as we had a hard time getting a corkscrew and two wine glasses but that was pretty minor.  The pool was very clean and heated with lounge chairs and cabanas around the edges.  The buffet breakfast was definitely real eggs and really yummy sausages, there was also toast, pancakes, rice,
Manager Response: Wow.  Thank you so much for your very in-depth and informative review!  I will be posting this on our hotel blog.  Thank you again.

Summary Heading: Horrible experience from beginning to end!
Summary: Horrible service from the moment you check-in to the moment you check-out. Front desk staff is extremely rude and does not know what customer service should be like. The owner and manager themselves are just as rude, wonder where they get it from? Poor management and poor quality rooms. The only elevator to the rooms does not function properly and takes about 5-10 minutes to come down, considering there is only 5 floors. Elevator stopped while my family and kids were inside for a few minutes, not a pleasant experience. Guests of this hotel don't seem very safe either. Drunk old men and women going around with their shirts off in the middle of the night cursing at people.   Rooms were dirty and housekeeping seems to not understand "Do not disturb" means do not knock and say
Manager Response: I'm sorry to hear about your unpleasant experience.  If you'll let me know names of the employees you're referring to, I can research the matter further.  Thank you.

Summary: We had stayed at this property 5 years ago when it was under another name. It is still one of the best choices for going to Disneyland, Universal Studios and LA tours. Cooked buffet breakfast in the mornings, free shuttes to Disneyland, and other tours available from the hotel as well. It is quiet and in a safe neighborhood, with restaurants within walking distances. The staff is exceptionally nice and helpful. Great value for the money!
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your review!

Summary: I work for a resort in Mesa and know what to expect as a guest and whats to be expected from the staff.  I feel like I got ripped off as there was nicer hotels in the area that I would have much rather stayed at. The rooms were very dirty, small and smelled musty.  The mirrors in the bathroom had huge black stains from top to bottom that were neglected and seeped into the back of the mirror.  Mold and mildew were on the shower and the vanity light above the mirror had a huge amount of rust accumulated.  This is where I'm supposed to take a shower!!    The breakfast was the same everyday and was of cheap quality.  For $61 a night at my resort you get your room and a full breakfast buffet including a daily changing entree  with real eggs, hash browns, bacon and sausage.  We also
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback.  I'm sorry to hear your stay wasn't satisfactory.  Should you ever have issues with the rooms you're in, please let our front desk know as soon as possible.  Often times we can move you to a room that is to your satisfaction or take care of any issues you bring up.  The prices we charge for our hotel are very competitive compared to hotels closer to Disneyland, especially when you consider that we do offer a free, hot breakfast and a free shuttle to Disneyland.  Parking at Disneyland is $14/day and many hotels next to Disneyland only offer only a more limited, continental breakfast.  In addition, in Anaheim, there are often extra hidden fees, including the 17% tax rate, Resort Fees, parking fees, wireless Internet fees, etc.  Pictures of our breakfast can be found on our main website and the eggs we use are freshly cracked every morning.  The gift shop is run by an independent operator and is not managed by the hotel.  I apologize on their behalf for their behavior.  I'll be sure to forward your concerns to the gift shop manager.  Thank you for your feedback, and I hope next time you visit, you'll see the value that we offer for this area.

Summary Heading: Worst hotel I have ever stayed at!!!!
Summary: We were a party of 10 to included grandchildren going to Disneyland for the first time.  I booked this "3-STAR" hotel through AARP Travel/Expedia.  This was not even close to a 3-STAR hotel.  This was perhaps the worst hotel I have ever stayed at and I am 56 years old.  The rooms are small, dirty, and are in dire need of updating.  The "hot breakfast" is a joke.   I am disappointed with AARP and Expedia for listing this hotel as a 3-STAR, a 1 or 1.5 STAR would be more appropriate.  A very horrible experience and because of this, I will NEVER stay at a Howard Johnson Hotel again.....  Don't waste your hard earned money on a BAD experience.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback.  I'm sorry to hear that your stay wasn't to your satisfaction.  Our staff tries hard to ensure you have a quality experience.  If you have issues with your room, please don't hesitate to let our front desk know.  If the issues cannot be resolved, we can usually move you to a different room that may alleviate any issues you're having.  Our breakfast typically consists of sausage, eggs, pancakes, Asian rice, fruit, juices, bread, and coffee.  Thank you again for your feedback.

Summary Heading: Never EVER take valueables to this hotel, EVER!
Summary: My family decided to book a 14 night stay at this hotel (although we only stayed 12 and spend 2 nights in Vegas). The hotel has no safes in its rooms therefore you have to hide any valuables in the room. A member of my family always takes a certain teddy on holiday with them and after 25+ holidays there has been absolutley no problems, we came back one night and was shocked to find that the teddy was not in the place we had left it that morning (Hidden in a secret compartment within a suitcase) after having the room upside down and inside we was still not able to the teddy. The following morning we went down to reception to ask if they knew anything about it, they contacted the house keeping department who checked the laundry just incase but nothing was found, the search
Manager Response: I'm sorry to hear about your missing belongings.  As management, we are shocked to hear about any stolen belongings as our housekeeping staff is very honest and hard working.  Our housekeeping staff is also trained to minimally touch personal belongings to help prevent misplaced items.  We will be sure to contact you should any of the belongings turn up.  Should any guests be causing a disturbance, please let the front desk know and we can ask them to be quiet.  It's possible that the group you saw had come in from a late flight on a bus and were checking in.  Usually, there is not much extended loitering that occurs in the hallways and we do not allow any meetings to occur on property that late at night.  If silence is of concern, I would recommend getting a room in the tower building or asking specifically for a room in the corners of the building where noise will be less of an issue.  I would also like to echo Sarahhh92's comment regarding taking valued personal belongings with you out of the room.  Though our staff is typically very honest (and I've never seen theft from any housekeepers happen in my 4 years in the hotel industry), it's nearly impossible, regardless of which hotel you go to, to prove that a housekeeper or staff was responsible for the theft of any belongings left in the room.  I'm sorry again about the loss of the teddy and I hope your future holidays are more enjoyable than the last.

Summary Heading: Very satisfied and will stay again!
Summary: Couldn't wait to get back home to write this review.  I know people like you and I appreciate these comments as we plan our trips.  We also were very skeptical, but needed a place close by Disneyland.  The price was what attracted us so we took a chance.  Our stay turned out to be very pleasant and satisfying.  Everything was just right but with a few minor things.  We stayed for 3 nights.  Service was great from the beginning, staff was very friendly.  Rooms were clean.  The only concern I had was the carpet.  It wasn't 100% new and not sure when the last time it was deep cleaned.  But it didn't bother us so much.  Beds were very comfortable.  My family and I slept great.  My husband also enjoyed getting a nice workout in the onsite gym, although he felt the equipment was quite
Manager Response: Thank you for your review!  I'm glad to hear you had a great stay.  We try to deep clean the carpets on a regular basis.  We have newer carpets in the Tower building and select rooms in the main building.  You may be able to special request a room with newer carpets prior to check-in.    The extra pool towels can be found at the front desk upon request.  Thanks again for your review!

Summary: We had a 10 night stay at this hotel from March 28- April 7. Loved it!  We had been to the hotel when it was under a different name 2 years ago, and were pleased to see everything was still great, if not improved from then. Checked in early and were given a great room with balcony  facing the pool/courtyard. Very spacious and well maintained. Beds were comfy, although we prefer queens as to doubles. Bedding was excellent, nice douvets. The breakfast buffet was really good, and free. You cannot beat the value. Shuttle to Disneyland ran hourly  4 times in the AM, and 5 times in the PM, with a break between 11 and 5. This hotel has one of the best pool areas we have stayed at. Cabanas and loungers, with many places to sit out and relax. Pool is clean and warm. Lobby and restaurant
Manager Response: Thank you for your detailed review!  I'm sure many future travelers will find it very helpful.  I'll be sure to let Eden and Efrain know about the shout outs you give them.

Summary: The 5th annual Orange County Marble Show was held at Howard Johnson's Hotel in Fullerton.  The staff was VERY nice to work with in helping me make my event successful.  I look forward to the 2012 marble show being held there.
Manager Response: I'm glad to hear that we were helpful to you for the event.  I'll be sure to pass this on to our event coordinator.  Thanks for your review!

Summary: I was a little afraid by all the bad experiences, but I was willing to give it a try. I realy enjoyed my one week stay here. Amado great guy, and the severs at Twin Palms trying their best during the rush breakfast. The breakfast was great value and was great. Overall the rooms were comfortable a few issues working alarm clock and no directory for services.All staff were friendly and helpful.  The decor did not bother me. Money saved meant that more money spent in the area which I did.
Manager Response: Fear not my good people!  Thank you for your reviews and be prepared to be pleasantly surprised by the value we bring you.  I'll let Amado know he has another fan!  Our savings are more than just a shuttle and free breakfast: we only charge a 10% tax whereas if you stay in the City of Anaheim, they will charge as high as 17%.  Plus parking at Disneyland is about $14.

Summary: Read some of the reviews before we went, and I was a little nervous.  Ended up being a pretty nice place.  Decor is tacky, but our room was lovely, cozy and clean.  We stayed in the "tower" which is the newer area, so I can't speak for the older area of the hotel.  Looked a little yucky.  But, the shuttle to Disney was great.  Service from the shuttle driver Amando was AWESOME!  He's a great guy, and he was very helpful getting us information for other tours we wanted to go on.  Service at front desk was hit or miss, depending on the "ray of sunshine" you were dealing with.  Overall, was a nice, affordable place to stay.
Manager Response: I'm glad you chose to write a review describing your positive experience at the hotel.  I look forward to the day when people aren't so nervous from reading the past reviews!  TOWER BUILDING The bedding is the same in the "tower" and in the main building.  The tower was constructed more recently than the main building.  DECOR Our hotel has a Mediterranean theme that you can check out on the pictures of our main website, and we have an interactive Karaoke show in the restaurant Monday - Saturday nights.  SHUTTLE I'll let Amado know about your complements.  FRONT DESK I'll let my front desk staff know that the Internet is watching their behavior.  Thanks again for your input, and I hope you had a great vacation!

Summary Heading: Friendly, clean, and a great bargain.
Summary: I was wary of staying in this hotel because of the negative reviews I'd read online, but it was the closest hotel we could find to Disneyland that we could afford.  I was afraid we were going to be in a horrible neighborhood and I'd be fearing for my kids' lives, but we were pleasantly surprised at how nice it all was.  There was a hot breakfast included in the room (which was worth at least $50 for the 5 of us right there).  Everything was clean, the pool was great (nice and warm on a chilly evening!), the rooms were much nicer than expected and I think the beds were just about the most comfortable I've ever slept in.  The lobby and restaurant decor is kitschy and over the top, but that just made it even more fun!  Small complaints include slow restaurant service (they were
Manager Response: Thank you for writing your positive review!  I hope that more people will write positive or even average reviews so that people get a better understanding of what our hotel is actually like.  BREAKFAST I'm glad you see our hotel as a great value!  That's exactly what we're aiming for and the hot breakfast buffet that we included in this value.  BEDDING All beds have extra padding in the form of a washable mattress protector and extra sheets which adds to the comfort.  DECOR I hope you had a chance to try out the Kinect in the lobby.  That was my personal touch.  The restaurant decor is over the top with the personal taste of the owner.  This matches the interactive Karaoke show that occurs every night except Sunday in the restaurant.  RESTAURANT I'll be sure to let the restaurant manager know about the slow service you had.   SHUTTLE Please call the hotel front desk and they can explain the shuttle schedule to you as our drivers take a break in the middle of the day in order to minimize gas usage during the slowest times when only a few people need to come back or go to Disneyland.  We are able to pass on the savings we gain from the shuttle schedule to your low room rates.  Thanks again for your review and I hope you had a great vacation!

Summary: I stayed in Fullerton because everything near Disneyland was booked. This hotel had free breakfast which was nice, free internet to guests, and free parking. The room was good in the sense that it was a room and I could sleep in it but the cleanliness of my room wasn't as great as it could of been. The staff was helpful. A decent hotel for the price.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and feedback.  Should there be any issues with your room, please let our front desk know immediately so we can take care of the situation, and at worst, move you to a different room if the situation cannot be fixed.  We try and focus on offering guests the most service while at the same time minimizing costs in order to pass on the savings to your room rates.  That's why you'll see that our rates are very competitive, while at the same we can offer many extra services you can't find at other hotels.

Summary Heading: Stay here if you want to be robbed at gun point.
Summary: We decided to try out Travelocity's 'Top Secret Hotels' we found out we would be staying at the Howard Johnson in Fullerton CA for our Disneyland stay.  I immediately looked up the hotel and read reviews on the hotel.  We were worried because about 95% of reviews I could find on this hotel were terrible.  I know Travelocity is a very reputable company and also typically we aren't too picky when it comes to hotel stays as long as we're not going to get robbed, or our car broken into and we have a clean bed and bathroom to use.  Unfortunately the Howard Johnson (formerly the Anaheim Park Hotel) couldn't meet even those low standards.  The first night of our stay we were coming back to our room and my boyfriend got robbed in the parking lot of the Howard Johnson.  They got off with
Manager Response: I apologize about the theft that occurred.  It can be a very frightening experience.  We have a regular security guard that patrols the hotel and parking lot every night.    I can assure you that our specific location is typically a very safe environment with our main guests being families going to Disneyland.  In fact, you can review our crime stats with a map on the City of Fullerton website and you will see that our crime is very low.  More specifically, the City of Fullerton has half the number of violent crimes in comparison to the national levels.  If you have any further questions regarding this, feel free to contact me directly by calling the front desk and asking to speak to me.

Summary: I am writing this to save toehr people from unfortunatley booking their stay at this hotel. Please don't it is horrible, service is bad. It is too far from the park with a shuttle which operates only every hour and stops between 11 and 5. Breakfast  don't ev en bother out of the 6 days I ate it once, and woudl rather starve, it was shocking. Tasteless and horrible, no variety, jsut the worst I have experienced. I wish I had of  rebooked somewhere closer to the park and much much nicer. Plerase do nto stay here.The one time we ate at the restaraunt they charged us a sercice fee, which wasn't worth paying just awful.
Manager Response: I apologize your stay wasn't satisfactory.  BREAKFAST I'm not sure if you're referencing the free old breakfast or the free new breakfast.  We heard a lot of complaints about the old breakfast, so we upgraded it to now be a hot buffet  including sausage/bacon, eggs, teriyaki rice, pancakes/toast, fruit, bread, coffee, and juices.  You never should be charged a "service fee" for the free breakfast.  If so, please let me know.  BUSES It is true that our drivers take a break during mid-day to take lunches and to minimize the gas consumption when there are few people who want to return back to the hotel.  Our bus runs on regular intervals throughout the morning and closing time of Disneyland.  The drive distance is about 10 minutes each way.  You can get more details on the exact schedule by calling the hotel.

Summary Heading: We had our wedding there and everthing was great!
Summary: This is an older hotel.  The rooms have been renovated though.  Looks like they are going through a name change right now to Howard Johnson's, but the owner has not changed.  The staff is professional.  They did everything right.
Manager Response: I'm glad to hear you had a pleasant stay.  We have converted to the Howard Johnson brand and regularly have weddings, banquets, and events at our conference center on property.  INSIDERS TIP: The tower building is generally more quiet, and has newer carpet.

Summary: i went to this hotel with a tour, and after what i read in trip advisor, i was more than scared  at the end, the room was clean and quiet, and with sufficient size, the beds were comfortable, there was a coffee maker and the batroom was acceptable  there are quite a lot of places for dinner five minutes walking from the hotel as i would not have dinner at the hotel  i did not try the famous "free breakfast"  i checked the price for a room and saw it is offered in 50 usdollars. for this price, the hotel is ok
Manager Response: I agree that the past reviews are a little scary.  Based off of the reviews, we have upgraded the breakfast to be a free hot buffet.    We try to offer customers the best value, and a lot of the savings comes from not having to pay the daily parking $15 fee at Disneyland, and the 17% tax rate in Anaheim!  INSIDER TIP: If you want to eat dinner nearby on the cheap, there's the world famous "In-N-Out" burger place which is a favorite for locals.  Many budget travelers also find that the grocery store and Target in the adjacent parking lot to be very convenient to help save even more on their family vacation.

Summary Heading: Good value with hotel pool and clean room.
Summary: We enjoyed having a place to crash while taking in Disneyland.  The receiving front end staff was kind.  The breakfast was nothing to write home about so we decided to skip it a few times and go to the IHOP nearby.  Shuttles were scheduled and crowded but got us to the park.  Overall the room was clean and the linens were new.  The pool was great as it was so hot that we needed to cool down.  Close to some shopping.  Free Parking and Shuttle made it good value.  Next time I might get closer to the park and just walk :) Free internet in the lobby.
Manager Response: I'm very happy you saw as a good value.  We try to offer customers the best value, and a lot of the savings comes from not having to pay the daily parking $15 fee at Disneyland, and the 17% tax rate in Anaheim!  We have since upgraded the breakfast to a hot buffet.  INSIDERS TIP: There's a grocery store and Target in the adjacent parking lot to help you save some extra money when you're staying at the hotel.

Summary Heading: NOT WHAT ITS CRACKED UP TO BE !!!
Summary: We booked  5 rooms as we were in town for a weddng. The lobby is BEAUTIFUL!!!  The rooms were not very...clean. Carpets dirty..curtains/shears very dusty..pleats at top of curtains covered in dust.  Smelled of cleaner (like nil odor) in some. Upon arrival found out that a fridge is an extra charge, a microwave is another extra charge ,internet in your room is another extra charge seems that they were around $10.00 ea.  They have internet in the lobby (2) computers , of which 1 was downfor 1 day and can only use for 15 min at a time. Took at least up to 2 min to sign on so not much time. You can use your lap top in the lobby for free. Breakfast was the same every morning...pretty boring after 7 days.

Summary Heading: Dirty dirty -Your clean sheets and towels are dropped on the dirty floor before being put in your room.
Summary: As soon as I booked the hotel I tried to cancel the reservation, the hotel refused to let me out of my nights stay.         Their "free" shuttle driver had us wait 45 minutes to leave to go to Disneyland because he was helping a man from Japan, while the two girls behind the counter could have helped him but they chose not to.         The hotel has three shuttle busses but chooses to only use 1 to save money. Don't try to return to the hotel between noon and 6, there aren't any busses returning at that time.          When we did get back to the hotel I tried to check in, their computers were down for an hour so we couldn't check in.  I finally called the company I booked with and they faxed over a copy of my booking.  After about an 1 1/2 hours I was finally checked in.  Mind

I stayed in this hotel with my boyfriend just to see Disneyland with not very high expectations because it was cheap and we were'nt going to be spending anytime there expect for sleeping. But it was TERRIBLE! When we first approached the front desk in the tacky faux italian looking lobby. The receptionist didnt even look at us, just kept on talking to the other reception girls about her hair. Then once we tried to check in giving BOTH of our names she said we did not have a reservation but did not help in anyway to sort out this predicament. After 10-15 minutes she asked my name and said it was under my name and that it was my fault for not giving it to her in the first place. Not a great start. Our room was ookay. Brown stains on the carpet and a dead bird on our patio. We had

Summary Heading: Only if you're on a budget
Summary: It really depends on what the purpose of your stay is. Hotel was clean-ish, beds were alright and toilet acceptable. Just a tiny bit run down. I wouldn't really recommend the Fullerton area, would never walk alone outside of the hotel all by myself or after dark. But do stay here only if you're on a budget.

I will never stay at this hotel again bottom line. We stayed a total of 2wks here, 1wk in the 'towers' which is your best bet if you had to stay here..its cleaner & looks nicer & for $40/night extra you get a balcony room. For $20/night you can get a tiny fridge & microwave. The room we stayed in was beyond nasty!! It smelled like dope & ciggerette smoke in the halls & room. There were little holes in the walls, the cheap wallpaper was stained & the paint & caulking had a yellow tint. The carpet is FILTHY. The desks had a grimey feel to them & the smoke detector was old & hanging from the ceiling. The window didn't latch all the way. The toilet barely flushed. No batteries in remote. The maids kept attempting to enter our room multiple times in one day despite the DO NOT DISTURB

Summary Heading: Sticky Hotel .. I do not recommend
Summary: The good thing is that Thanks God I only booked one night at this hotel,,, everything was dirty and sticky.. not to mention when you have to go for breakfast.. NO GOOD!!!.. Don't get impressed by the only picture posted.

This hotel is under new management and it's getting run down. My family and I could not believe the service in the resturant with their bad food. I asked for the manager and he had the poorsest people skills ever, so I asked for a manager higher than him which he never went to get. I finally went to the front desk and asked for a manager and the owner Kim came down to my disappointment. Kim was the lady I saw chasing down a customer out of the resturant saying " You Can't Take Food Out!!, You Can't Take Food Out!!,". She literally chased her down. So when I saw who the owner was I knew her lack of professionalism I was not getting anywhere. I gave her a chace and I was correct about that. The carpets are dirty so don't walk in the room barefoot.They mentioned a lounge but they
Manager Response: I apologize your stay wasn‚Äôt to your satisfaction.    The owner has broken English and may not have the most polished presentation.  I can assure you that her intentions are to bring all our guests the best value for the pricing of the hotel and one of the ways she demonstrates this is by personally being present almost every day in the breakfast room.  In order to control costs and pass the savings to our guests, one of our posted policies at the entrance is to keep the plated food in the restaurant.  Unlike many other hotels, our breakfast utilizes porcelain plates rather than plastic or paper, and we want to limit any sort of ants that may enter the rooms if too much food is present.  I agree this may seem tacky, however, our underlying intention is to save every penny in order to pass the savings to our guests.   Since acquiring the hotel in March, the owner has been personally involved in obtaining a liquor license.  Due to California law, it is not automatic that a transfer of ownership means a transfer of a liquor license and often times a new license takes many months to get through the California Department of Alcoholic Beverage Control (ABC).  Currently, our license status is ‚ÄúISSUPD‚Äù which means that the issuance of the license is pending.  We are awaiting for the ‚ÄúACTIVE‚Äù status.  You can see the latest status of our license by looking up our license number, 489273, on the ABC website.

Summary: I stayed at this hotel with my fiance last year around the same time, I loved it b/c at that time the staff were friendly, the food was great and the free shuttle was convenient BUT as of this year, I totally have a very different opinion. The staff weren't as friendly as before, the free breakfast was horrible..tasted like they bought the ingredients at a 99 cent store and just reheated it, the shuttle didn't run as often so we were often stuck at the hotel, the room didn't feel as clean as before and all around was a totally unsatisfying experience. I won't be coming back, sorry.
Manager Response: I apologize to hear that your experience wasn‚Äôt satisfactory.    The shuttle service is provided from the morning hours and evening hours.  From about 10:00 AM ‚Äì 6PM, shuttle service is typically not provided in order to cut costs.  These cost saving measures are intended to serve most people‚Äôs needs and allows us to pass on the savings to our guests.   The hot breakfast pictures can be seen on our website and began as a free amenity beginning in May 2010.  Prior to that, breakfast was only offered as an extra cost in our restaurant.  For $3.00 more, the breakfast can be upgraded to a buffet that offers much more selection than the standard breakfast.

Summary Heading: Horrible experience. Stupid to have stairs and ramp to get to elevator.
Summary: My mother tripped and fell on the stairs and ramp on the way to the elevator. The signs were not noticable. Bottom line..there should be a rail in between the stairs and ramp.  Very disappointed in the service and the upkeep in the rooms. Clock didn't work, cable went out, room binder was empty. Pool towels were ghetto. Room smelled. Room next to traffic was noisy. Overall disappointed in the whole experience.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback.  Please let the front desk know if you have any problems with the room and we can typically take care of any issues.  Worst case scenario, we can typically move you to a different room that is to your satisfaction, such as a room away from the traffic.   The pool towels have a promotional image of a music band that the owner was able to purchase at a large discount.  The savings on the towels are ultimately passed onto customers in lower room rates while not negatively impacting the quality of stay for the majority of guests.

Summary Heading: Stay here only if you're on a budget
Summary: We came to this hotel because we wanted to go to Disneyland.   We stayed here on 8/3-8/7/2010.    This is an older hotel. The lobby looks nice.  There's free parking and free wireless internet in the lobby but not in your room.  You have to pay about $10/day for wireless internet in your room.  There are 2 public computers in the lobby that you can use to check your emails and surf the web for free.  The computers are not attached to a printer.  If you want a computer with a printer, I think you can rent their ONE computer in the "business center".    We have 2 adults and 2 kids and we paid approximately $76/day for a room with 2 double beds.  Including tax, a four night (Tue-Fri) stay cost approximately $336.  The room looks nice but the carpet looks dark (it's probably dirty).

This is an older hotel. The lobby is really nice but the hotel has a weird smell. They offer a free breakfast but it is so not worth it. The eggs taste like they are powdered eggs, a watermelon slice, really bad fried potatoes and pancakes that taste like they were cooked on the outside but powdered batter in the center. The coffee tastes like they used toilet water to make coffee.  If you want a "better breakfast" you can pay for the all you can eat buffet. I wouldn't waste my money on that. We stayed here to be able to save a little money on not having to breakfast out but ended up eating out after the first day because it was so horrible. The beds were comfortable, the carpet felt dirty.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing our hotel for your stay. Our staff and management are dedicated to  making your stay as perfect and as enjoyable as possible.   I would like to address the concerns you had about our food quality.  We use fresh liquid eggs that have been premixed, not powdered. They are cooked fresh every half hour. Our pancakes are made with a premixed buttermilk batter, not  powdered. We use fresh cut potatoes that are cooked fresh daily. We use organic coffee grounds that are brewed fresh every half hour. It may taste strange, at first, to some people who are not familiar with it.  Thanks for your feedback.

Summary: Bookit.com failed me. The only thing worth your while at this "hotel"  is the shuttle TO Disneyland. The shuttle back is a completely different story. The bus driver was too lazy to make a second trip back so he had us stand up in the aisle. Totally illegal and not safe at all. 45 minutes later we arrived...this place is only 6 miles away!!  At the front desk, there was only 1 female worker on the phone attempting to book two rooms with two different credit cards. I waited patiently for 10 minutes as she attempted to make the1st reservation;40 minutes later you would think she would have booked the entire hotel but no she had just got one room booked. Common courtesy and customer service would have been to have place the caller on hold and serviced me the LIVE customer who had

pros: they will provide transportation to disneyland. beds are comfortable. swimming pool. rooms are quiet.  cons: no wireless internet in the room. they will tell you that you are allowed to get one hot plate per person at breakfast. stained on chair in the room.  overall if you are not going to spend a lot of time in the hotel this place is a good deal for what you pay.

NEVER stay at this hotel! My friends and i stayed there 3 nights and all three were bad. First night hotel was loud but not too annoying but then we woke up and found BED BUGS! Totally unacceptable! Then we told the staff and they seemed so nonchalant about it almost like they see this all the time. They then transferred us to another room which had a broken bed. They said they would call after they spoke to the managers and owners and etc. they never did. Then we finally got another room that was fine. It is torturous to fall asleep or stay asleep when every itch freaks you out. I was uncomfortable the entire stay. On top of that we should have had both rooms comped for the entire stay because of these issues but they  only comped one night for one room. I guess they cherry on

Summary Heading: O' HECK NO!!  We will not go back nor recommend this hotel to anyone
Summary: As many othes, we booked on line based on reviews and location.   When we checked in, we were excited to be there, looked so nice in the lobby and the family was going to go to Disneyland!!  Who wouldnt be happy??   The service at the counter was very average, and lacking in information.   We arrived to our rooms ( 2 rooms for 8 guests) to find them very dark and musty smelling.  Opening the drapes and turning on the air conditioner worked well, till night came and the 2 small lamps in each room wasnt even bright enough to read in.  When asking one of the maids where the ice machine was, she said on the fist floor...we were on the 4th floor.  Funny thing is, after the 2nd day we discovered by accident that there was an ice machine right next to our room!!  The beds were
Manager Response: I would like to thank you for posting your concerns about your stay so that we can work to improve our service.  Lighting - We are working with maintenance to brighten our rooms up a bit.  Breakfast - The free hot breakfast is for 2 adults per room. There is an additional charge for any additional adults and for children over the age of 10. We have talked to the kitchen staff about the state of the food and improvements will be made.  Internet service - The free internet service is only available in our lobby. We are currently working to make it available for in all guest rooms.  Shuttle driver - We have spoken with the Shuttle driver about his conduct and he has been issued a strict warning to improve his driving habits.

Summary Heading: Reasonable price, pathetic free breakfast, will not be back
Summary: We booked on line based on reviews and location. The lobby is very nice, ....it ends there.  As noted in other reviews the rooms are dated, .....very dated.  Yes they are fairly clean, and the staff seems to be trying hard, but its time for a full reno.    We booked with Expedia, and received notice that the breakfast buffet was included with the room. We booked 2 rooms for 4 nights, 8 guests in total.   After we checked in, we were informed it would be a plated breakfast for the adults only, kids under 3 eat free, kids 4-17 need to purchase separate meals. When we objected , the front desk referred us to the dining room manager, who referred us to the front desk.  Every morning we had to retell the whole story and show them our Expedia confirmation.  Every morning they

well i stayed at this hotel when it was called wyndam...in 2008..every year my little daughter compets in the california tropic pagents at the marriot by the convention center and there prices are to high......so i stayed 5 miles away which is nothing to travel and i stayed here for 65 dollars a nite what a steal...i stayed in the towers which has its own balcony and the beds are soooooo comfortable .....its very clean and i love the marble lobby and cant beat the free stuttle....wow..i had a great time and we have been coming back since every year since 2008 every september in finals for california tropics...and i cant forget larrys pizza ....wow delicious its near by the hotel ....the best pizza ever...
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your review. We are really glad you enjoyed your stay!

Summary Heading: This was a good place to stay while visiting Disneyland.
Summary: Our AAA office booked this hotel for us as we were on our way out of town on a spur of the moment trip to see Disneyland. The hotel was friendly and clean, and the price was more than reasonable at $69 per night.They had a free Hot breakfast for us every morning served buffet style with lots of clean tables and plenty to eat. They offered food to order as well as the buffet for a fee and had a short menu for lunch. The location was about 6 miles away but a straight shot to Disneyland parking and they offered a shuttle to take us and also pick us up in the evening, which saved the $15 parking fee. The hotel rooms were large and clean and the pool was in a lovely setting. They also offered a nice exercise room which we did not use after our 2 days at Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thanks for your review. We are so glad you enjoyed your stay at our hotel. We welcome you back any time.

Summary: Chairs in room had stains on them; furniture was beat up; TV had terrible reception couldn't even watch it and if I did want to watch, there was no remote; one of the two elevators was always down; no ice in the ice machines; no free wi-fi; stayed there for a week and it was the noisiest hotel ever. Decor very out dated and tacky from the 80s; hallway carpets had bleach stains all over them. would never stay there again. Not worth the money
Manager Response: I apologize to hear about your experience.  I'll try and address specific issues here.  OWNERSHIP CHANGE As of March 18, 2010, we obtained ownership of the hotel, so we're working hard on addressing the short comings of the property.  FURNITURE CONDITION There were  major renovations to the rooms as of 2005 when the hotel was a Wyndham.  I'd have to see the specific room regarding the condition of the furniture.  TV RECEPTION It may have been a particular room that had problems.  Any issues can typically be resolved easily by notifying the front desk.  Worse case scenario we usually are able to accommodate a room change or even free upgrade.  ELEVATOR PROBLEMS One of the elevators was down for extensive, emergency maintenance.  I apologize for the inconvenience.  NO ICE I'll talk to my maintenance staff about checking all the ice machines for any problems.  NO FREE WI-FI The free wi-fi is limited to the lobby along with free computers you can use with Internet.  I'm currently working with AT&T about getting free wi-fi to the rest of the rooms.  NOISE If there are particular noisy rooms, we can get that addressed by letting the front desk know.  SIDE TIP: a room in the "tower building" is typically the quietest.  Also, if you're sensitive to noise, please let the front desk know at the time of check in and we can move you rooms.  Thanks again for your feedback and please let the front desk know of any problems during your stay and we can usually take care of most issues.

Summary: We stayed here in June 2010. The only complaint I have is the tv channels sucked. There was really nothing on tv when we came back in the evening. Also, they advertise free wireless internet, but that is not in your room. I thought that was a bit of false advertising. Other than those 2 issues, no complaints on the room or cleanliness or staff. Nothing was excellent, but it also wasn't bad. When we booked, they offered free hot breakfasts so that was nice. Also, parking is free. I'd stay again because it was a good price for the area. If you have AAA, you get a discount so use that.

I visited this hotel during my visit to LA. We have chosen this place because our bus tour had this hotel as one of the pick up point. We stayed there for two days, overall experience was good.  Staff was friendly and agile. We wanted to leave car baby seat for couple of days at the hotel as we had plan to return to the same hotel later, they kept it with full care.   They do provide free internet in the room but for some reason we could not connect to wifi due to laptop problem, we were disappointed to know that there is no free computer there to be used in that situation.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  We are currently working on getting free Internet in the rooms.  In about late March or early April, I installed free Internet in the lobby and installed two kiosk computers, so the next time you come out, you should be able to use those for free.  Thanks again!

Summary Heading: The hotel service and rooms were GREAT
Summary: Dear Robin Wright, I just wanted you to know that I enjoyed my visit at the hotel. Everyone was helpful and polite‚Ä¶please let the staff know that I was very pleased!!! Also, I loved my room and the patio was great. Thanks for all of your help! Everything went very smoothly!!!

Summary Heading: I highly recommend Anaheim Park Hotel to all my family, friends and business contacts
Summary: I've traveled alot for leisure and business and my hotel accomendations are always the most important part of the trip. It's hard to have to choose between comfort and cost when you're on a budget and when it comes down to it, comfort which includes cleanliness and quality takes priority. At Anaheim Park Hotel, not only have i experienced cleanliness and quality but I've also found it to be very reasonably priced.  Just entering the lobby area for check in gives a feeling of comfort and luxury.  It is a very nice hotel. I've received great friendly service everytime I've been a guest.  It is right off the freeway with easy access to many shops and restaurants including a grocery store.  It's less than 10 minutes away from major Orange County tourist attractions.    The pool area

This has got to be the most god awful place I have ever been. I got a deal on a discount site, and folks, you get what you pay for. The service was terrible, they have a pathetic excuse for a Disneyland tram, as the bus rarely runs, the walls are paper thin, and the place is busy and noisy night and day. My husband and I got no sleep and were miserable at Disneyland the next day. We didn't get to the hotel until around 2:30am, and we weren't planning on getting to Disneyland first thing in the morning, but we decided to go ahead and go because there was a choir group there at the same time we were, that started vocalizing at 7am. Not that we got any sleep before they started in. Our trip was completely ruined. And as if that wasn't bad enough, they charged $75 to my bank card
